original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang dngos po yod pa'i mtshan ma blang zhing dmigs su med pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang dngos po yod pa'i mtshan ma blang zhing dmigs su med pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the essential nature of non-entity is so called because the signs of non-entity and the entity that exists are not apprehended or observed.

original: gzhan yang kha cig na re 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i chos stong pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig na re 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i chos stong pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, some say that the emptiness of past and future phenomena is called the emptiness of non-entity.

original: da ltar dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos stong pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po yod pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos stong pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po yod pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of present and unconditioned phenomena is called the emptiness of existent entity.

original: de gnyi ga yang stong pa'i phyir ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa @189b nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang stong pa'i phyir ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa @189b nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Because both of those are empty, it is called the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entity.

original: gzhan yang kha cig na re 'dus ma byas kyi chos la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig na re 'dus ma byas kyi chos la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, some say that the non-arising, non-abiding, and non-ceasing of unconditioned phenomena is called the emptiness of non-entity.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po yod pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po yod pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That which is conditioned, having arising, enduring, and ceasing, is called the emptiness of the existence of things.

original: de gnyi ga yang stong pa'i phyir ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang stong pa'i phyir ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Since both of those are empty, it is called the emptiness of the essential nature of non-things.

original: don dam pa ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The ultimate is called the characteristic of the reality of phenomena.

original: 'jig pa dang nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig pa dang nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang stong pa nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of the reality of phenomena is also emptiness, because it does not disintegrate and does not deteriorate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: len pa med pa dang mngon par zhen pa med ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: len pa med pa dang mngon par zhen pa med ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it is without appropriation and without attachment.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in that very text.

original: mdo 'di las stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar gsungs pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: mdo 'di las stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar gsungs pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: In this sutra, the statement that the signs of emptiness are eliminated has three explanations.

original: kha cig na re mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma snga ma gnyis rnam par 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig na re mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma snga ma gnyis rnam par 'jig par byed do //
translated: Some believe that the emptiness of what transcends limits causes the two former signs to be annihilated.

original: dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par byed do //
translated: The emptiness of non-existence causes the sign of mere representation to be annihilated.

original: don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyis ni don dam pa'i mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i stong pa nyid kyis ni don dam pa'i mtshan ma rnam par 'jig par byed do zhe'o //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate causes the sign of the ultimate to be annihilated.

original: kha cig na re mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma snga ma gnyis rnam par 'jig par byed do //🔽rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: kha cig na re mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma snga ma gnyis rnam par 'jig par byed do // rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: Some believe that the emptiness of what transcends limits causes the two former signs to be annihilated.🔽The adherence to the sign of mere representation is eliminated by the emptiness of non-existence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la don dam pa stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la don dam pa stong pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: The sign of the adherence to the emptiness of the ultimate in regard to the other-dependent is eliminated by the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: yongs su grub pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhe'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa nyid du mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhe'o //
translated: The conception of the perfected as real is eliminated by the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: kha cig na re go rims bzhin du snga ma'i mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi rnam par sel bar byed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re go rims bzhin du snga ma'i mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi rnam par sel bar byed de /
translated: Some say that, in order, it eliminates the four kinds of signs of the former.

original: des na bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni kun kyang mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
analyzed: des na bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni kun kyang mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to //
translated: Therefore, whatever signs there are of the conception of self are all eliminated by the emptiness of what transcends extremes.

original: chos su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'i stong pa nyid kyis rnam par sel to zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Whatever signs there are of the conception of phenomena are eliminated by the emptiness of non-apprehension.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na chos stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid rnams kyis yongs su bsal dgos pas gong du bstan pa'i stong pa nyid rnams kyang chos stong pa nyid kyis yongs su @190a * //🔽bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na chos stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid rnams kyis yongs su bsal dgos pas gong du bstan pa'i stong pa nyid rnams kyang chos stong pa nyid kyis yongs su @190a * //🔽bsal ba yin te /
translated: In the ultimate sense, even the emptiness of phenomena must be eliminated by the emptinesses, and so the emptinesses taught above are also eliminated by the emptiness of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir 'dir re zhig dngos po med pa smos nas chos stong pa nyid rnam par sel bar bstan pa yang chos rnam par rig pa tsam las gud na med par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir re zhig dngos po med pa smos nas chos stong pa nyid rnam par sel bar bstan pa yang chos rnam par rig pa tsam las gud na med par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis
translated: the emptiness of the non-existent nature

original: ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
analyzed: ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel to //
translated: removes the sign of mere awareness.

original: don dam stong pa nyid kyis ni don dam pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to zhes bstan te /
analyzed: don dam stong pa nyid kyis ni don dam pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel to zhes bstan te /
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate removes the sign of the ultimate.

original: ming dang don du 'tsham pa'i phyir don gyis rab tu bstan pa yin pas brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: ming dang don du 'tsham pa'i phyir don gyis rab tu bstan pa yin pas brda phrad par zad do //
translated: Since it is taught by the meaning in accordance with the name, it is merely a conventional expression.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi po de dag stong pa nyid rnam pa lngas rnam par sel bar byed do zhes ston te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi po de dag stong pa nyid rnam pa lngas rnam par sel bar byed do zhes ston te /
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought, it teaches that those four signs are removed by the five types of emptiness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It says:🔽What are the five?

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong ba nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong ba nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong ba nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong ba nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: emptiness of nature, emptiness of non-things, emptiness of intrinsic characteristic, emptiness of the essential nature of non-things, and emptiness of the ultimate.

original: mdo de dang sbyar na de las stong pa nyid bco brgyad tshang bar ston te /
analyzed: mdo de dang sbyar na de las stong pa nyid bco brgyad tshang bar ston te /
translated: When applied to that sutra, it teaches all eighteen kinds of emptiness.

original: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las byams pa bsgom par dka' ba'i mtshan ma ni rnam pa bcu yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las byams pa bsgom par dka' ba'i mtshan ma ni rnam pa bcu yod de /
translated: Therefore, that very sutra states that there are ten aspects of difficult to fathom signs,

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad la brten nas bsgom bar dka' ba'i mtshan ma de dag blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad la brten nas bsgom bar dka' ba'i mtshan ma de dag blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and one should view those difficult to fathom signs based on the eighteen kinds of emptiness.

original: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma dgu pa ston to //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi don so so yang dag par rig pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma dgu pa ston to //
translated: The ninth sign is taught by the phrase “the existence of the sign of the unconditioned and the sign of immutability, etc.,” because it is the object of the correct understanding of the pure suchness.

original: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the teaching of the signs and the teaching of emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the signs.

original: 'di ltar sngar gong du bstan pa'i rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar gong du bstan pa'i rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid 'gog pa'i bden pa so sor yang dag par rig pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the knowledge of the truth of cessation, the suchness of purification taught above,

original: de so so yang dag par rig par gyur pa na mtshan ma rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de so so yang dag par rig par gyur pa na mtshan ma rnam pa gnyis 'byung ste /
translated: when one has that knowledge, two kinds of signs arise:

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan ma dang 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan ma dang 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: the sign of the unconditioned and the sign of the unchanging.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba /
translated: That is eliminated by the emptiness of the unconditioned and the emptiness of the unchanging.

original: gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid ston pa'o //
translated: This is the second, the teaching of the emptiness that is the antidote.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutras,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the emptiness of the unconditioned is as follows:

original: skye ba med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That which is unborn, non-abiding, unchanging, and non-perishing is called the emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: @190b 'gyur ba med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @190b 'gyur ba med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Unchanging is as follows:

original: gtong ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / spangs pa med cing dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyur ba med pa'o zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gtong ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / spangs pa med cing dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyur ba med pa'o zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is ungiven, unrejected, unabandoned, and unapprehended is called unchanging.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it says, “The unconditioned is called ‘without causes and conditions.’

original: rtag par mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rtag par mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa dang / nam mkha' lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained as ‘permanent, non-arising, non-ceasing, and like space.’

original: 'gyur ba med pa stong ba nyid ni 'grel pa de las rnam par bshad pa med do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa stong ba nyid ni 'grel pa de las rnam par bshad pa med do //
translated: The emptiness of the unchanging is not explained in that commentary.

original: mdo 'di las kyang phal cher 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las kyang phal cher 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las gsungs pa dang mthun par ston te /
translated: This sutra also teaches for the most part in accordance with what is taught in the noble Perfection of Wisdom sutras.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid mngon du gyur pa'i tshe mtshan ma gnyis med pa'i phyir stong ba nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid mngon du gyur pa'i tshe mtshan ma gnyis med pa'i phyir stong ba nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Thus, when emptiness is manifested, the two signs do not exist, and so emptiness is completely abandoned by the two kinds of emptiness.

original: mtshan ma de'i gnyen por stong pa nyid de nyid yid la byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma bcu pa ston to //
analyzed: mtshan ma de'i gnyen por stong pa nyid de nyid yid la byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma yod pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan ma bcu pa ston to //
translated: The existence of the sign of emptiness is taught by the words “the sign of that very emptiness” and so on, because one attends to that very emptiness as the antidote to that sign.

original: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan ma bstan pa dang / stong pa nyid bstan pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the teaching on the signs and the teaching on emptiness.

original: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the signs.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of these words of the sutra.

original: kha cig na re mtshan ma de'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kha cig na re mtshan ma de'i zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Some say: The sign of that means the sign of the unconditioned that was just explained, and the characteristic of immutability.

original: gnyen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The antidote is emptiness.

original: sngar bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: sngar bshad ma thag pa'i 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa nyid de /
translated: It is the emptiness of the unconditioned and immutability that was just explained.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is as taught in the Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: It says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma gnyis kyi gnyen por stong pa gnyis yid la byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma snang bar gyur to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhe'o //🔽kha cig na re mtshan ma de'i zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan ma gnyis kyi gnyen por stong pa gnyis yid la byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma snang bar gyur to zhes bstan par 'gyur ro zhe'o // kha cig na re mtshan ma de'i zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Because bodhisattvas attend to two kinds of emptiness as antidotes to two kinds of signs, the sign of emptiness appears.

original: mtshan ma snga ma dgu po dag go //
analyzed: mtshan ma snga ma dgu po dag go //
translated: Some say: The sign of that means the previous nine signs.

original: gnyen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid sde ma bcu drug po dag ste /
analyzed: gnyen po stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong pa nyid sde ma bcu drug po dag ste /
translated: The antidote called emptiness is the sixteen groups of emptinesses.

original: snga ma'i stong pa nyid bcu drug po dag yid la byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug gi mtshan ma snang bar gyur pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i stong pa nyid bcu drug po dag yid la byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug gi mtshan ma snang bar gyur pa'o zhe'o //
translated: The sixteen signs of emptiness appear because of the attention to the previous sixteen emptinesses.

original: da ni stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid kyis yang dag par rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa gnyen por gyur pa'i stong pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Now, it is said that emptiness completely eliminates them. This is the second teaching of emptiness as the antidote.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid 'dis stong pas na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces @191a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste / chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid 'dis stong pas na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces @191a * //
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutras, it is said, “Here, the emptiness of emptiness is as follows.

original: bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is empty of this emptiness, and so it is called the emptiness of emptiness.”

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i 'grel pa las kyang don de skad du ston te /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba'i 'grel pa las kyang don de skad du ston te /
translated: This meaning is also taught in the commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, the same commentary says:

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid 'dis snga ma'i nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum 'jig par byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di ltar stong pa nyid 'dis snga ma'i nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum 'jig par byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness is so called because this emptiness makes the former three kinds of emptiness—inner emptiness, outer emptiness, and emptiness of both outer and inner—empty.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained extensively in that same text.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The treatise Differentiating the middle from the extremes states:

original: stong pa nyid kyi shes pa mad stong pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi shes pa mad stong pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The emptiness of the cognition of emptiness is called the emptiness of emptiness.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore that same treatise states:

original: nang gi skye mched la sogs pa de yang gang gis stong par mthong zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched la sogs pa de yang gang gis stong par mthong zhe na /
translated: By what is the inner sense bases and so on seen to be empty?

original: stong pa nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pa ste /
translated: By the cognition of emptiness.

original: de'i stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid do zhes bshad pas don gyis bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa dang mthun par snga ma'i nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang /🔽chen po stong pa nyid rnam par 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid do zhes bshad pas don gyis bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa dang mthun par snga ma'i nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid rnam par 'jig pa yin no //
translated: Since it is explained that the emptiness of that is emptiness, it is similar to the emptiness of the former, the emptiness of the latter, the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the outer and inner,🔽and the emptiness of the great taught in the treatise Differentiating the Middle and the Extremes.

original: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las ni yod pa dang / med pa cig car rnam par sel ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bstan te /
analyzed: 'phags pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo las ni yod pa dang / med pa cig car rnam par sel ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bstan te /
translated: In the noble Great Nirvana Sutra, emptiness is taught to be the simultaneous elimination of existence and nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las yod pa gang yin pa dang / med pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni yin pa yang ma yin pa yin pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las yod pa gang yin pa dang / med pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni yin pa yang ma yin pa yin pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore that sutra itself says, “That which is existence and that which is nonexistence are the emptiness of emptiness because they are not existent and they are not nonexistent.

original: kho na phab shin de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ni yod pa dang med par mtshungs te /
analyzed: kho na phab shin de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ni yod pa dang med par mtshungs te /
translated: The phenomena of dependent origination are similar to existence and nonexistence.

original: bdag nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir med pa'i chos ni yod par 'gyur la /🔽yod pa'i chos ni med par 'gyur te 'dus ma byas yod pa'i phyir yod pa yin yang /🔽yod pa nyid kyang ma yin la 'dus byas med pa'i phyir med pa yin yang /
analyzed: bdag nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir med pa'i chos ni yod par 'gyur la / yod pa'i chos ni med par 'gyur te 'dus ma byas yod pa'i phyir yod pa yin yang / yod pa nyid kyang ma yin la 'dus byas med pa'i phyir med pa yin yang /
translated: Nonexistent phenomena become existent because they are similar to themselves.🔽And existent phenomena become nonexistent because unconditioned phenomena exist, they are not existent.

original: med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: And because conditioned phenomena do not exist, they are not nonexistent.

original: yod pa yang ma yin med ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Because they are neither existent nor nonexistent, they are called emptiness of emptiness.

original: mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa dang mi mthun pas bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo 'di las gsungs pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa dang mi mthun pas bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is not consistent with the previous explanation, so there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re 'di ltar stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma rnam pa dgu'i nang na stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis po 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ltar stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni mtshan ma rnam pa dgu'i nang na stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis po 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Some say: Thus emptiness of emptiness is so called because it eliminates the sign of the two types of emptiness from among the nine types of signs: emptiness of the unconditioned and emptiness of the unchangeable.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore the Sutra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: 'dus ma byas @191b dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i stong ba nyid kyi mtshan ma'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas @191b dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i stong ba nyid kyi mtshan ma'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because it serves as the antidote to the signs of the emptiness of the unconditioned and the emptiness of the unchangeable, it is called emptiness of emptiness.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: This is explained in detail in that sutra.

original: kha cig na re 'di ltar stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni snga ma'i stong pa nyid bcu drug po dag gi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ltar stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyis ni snga ma'i stong pa nyid bcu drug po dag gi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed pa'i phyir stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: Thus emptiness of emptiness is so called because it eliminates the signs of the previous sixteen types of emptiness.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar bstan pa ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam pa gnyis kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar bstan pa ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching on the elimination of the signs of the two kinds of emptiness is due to the different ideas of the translators.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na gang dag rnam par sel bar bgyid cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel bar bgyid pa na gang dag rnam par sel bar bgyid cing /
translated: Blessed One, when one eliminates the ten kinds of signs in this way, what does the elimination consist of,🔽and from what signs is one liberated?

original: mtshan ma gad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba'i rnam par grol ba rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
analyzed: mtshan ma gad las yongs su grol bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba'i rnam par grol ba rnam par 'byed pa ston to //
translated: The passage from “Thus have I heard” up to “The elimination of the signs of the two kinds of emptiness” explains the first topic, the elimination of the signs.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is divided into two parts:

original: zhus pa dang / lan dag gis mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba rnam par grol ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / rigs kyi bu gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba man chad gzhan gyis brgal ba'i the tshom gcod pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa dang / lan dag gis mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba rnam par grol ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / rigs kyi bu gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba man chad gzhan gyis brgal ba'i the tshom gcod pa'o //
translated: the question and the answer, which explain the elimination of the signs of the two kinds of emptiness, and the elimination of doubts raised by others, from “Son in the lineage” up to “The main point.”

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: zhu ba gsol ba la yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba la yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The request has two intentions:

original: mtshan ma gang dag rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba zhu ba dang / mtshan ma gang las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba zhu ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma gang dag rnam par sel bar 'gyur ba zhu ba dang / mtshan ma gang las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba zhu ba'o //
translated: the request for the elimination of signs and the request for the liberation from signs.

original: zhus pa dang po'i dgongs pa yang bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: zhus pa dang po'i dgongs pa yang bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The first request has three different explanations.

original: kha cig na re gong du bstan pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma de dag rnam par sel ba na /
analyzed: kha cig na re gong du bstan pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma de dag rnam par sel ba na /
translated: Some say: When the signs of thorough affliction are eliminated,

original: mtshan ma gad dag yongs su bsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma gad dag yongs su bsal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe'o //
translated: the signs of purification are eliminated.

original: kha cig na re gong du mtshan ma rnam pa bcu yongs su bsal bar bstan pa de yang ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma'i nad nas mtshan ma gang las brtsams nas bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re gong du mtshan ma rnam pa bcu yongs su bsal bar bstan pa de yang ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i mtshan ma'i nad nas mtshan ma gang las brtsams nas bstan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The above teaching of the complete elimination of the ten aspects of signs also refers to the signs of meditative concentration and distraction.

original: kha cig na re gong du yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel bar bstan pa de yang mtshan ma ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re gong du yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel bar bstan pa de yang mtshan ma ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The above teaching of the complete elimination of the signs of grasping also refers to the signs of meditative concentration and distraction.

original: zhus pa gsum pa 'di dag dang sbyar na lan yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhus pa gsum pa 'di dag dang sbyar na lan yang rnam pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: When applied to these three questions, the answer also becomes threefold.

original: mdo'i tshig thad dkar bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig thad dkar bab pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained in accordance with the order of the words of the sutra.

original: rigs kyi bu ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi @192a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzugs brnyan gyi @192a * //
translated: Son of noble family, the images that are the domain of meditative concentration

original: mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur la de yang rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan du gsungs pa'o
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur la de yang rnam par sel to zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par zhus pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lan du gsungs pa'o
translated: This is the reply to the second of the two questions asked by the Tathagata.

original: // lan du gsungs pa 'di yang snga ma'i zhus pa rnam pa gsum yod pa nyid kyis 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /🔽kha cig na re stong pa nyid bsgoms pas kun du brtags pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bcu po dag rnam par sel ba na stong pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i sems la da dung gzhan gyi dbang stong pa 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan stong pa nyid kyi sems kyi rjes
analyzed: // lan du gsungs pa 'di yang snga ma'i zhus pa rnam pa gsum yod pa nyid kyis 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de / kha cig na re stong pa nyid bsgoms pas kun du brtags pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bcu po dag rnam par sel ba na stong pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i sems la da dung gzhan gyi dbang stong pa 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan stong pa nyid kyi sems kyi rjes
translated: This reply has three explanations since the former question has three parts.

original: su snang bas /
analyzed: su snang bas /
translated: Some say: When emptiness meditation eliminates the ten kinds of imagined signs, the mind that meditates on emptiness still has the appearance of dependent images that resemble emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de las mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa la zhus nas yang stong pa 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rnam par sel bar byed de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor de las mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa la zhus nas yang stong pa 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam par rnam par sel bar byed de /
translated: Having withdrawn the consciousness of realization from that yoga of emptiness, he again eliminates the aspect of the sign of the image that is like emptiness.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa yongs su bsal ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i sa bon las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa yongs su bsal ba nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i sa bon las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By eliminating the aspect of the sign, he becomes completely liberated from the seed of the bondage of affliction.

original: yongs su grol ba'i sems kyang yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang rnam par sel to zhes bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: yongs su grol ba'i sems kyang yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de yang rnam par sel to zhes bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: And because he also abandons the liberated mind, that is also eliminated.

original: kha cig na re gong du bstan pa ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel ba na /
analyzed: kha cig na re gong du bstan pa ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel ba na /
translated: Some say: When eliminating the ten signs as previously explained,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzhan gyi dbang gis gzugs brnyan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa kho na rnam par sel bar byed de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gzhan gyi dbang gis gzugs brnyan gyi rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa kho na rnam par sel bar byed de /
translated: he eliminates only the aspect of the sign of the image that is dependent on the domain of samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par sel ba nyid kyi phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par sel ba nyid kyi phyir zag pa dang bcas pa'i mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the elimination of the image of concentration, one is completely liberated from the bondage of the sign of the contaminated.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol ba'i mthu'i phyir dmigs par byed pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol ba'i mthu'i phyir dmigs par byed pa /
translated: Because of the power of complete liberation from the bondage of the sign, one is able to objectify.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa yang rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa yang rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: One also eliminates the aspect of views.

original: yang na mngon du spyod pa'i mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol ba'i mthu'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba'i sa bon las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba'o zhe'o //
analyzed: yang na mngon du spyod pa'i mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol ba'i mthu'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba'i sa bon las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ba'o zhe'o //
translated: Or, because of the power of complete liberation from the bondage of the sign of manifest activity, one is completely liberated from the seed of the bondage of the sign.

original: kha cig na re gong du bstan pa ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel ba de ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas snang ba'i gzugs brnyan kun brtags pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re gong du bstan pa ltar mtshan ma rnam pa bcu rnam par sel ba de ni ting nge 'dzin la brten nas snang ba'i gzugs brnyan kun brtags pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: Some say: The elimination of the ten signs as previously explained is the imagined sign of the image that appears based on concentration.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la gzugs brnyan dang bcas pa snang bas phyis rnam par g-yeng bar sems kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin la gzugs brnyan dang bcas pa snang bas phyis rnam par g-yeng bar sems kyang /
translated: Because concentration appears with an image, later the mind is distracted.

original: gzugs brnyan de la brten nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi rjes su yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yod par 'gyur pas //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de la brten nas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi rjes su yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma yod par 'gyur pas //
translated: Because of that reflection, the sign of the apprehension of an unreal mind comes to exist.

original: de'i phyir stong pa @192b nyid du bsgoms pa'i tshe mtshan ma de lta bu dag rnam par sel bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa @192b nyid du bsgoms pa'i tshe mtshan ma de lta bu dag rnam par sel bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, when meditating on emptiness, one eliminates such signs.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma rnam par sel ba'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Because of eliminating the sign of apprehension, one becomes liberated from the sign of affliction.

original: yang na slob dpon chos skyong gis bstan pa ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du mngon du mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya'i /
analyzed: yang na slob dpon chos skyong gis bstan pa ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba yang sngar bstan pa bzhin du mngon du mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya'i /
translated: Or, as the master Dharmapāla teaches, the elimination of the image that is the object of concentration is called elimination because it does not appear as it was previously.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyang med pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyang med pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not called elimination because it does not exist by its own nature.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore the Yogācāra Levels says:

original: rnal 'byor ba kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la yang dag par zhugs pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid gang gi rjes su 'jug ce na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la yang dag par zhugs pa'i tshe ngo bo nyid gang gi rjes su 'jug ce na /
translated: When the yogi/nī enters into the imagined nature, which nature does he/she enter into?

original: smras pa / yongs su grub ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su grub ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'jug go //
translated: It is said: He/she enters into the perfected nature.

original: rnal 'byor pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rjes su zhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rjes su zhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: When the yogi/nī enters into the perfected nature,

original: ngo bo nyid gang rnam par sel ce na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang rnam par sel ce na /
translated: which nature does he/she eliminate?

original: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par sel bar byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnam par sel bar byed do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said: He/she eliminates the dependent nature.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las rnal 'byor pas ji ltar dmigs pa'i yul gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las rnal 'byor pas ji ltar dmigs pa'i yul gyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed ce na /
translated: Moreover, how does the yogi/nī eliminate the signs of the object of observation?

original: smras pa / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shes bya'i gzugs brnyan la sngar so sor brtags pas phyis don dam pa'i yid la byas pa'i stobs kyis mtshan ma dang bcas ba nyid ni rnam par ldog la mtshan ma med pa nyid ni thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo
analyzed: smras pa / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shes bya'i gzugs brnyan la sngar so sor brtags pas phyis don dam pa'i yid la byas pa'i stobs kyis mtshan ma dang bcas ba nyid ni rnam par ldog la mtshan ma med pa nyid ni thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo
translated: Through correct concentration, the image of the object of knowledge is previously analyzed and later, through the power of attention to the ultimate, the possession of signs is reversed and the attainment of signlessness occurs.

original: // gzhan yang de nyid las gcod par nus shing spong bar nus pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: // gzhan yang de nyid las gcod par nus shing spong bar nus pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Moreover, that same text explains that it is called elimination because it is able to eliminate and able to abandon.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: The Vyakhyayukti says:

original: de la rnam par sel ba'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par sel ba'i bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meditation of elimination is as follows.

original: ji ltar kha cig ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yid la byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar kha cig ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yid la byas pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, some, through attention to the sign of the image that is the object of concentration,

original: chos rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed cing /
translated: eliminate the sign of the essential nature of phenomena.

original: yang snang bar mi 'gyur bar byed pas khyi gus khyi gud dbyung ba'i rigs pa la rten par byed de /
analyzed: yang snang bar mi 'gyur bar byed pas khyi gus khyi gud dbyung ba'i rigs pa la rten par byed de /
translated: Also, since it is the cause of not appearing, it is like the reasoning of a small dog chasing out a big dog.

original: dper na skyes bu la la khyi gu phra mos khyi gu sbom po 'byin pa ltar /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la la khyi gu phra mos khyi gu sbom po 'byin pa ltar /
translated: For example, it is like a small dog chasing out a big dog.

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pas lus kyi gnas ngan len rnam par sel bar byed ba lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pas lus kyi gnas ngan len rnam par sel bar byed ba lta bu'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, it is like physical pliancy removing the negative tendencies of the body.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du ston to //
translated: This is taught in the Yogācāryābhūmi Śāstra.

original: rigs kyi bu gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas stong pa nyid de dag ni mtshan ma de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa zhes bstan kyang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas stong pa nyid de dag ni mtshan ma de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa zhes bstan kyang /
translated: Son of noble family, from the perspective of the main point, those emptinesses are the antidotes to those signs, but

original: re re la yang mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen por mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin par @193a * //
analyzed: re re la yang mtshan ma thams cad kyi gnyen por mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin par @193a * //
translated: it should be understood that each one is not the antidote to all signs.

original: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gzhan gyis brgal ba'i the tshom gcod pa'o //
analyzed: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa gzhan gyis brgal ba'i the tshom gcod pa'o //
translated: This section from here onward is the second, the removal of doubts through others’ objections.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three.

original: don bstan pa dang / dpes nye bar mtshon pa dang / dpe dang / don sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: don bstan pa dang / dpes nye bar mtshon pa dang / dpe dang / don sbyar ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning, the illustration by the example, the example, and the application of the example to the meaning.

original: 'di ni dang po'i bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'i bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first explanation.

original: gzhan dag na re ci re res kyang mtshan ma rnam pa bcu po dag yongs su sel bar mi byed dam /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ci re res kyang mtshan ma rnam pa bcu po dag yongs su sel bar mi byed dam /
translated: Some argue: Do not each of the ten aspects of signs eliminate all signs?🔽Why do they each eliminate a different sign?

original: ci'i phyir so so nas mtshan ma tha dad pa re re rnam par sel bar byed ces rgol bas de'i phyir lan du 'di gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir so so nas mtshan ma tha dad pa re re rnam par sel bar byed ces rgol bas de'i phyir lan du 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In response to this argument, the following is stated:

original: yang dag pa'i don du na re res kyang mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed mod kyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na re res kyang mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed mod kyi /
translated: In reality, each does eliminate all signs.

original: gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir mtshan ma re re rnam par sel bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir mtshan ma re re rnam par sel bar bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: However, because they are considered to be primary, it is taught that each eliminates a sign.

original: dper na ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams mi bskyed pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams mi bskyed pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: For example, the defiled phenomena from ignorance to aging and death are not not produced.

original: gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas 'du byed skyed pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gtso bo'i dbang du byas nas 'du byed skyed pa zhes bstan te /
translated: However, from the perspective of the primary cause, it is taught that they produce formations.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi nye ba'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpe nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi nye ba'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpe nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The second, the illustration of the example, is: “because it is the proximate condition of the formations.”

original: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: mdo nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The sutra itself explains this.

original: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dpe dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dpe dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The third, the application of the example, is: “Here, too, this method should be understood.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Maitreya addressed the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di la stong pa nyid gang gis stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di la stong pa nyid gang gis stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa gang lags /
translated: “Lord, what is the emptiness by which the characteristic of emptiness is included?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de rtogs nas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de rtogs nas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: When bodhisattvas understand it, the characteristic of emptiness is not lost,🔽and they abandon the conceit of the view of emptiness.”

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal yongs su spong bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa zhus pa dang lan dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal yongs su spong bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa zhus pa dang lan dag gis stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The third, the analysis of the inclusion of the characteristic of emptiness by means of the question and answer, is from here.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol pa'o //
translated: This is the first part, the request.

original: 'di la stong pa nyid gang lags /
analyzed: 'di la stong pa nyid gang lags /
translated: What is emptiness here?

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mdor bsdus pa gang yin pa nyid yang dag par zhus pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mdor bsdus pa gang yin pa nyid yang dag par zhus pa'o //
translated: The brief summary of the characteristics of emptiness is called the brief summary of emptiness.

original: de la zhu ba gsol pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la zhu ba gsol pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of the request is as follows.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las chos stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid gang gis bsdus pa lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las chos stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid gang gis bsdus pa lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: From among the three natures, which emptiness includes the emptiness of phenomena?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhu ba gsol ba'i dgongs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The intention of the request is indicated by the bodhisattvas... and so on.

original: @193b gal te stong pa nyid mdor bsdus pa khong du chud par gyur na /
analyzed: @193b gal te stong pa nyid mdor bsdus pa khong du chud par gyur na /
translated: If one understands the brief summary of emptiness,

original: rab tu nyams par gyur ba stong pa nyid du nye bar gzung ba'i skyon med pas de'i dbang gis ma thob par thob bo snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa yang yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la legs so legs so zhes bsngags pa brjod nas rigs kyi bu khyod kyis deng 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di ltar don zab mo 'dri ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams stong pa nyid kyi
analyzed: rab tu nyams par gyur ba stong pa nyid du nye bar gzung ba'i skyon med pas de'i dbang gis ma thob par thob bo snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi nyes pa yang yongs su spong bar 'gyur ba'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la legs so legs so zhes bsngags pa brjod nas rigs kyi bu khyod kyis deng 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa la 'di ltar don zab mo 'dri ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams stong pa nyid kyi
translated: and by not holding emptiness as a fault, one completely abandons the fault of the conceit of attainment, thinking, “I have attained what was not attained.”🔽Then the Lord, having praised the bodhisattva Maitreya, saying, “Excellent, excellent, son of good family,” said, “Here you have asked the Tathāgata about this profound meaning in order to prevent the bodhisattvas from falling away from the characteristic of emptiness.”

original: mtshan nyid las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i ched du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i ched du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This shows the second, the Tathāgata’s true reply.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhus pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas bshad par gnang ba bstan pa dang zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas bshad par gnang ba bstan pa dang zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the request is shown by the praise of the request and the permission to explain. The reply is given in accordance with the request.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into three parts:

original: zhu ba zhus pa la phan yon yod par bsngags pa dang / zhu ba ma gsol ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa dang / mnyen par bskul zhing bshad par gnang ba ste /
analyzed: zhu ba zhus pa la phan yon yod par bsngags pa dang / zhu ba ma gsol ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa dang / mnyen par bskul zhing bshad par gnang ba ste /
translated: the praise of the benefits of making the request, the teaching of the disadvantages of not making the request, and the gentle urging and permission to explain.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba zhus pa la phan yon yod par bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba zhus pa la phan yon yod par bsngags pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the praise of the benefits of making the request.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' gang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las rab tu nyams pa ni theg pa chen po mtha' dag las rab tu nyams par 'gyur bas zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa zhu ba ma gsol ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' gang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las rab tu nyams pa ni theg pa chen po mtha' dag las rab tu nyams par 'gyur bas zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa zhu ba ma gsol ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family, a bodhisattva who falls away from the characteristic of emptiness falls away from the entire Great Vehicle. This is the second, the teaching of the disadvantages of not making the request.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This statement of the sūtra is also divided into two parts:

original: dang po ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rab tu nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
translated: The first question is Why? which indicates the reason why the characteristic of emptiness does not deteriorate.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu bstan to //
translated: The phrase son of noble family and so on indicates the characteristic of deterioration.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' gang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las rab tu nyams pa ni theg pa chen po mtha' dag las kyang rab tu nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba la theg pa chen po mtha' dag ces bya ba ni sngar khungs su bstan pa
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' gang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid las rab tu nyams pa ni theg pa chen po mtha' dag las kyang rab tu nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba la theg pa chen po mtha' dag ces bya ba ni sngar khungs su bstan pa
translated: Among them, the bodhisattva who deteriorates from the characteristic of emptiness also deteriorates from the entire Great Vehicle. The phrase entire Great Vehicle was previously cited as a source.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sutras,

original: stong pa nyid bco brgyad la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa nyid ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bco brgyad la sogs pa ji skad du bstan pa nyid ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: it is taught that the eighteen kinds of emptiness and so on are called the Great Vehicle.

original: 'dir rab tu nyams par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa de yang /
analyzed: 'dir rab tu nyams par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa de yang /
translated: Here, the phrase deteriorates

original: bstan @194a * //
analyzed: bstan @194a * //
translated: is explained.

original: bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
analyzed: bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ji skad du /
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi, a treatise of the Yogacara, says:

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po las rab tu nyams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po las rab tu nyams pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does a bodhisattva fall away from the Mahayana?

original: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' gal te chos rnams kyi zab pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos na rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i rims nad nyid med par yongs su 'dzin cing bdag nyid 'khor ba'i nad lci ba med do snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' gal te chos rnams kyi zab pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thos na rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa'i rims nad nyid med par yongs su 'dzin cing bdag nyid 'khor ba'i nad lci ba med do snyam du sems te /
translated: If a bodhisattva hears about the profundity of the teachings and their lack of intrinsic existence, he may think, “I am naturally free of the disease of the afflictions; I do not have the heavy disease of cyclic existence.”

original: dper na rims kyis btab par gyur pa de nyid bdag nyid nad med par rlom par byed pa rims kyi nad las thar bar mi 'gyur zhing rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo
analyzed: dper na rims kyis btab par gyur pa de nyid bdag nyid nad med par rlom par byed pa rims kyi nad las thar bar mi 'gyur zhing rab tu nyams par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes 'byung ngo
translated: Just as one who is infected with a disease may think that he is healthy and not be cured of his disease, the bodhisattva should be seen in the same way.

original: // gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
analyzed: // gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni /
translated: Moreover, the Bodhisattvabhumi, a treatise of the Yogacara, says:

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa dang / stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba la rab tu nyams pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur ba 'debs pa dang / stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba la rab tu nyams pa zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained that “degeneration” is the superimposition of the existence of form and so on and the deprecation of the ultimate, which is the nonexistence of form and so on.🔽Thus Treatise on the Essence of the Middle Way says:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las gang zag rnam pa gnyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dul ba las rab tu nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las gang zag rnam pa gnyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'dul ba las rab tu nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Two types of persons degenerate from the Buddha’s doctrine of vinaya:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'dogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rten du gyur pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyi don dam par yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la thams cad kyi thams cad du med do zhes skur pa 'debs shing /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'dogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rten du gyur pa brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyi don dam par yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la thams cad kyi thams cad du med do zhes skur pa 'debs shing /
translated: Those who superimpose the existence of the entityness of the identity-reality of the verbal conventions that impute the phenomena of form and so on and the things of form and so on and those who deprecate the ultimate, which is the inexpressible reality that is the basis of the signs of imputation and the support of the signs of imputation, saying, “It does not exist at all in any way.”

original: chud gson bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba'i bar gang yin pa de ni rab tu nyams pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: chud gson bar byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba'i bar gang yin pa de ni rab tu nyams pa zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: That which is wasted away is called “degenerated.”

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the same text.

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis legs par nyon cig dang / khyod la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mnyam par bskul zhing bshad par gnang ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis legs par nyon cig dang / khyod la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa mnyam par bskul zhing bshad par gnang ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, listen well, and I will explain to you the summary of the characteristics of emptiness. This is the third encouragement to equality and permission to explain.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid dang / de la ci yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po la stong ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa bzhin du lan @194b yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid dang / de la ci yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po la stong ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zhus pa bzhin du lan @194b yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family, the characteristic of the dependent and the characteristic of the real are completely free from the imagined characteristic of the afflictions and purification in all aspects, and nothing whatsoever is apprehended there. That is called the summary of the characteristic of emptiness in the Great Vehicle.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This statement of the sūtra also has two parts:

original: zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par bstan pa dang / de ni zhes bya ba man chad ni mjug bsdu zhing gzhan dag gis brgal ba'i lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du lan yang dag par bstan pa dang / de ni zhes bya ba man chad ni mjug bsdu zhing gzhan dag gis brgal ba'i lan btab pa'o //
translated: The correct answer that is taught in accordance with the question, and from “That” onward, which is the conclusion and the response to objections by others.

original: lan yang dag bar bstan pa la yang rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon dag gi bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: lan yang dag bar bstan pa la yang rgya gar yul pa'i slob dpon dag gi bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The correct answer that is taught in accordance with the question also has two parts, according to the explanations of the Indian masters:

original: dang po slob dpon bha bya la sogs pas mdo 'di las ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum char yang stong pa nyid du ston par mdzad do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dang po slob dpon bha bya la sogs pas mdo 'di las ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum char yang stong pa nyid du ston par mdzad do zhes bshad de /
translated: First, the master Bhavyakīrti and so on explain that this sūtra teaches all three natures to be empty.

original: mdo 'di las ji skad du gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid ces gsungs pas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo🔽bo nyid stong pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: mdo 'di las ji skad du gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid ces gsungs pas ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This sūtra says, “The characteristics of the dependent and the real are completely devoid of the imagined characteristics of affliction and purification,” which teaches that the imagined nature is empty.

original: de la ci yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa zhes gsungs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis stong pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: de la ci yang dmigs su med pa gang yin pa zhes gsungs pas ni gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis kyis stong pa'i don bstan te /
translated: “ In it, nothing at all is apprehended” teaches the meaning of the emptiness of the two kinds of nature, the dependent and the real.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po dag dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po dag dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, “in it, nothing at all is apprehended” is said to be the summary definition of emptiness.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang rnam par sel bar ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang rnam par sel bar ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that dependent nature is also eliminated?

original: des mdo las gsungs pa khungs su bstan pa /🔽chos ni gang yang cung zad skye ba med //
analyzed: des mdo las gsungs pa khungs su bstan pa / chos ni gang yang cung zad skye ba med //
translated: The sutra statement is cited as the source🔽No phenomenon whatsoever arises

original: chos ni cung zad gang yang 'gag pa med //
analyzed: chos ni cung zad gang yang 'gag pa med //
translated: No phenomenon whatsoever ceases

original: lta ba dag las chos rnams rab brtags na //
analyzed: lta ba dag las chos rnams rab brtags na //
translated: Having examined phenomena through views

original: yod pa ma yin med pa'ang min //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin med pa'ang min //
translated: They are neither existent nor nonexistent

original: zhes gsungs pa dang gzhan yang mdo gnyis po dag las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang gzhan yang mdo gnyis po dag las /
translated: Moreover, the two sutras state

original: chos rnams rkyen las gang skyes pa //
analyzed: chos rnams rkyen las gang skyes pa //
translated: Whatever arises from conditions does not arise

original: rkyen dang chos ni gnyi ga med //
analyzed: rkyen dang chos ni gnyi ga med //
translated: Neither conditions nor phenomena exist

original: de ltar yang dag gang skyes pa //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag gang skyes pa //
translated: Thus, whatever arises correctly

original: rkyen ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Is called the realization of conditions

original: / chos ni rkyen las gang skyes pa //
analyzed: / chos ni rkyen las gang skyes pa //
translated: Whatever arises from conditions

original: chos de dngos po ci yang med //
analyzed: chos de dngos po ci yang med //
translated: That phenomenon has no reality

original: chos dngos med pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: chos dngos med pa gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is unreal

original: chos de rkyen las skyes ma yin //
analyzed: chos de rkyen las skyes ma yin //
translated: That phenomenon does not arise from conditions

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the commentary on the perfection of wisdom states

original: chos rnams ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes bya bas na chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang dmigs su med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes bya bas na chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang dmigs su med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since it is said that phenomena are not apprehended, the basic field of phenomena and the perfect limit are also said to be not apprehended. Therefore, the consummate nature should be understood to be not apprehended.

original: gal te de lta na mdo las gsungs pa de ci ltar brda sprad cing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mdo las gsungs pa de ci ltar brda sprad cing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: If that is so, how can the statements in the sūtras be explained?

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: The sūtras say:

original: kun brtags dag ni yod ma yin //🔽gzhan @195a * //
analyzed: kun brtags dag ni yod ma yin // gzhan @195a * //
translated: The imputed does not exist.

original: gyi dbang ni yod ma yin //🔽rnam par rtog na rab nyams shing //
analyzed: gyi dbang ni yod ma yin // rnam par rtog na rab nyams shing //
translated: The dependent does not exist.🔽If one analyzes, it is completely destroyed.

original: sgro 'dogs skur 'debs mthar ltung 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs skur 'debs mthar ltung 'gyur // zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: One falls to the extreme of superimposition and denial.

original: smras pa / de la ming ni kun brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / de la ming ni kun brtags pa yin la /
translated: We respond: Names are the imputed nature.

original: don ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: don ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: Objects are the dependent nature.

original: ming ni don la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med la /
analyzed: ming ni don la yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med la /
translated: Since names do not exist in objects, they do not exist.

original: don ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pas 'di khungs su bzhag nas /
analyzed: don ni 'jig rten pa'i rjes su med pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pas 'di khungs su bzhag nas /
translated: Since objects do exist, they are not nonexistent from the perspective of the world. Therefore, this passage should be explained as follows.

original: gzhan gyi dbang yod par bsgrub tu mi rung ngo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yod par bsgrub tu mi rung ngo zhes bshad de /
translated: It is not suitable to establish the existence of the dependent.

original: 'di la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs mang po yod pa ni 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs mang po yod pa ni 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: There are many such arguments, but I will not elaborate on them here.

original: gnyis pa ni slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pas ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum las /
translated: Second, the master Dharm˝ôdgatapada and others teach that from among the three natures,

original: kun brtags bsal bar zad kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan gnyis ni ma yin no zhes ston to /
analyzed: kun brtags bsal bar zad kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan gnyis ni ma yin no zhes ston to /
translated: the imagined is eliminated, but the other two natures are not.🔽Therefore, in that very sutra, the characteristic of the dependent and the characteristic of the real are said to be completely devoid of the imagined characteristic of affliction and purification.

original: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid ces gsungs pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis kun brtags yongs su spang bar bstan pas de'i phyir kun brtags pa yongs su bsal ba nyid kyi stong pa nyid kyi
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de nyid las gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par bral ba nyid ces gsungs pa 'di ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis kun brtags yongs su spang bar bstan pas de'i phyir kun brtags pa yongs su bsal ba nyid kyi stong pa nyid kyi
translated: This teaches that the two natures are free from the imagined.

original: ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the teaching of the essence.

original: de la ci yang dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bshad de /
analyzed: de la ci yang dmigs pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par bshad de /
translated: Here, “the non-apprehension of anything” is explained as follows.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid bsdus pa de la mtshan ma bcu po thams cad dmigs su med pa la bya'i /
