analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid bsdus pa de la mtshan ma bcu po thams cad dmigs su med pa la bya'i /
translated: It is the non-apprehension of all ten signs in that which is subsumed by the characteristic of emptiness,

original: sngar bstan pa ltar stong ba nyid bcu drug po dag gi so so nas mtshan ma re re rnam par sel ba la bya ba ni ma yin pa'o //🔽yang na kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis po de la gtan du bral ba'am /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar stong ba nyid bcu drug po dag gi so so nas mtshan ma re re rnam par sel ba la bya ba ni ma yin pa'o // yang na kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis po de la gtan du bral ba'am /
translated: but not as the elimination of each sign by each of the sixteen kinds of emptiness as previously taught.

original: ci yang mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Or else, the non-apprehension of anything is the complete absence of the two imagined natures.

original: gzhan yang mdo gzhan dag las /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo gzhan dag las /
translated: Moreover, in other sūtras,

original: kun brtags dag ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: kun brtags dag ni yod ma yin //
translated: the imagined does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod ma yin //🔽rnam par rtog na rab nyams shing //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod ma yin // rnam par rtog na rab nyams shing //
translated: the relative does not exist,🔽when there is discrimination, there is a fall,

original: sgro 'dogs skur 'debs mthar ltung 'gyur //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs skur 'debs mthar ltung 'gyur //
translated: and there is the extreme of superimposition and denial.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo 'di nyid kyi nang nas rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan gyi le'u las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang mdo 'di nyid kyi nang nas rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan gyi le'u las /
translated: Moreover, in this very sutra, in the chapter on the characteristic of the lack of entityness, it says:

original: 'on kyang sems can rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rnams ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because sentient beings superimpose the imagined nature onto the dependent nature and the consummate nature,🔽the three types of lack of entityness are posited.

original: des ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin te @195b zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: des ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin te @195b zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: Moreover, the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sūtra says:

original: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams ni gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The imagined natures definitely do not exist.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams ni ming dang 'du shes kyis brtags pa tsam du yod cing tha snyad du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams ni ming dang 'du shes kyis brtags pa tsam du yod cing tha snyad du brjod pa'o //
translated: The dependent natures exist as mere imputations of names and concepts and are expressed conventionally.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams dang bdag med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams dang bdag med pa nyid de /
translated: The consummate natures and the absence of a self-entity

original: yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag par yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: They do not exist in reality.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa'i nang nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba dang / 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa'i nang nas /
translated: Moreover, Master Bhāviveka, in his Subcommentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna and in his Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom,🔽cites the noble Perfection of Wisdom Sūtra as a source and explains:

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo khungs su bstan pa las kyang kun du brtags pas bsags pa dang / bskyed pa dang / blangs pa dang / rtag par rgyun du rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o snyam pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo khungs su bstan pa las kyang kun du brtags pas bsags pa dang / bskyed pa dang / blangs pa dang / rtag par rgyun du rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o snyam pa'i chos gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “All phenomena that are imagined, accumulated, produced, taken up, and thought to be unchanging and permanent are said to be nonexistent.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa de dag ni yod pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa de dag ni yod pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Those that are produced by causes and conditions are explained to exist.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas de dang de dag tu ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas de dang de dag tu ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata, in this and that sūtra, said that among those three natures, the imagined nature is empty.

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis po dag ni yod pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gnyis po dag ni yod pa yin no zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The other two natures, the dependent and the real, do exist.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du gsungs pa'i bstan pa dag la dgongs pa gzhan yod pas de'i phyir sgra ji bzhin du bzung nas chos rnams med do zhes skur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid du gsungs pa'i bstan pa dag la dgongs pa gzhan yod pas de'i phyir sgra ji bzhin du bzung nas chos rnams med do zhes skur du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since the teachings on emptiness have another intention, it is not right to take them literally and deprecate phenomena by saying they do not exist.

original: sgra ji bzhin du don 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po la skur ba btab pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du don 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po la skur ba btab pa yin te /
translated: To take them literally is to deprecate the Mahayana,

original: stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba ma yin pas log par lta ba chen po nyid mngon par grub par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba ma yin pas log par lta ba chen po nyid mngon par grub par 'gyur ro zhes bshad de /
translated: and to hold emptiness wrongly is to establish a great nihilism.

original: de lta bu'i gtan tshigs la sogs ba mang po gzhan yod pa ni 'dir mi brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gtan tshigs la sogs ba mang po gzhan yod pa ni 'dir mi brjod do //
translated: There are many other such arguments, but I will not go into them here.

original: gal te de lta na ji ltar sngar mdo sde khungs su bzhag nas gzhan gyi dbang yongs su bsal bar bstan pa de dag ji ltar brda sprad cing rnam par bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ji ltar sngar mdo sde khungs su bzhag nas gzhan gyi dbang yongs su bsal bar bstan pa de dag ji ltar brda sprad cing rnam par bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how do you interpret and explain the earlier passages that cite sutras to prove the existence of dependent nature?

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa las 'byung bar sngar mdo dag las /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis bshad pa las 'byung bar sngar mdo dag las /
translated: As explained by the master Dharmapāla, the intention of the following sutra passages is as follows.

original: chos ni gang yang cung zad skye ba med //
analyzed: chos ni gang yang cung zad skye ba med //
translated: No phenomenon whatsoever arises.

original: chos ni gang yang cung zad 'gag pa med //🔽ces gsungs pa de'i dgongs ba ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid stong zhing skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid du bstan @196a * //
analyzed: chos ni gang yang cung zad 'gag pa med // ces gsungs pa de'i dgongs ba ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid stong zhing skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid du bstan @196a * //
translated: No phenomenon whatsoever ceases.

original: par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: par bzhed pa'o //
translated: The intention is to teach that the imagined nature is empty of the nature of being the referent of terms and expressions and is devoid of arising and cessation.

original: lta ba dag las chos rnam par brtags na yod pa ma yin med pa min zhes gsungs pa ni kun brtags pa dang bral ba'i lta ba yongs su dag pas 'jig rten pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i chos rnams yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang
analyzed: lta ba dag las chos rnam par brtags na yod pa ma yin med pa min zhes gsungs pa ni kun brtags pa dang bral ba'i lta ba yongs su dag pas 'jig rten pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i chos rnams yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang
translated: The statement in the view of the pure that phenomena are neither existent nor nonexistent when analyzed is that phenomena generated by mundane causes and conditions are neither existent nor nonexistent when seen by the pure view free of imagination.

original: ma yin pa nyid du mthong na phyi ma'i mdo gnyis las gsungs pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid du mthong na phyi ma'i mdo gnyis las gsungs pa yang khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: If one comprehends that, one will also comprehend the statements in the two later sūtras.

original: 'di ltar mdo phyi ma gnyis las kyang rkyen las byung ba'i chos rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston par mdzad pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo phyi ma gnyis las kyang rkyen las byung ba'i chos rnams rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston par mdzad pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus the two later sūtras also teach that phenomena arising from conditions are essenceless, so there is no contradiction between them.

original: 'di ltar rkyen las skye ba'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rkyen las skye ba'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of phenomena arising from conditions:

original: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: those that are imagined and those that are dependent.

original: 'di ni don gyis kun du brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid du ston par mdzad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni don gyis kun du brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa nyid du ston par mdzad kyi /
translated: This teaches that the imagined essential nature does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni ma yin no zhes bshad de /
translated: It is not the other-dependent.

original: de yan chad du slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pas gsungs pa dag phan tshun brda sprod par bstan to //
analyzed: de yan chad du slob dpon chos skyong la sogs pas gsungs pa dag phan tshun brda sprod par bstan to //
translated: Up to this point, the statements of the master Dharmmapāla and so on have been presented to show their mutual compatibility.

original: slob dpon bha bya yang mdo sde khungs su bzhag nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: slob dpon bha bya yang mdo sde khungs su bzhag nas 'di skad du /
translated: The master Bhāviveka also cites a sūtra source and says,

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang yod pa yin na /
translated: If the dependent nature exists,

original: ci'i phyir mdo las chos kyi dngos po thams cad ni mi stong pa gang yang med do zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo las chos kyi dngos po thams cad ni mi stong pa gang yang med do zhes gsungs /
translated: why did the Buddha say in the sūtra, “There is not a single phenomenon that is not empty”?

original: gzhan yang ci'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Moreover, why did the Buddha say in the sūtra,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: “The Bhagavat said to Subhūti:🔽The intrinsic reality of phenomena such as form does not exist at all”?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni thams cad du med pa'o zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni thams cad du med pa'o zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis blo gros chen po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: And the Bhagavat said to Mahāmati:

original: chos thams cad kyi dngos po ni skye ba med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dngos po ni skye ba med de /
translated: The entity of all phenomena is nonarisen.

original: sngar yod pa'am sngar med pa yang skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes gal 'dzugs te /
analyzed: sngar yod pa'am sngar med pa yang skye bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes gal 'dzugs te /
translated: Because it is illogical that what already exists or what does not exist previously would arise.

original: slob dpon chos skyong gis ni 'di la dgongs pa yod de dgongs pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: slob dpon chos skyong gis ni 'di la dgongs pa yod de dgongs pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Vasubandhu says that this has a specific intention, and what is that intention?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: mdo sde de dag ni kun du brtags pa rnam par gzhig pa kho na'i ched du gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mdo sde de dag ni kun du brtags pa rnam par gzhig pa kho na'i ched du gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Those sūtras were taught only to eliminate the imaginary.

original: thams cad med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that everything does not exist.

original: gal te thams cad med do zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad med do zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that everything does not exist,

original: 'o na ni log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni log par lta ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then that is the view of nihilism.

original: de lta bu'i dgongs pa ci ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dgongs pa ci ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that this is the intention?

original: mdo gzhan dag las rab tu phye nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las rab tu phye nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is clearly taught in other sūtras.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar 'di skad du /
translated: Thus the Bhagavān previously said,

original: nga ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na la dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med do zhes bstan te /
analyzed: nga ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na la dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med do zhes bstan te /
translated: “I taught that all phenomena lack entityness intending just the imaginary nature that is the entity of the name.

original: @196b gal te kha cig sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang med do zhes zer na stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba de ni log par lta ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: @196b gal te kha cig sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang med do zhes zer na stong pa nyid nyes par bzung ba de ni log par lta ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: If someone, adhering literally, were to say that even the nature of the phenomena of defilement and purification do not exist, that misapprehension of emptiness is called “wrong view.”

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in that same text.

original: do ni de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyi bstan bcos nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: do ni de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyi bstan bcos nyi shu pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the commentary on the Twenty Verses on Consciousness Only composed by Master Vasubandhu, it says:

original: chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du med par shes pa la chos bdag med par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos rnams rnam pa thams cad du med par shes pa la chos bdag med par 'jug pa zhes bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the understanding that phenomena do not exist in any way whatsoever is called “the entrance into the selflessness of phenomena.”

original: byis pa rnams kyis kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag yongs su spangs pa chos rnams kyi bdag med pa gang yin pa de la chos bdag med par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag yongs su spangs pa chos rnams kyi bdag med pa gang yin pa de la chos bdag med par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the complete abandonment of the specific attributes imagined by the childish. That is called “the entrance into the selflessness of phenomena.”

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul gang yin pa brjod du med pa'i chos nyid ci yang med pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir chos bdag med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul gang yin pa brjod du med pa'i chos nyid ci yang med pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir chos bdag med pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the domain of the buddhas is not the inexpressible reality that is nothing whatsoever, therefore it is taught to be the selflessness of phenomena.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /🔽rgyu med pa la nan gyis rgyu yod pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las / rgyu med pa la nan gyis rgyu yod pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, in the Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna composed by Master *Svābhāvika,🔽it says, “Because it forcefully engages the existence of causes in the absence of causes, it is called superimposition.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu la nan gyis med pa nyid du skur ba'i phyir skur ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba nas kun brtags pa la ni sgro 'dogs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu la nan gyis med pa nyid du skur ba'i phyir skur ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba nas kun brtags pa la ni sgro 'dogs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Because it forcefully engages the nonexistence of causes in the presence of existent and nonexistent causes, it is called denial.”🔽From that point, in the imputed, there is only superimposition.

original: skur pa 'debs pa ni med de ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa ni med de ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no denial because there is nothing at all.

original: 'di ltar yod pa la gdong skur pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa la gdong skur pa 'byung bas so //
translated: Because in this way, denial of existence occurs.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur bar mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur bar mi byed de /
translated: In the dependent, there is neither superimposition nor denial.

original: bdag nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists by itself.

original: nga 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa la gdod sgro 'dogs pa yod pas so //
analyzed: nga 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa la gdod sgro 'dogs pa yod pas so //
translated: Since there is superimposition of what does not exist in this way,

original: skur par yang mi byed de yang dag pa ma yin pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skur par yang mi byed de yang dag pa ma yin pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one does not deprecate, because of the mere existence of what is not real.

original: yongs su grub pa la ni sgro 'dogs par mi byed de yang dag par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa la ni sgro 'dogs par mi byed de yang dag par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not superimpose on the consummate, because of the real existence.

original: skur pa kho na yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: skur pa kho na yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin te /
translated: One deprecates only, up to, “it exists.”

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in the Treatise itself in detail.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Moreover, the Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa la med do zhes skur ba gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid log par zin ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa la med do zhes skur ba gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid log par zin ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: “The deprecation that the dependent and the real do not exist is called ‘the wrong understanding of emptiness.’🔽”

original: sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rab tu dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin du rab tu dbye bar bya'o //
translated: This should be analyzed as above.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Moreover, the Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas says:🔽“

original: yod par lta ba la mang du mngon par zhen pa dang / med par lta ba la mang du mngon @197a * //
analyzed: yod par lta ba la mang du mngon par zhen pa dang / med par lta ba la mang du mngon @197a * //
translated: It is to not be attached to the view of existence or the view of nonexistence.🔽

original: par zhen pa'i sems can de dag ni yod par lta ba dang med par lta ba la mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: par zhen pa'i sems can de dag ni yod par lta ba dang med par lta ba la mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who are attached to the view of existence and attached to the view of nonexistence are attached to the view of existence and the view of nonexistence.

original: lta ba rnam pa gnyis po de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yin gyi yang dag pa ni ma yin pas dbu ma'i lam 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa gnyis po de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yin gyi yang dag pa ni ma yin pas dbu ma'i lam 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: Those two views are not real, but are not real, and so they destroy the middle way.

original: dper na la la zhig lam dog par zhugs te /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig lam dog par zhugs te /
translated: For example, suppose someone enters a narrow path

original: 'gro ba ngos gcig tu ni chu shin tu zab pa yod la ngos gcig tu me chen po yod na phyogs gang du song yang 'chi bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'gro ba ngos gcig tu ni chu shin tu zab pa yod la ngos gcig tu me chen po yod na phyogs gang du song yang 'chi bar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: and on one side there is a deep river and on the other side there is a great fire, so that no matter which side one goes to, one will die.

original: yod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / med pa la mngon par zhen pa yang dngos po gnyi ga stod par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yod pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / med pa la mngon par zhen pa yang dngos po gnyi ga stod par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, attachment to existence and attachment to nonexistence are both destroyed.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: stong pa nyid bsdus pa 'di dang / stong pa nyid bcu bdun po dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsdus pa 'di dang / stong pa nyid bcu bdun po dag la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this Compendium of Emptiness and the seventeen kinds of emptiness?

original: smras pa / 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: It is said that there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re ngo bo nyid la bye brag med kyang spyi dang bye brag ni tha dad do zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re ngo bo nyid la bye brag med kyang spyi dang bye brag ni tha dad do zhe'o //
translated: Some say that there is no difference in essence, but that the general and the particular are distinct.

original: kha cig na re stong pa nyid bsdus pa 'dis ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par sel bar byed la snga ma'i stong pa nyid bcu bdun po dag gis ni gzugs brnyan rnam par sel bar byed pa'i phyir bye brag yod do zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re stong pa nyid bsdus pa 'dis ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par sel bar byed la snga ma'i stong pa nyid bcu bdun po dag gis ni gzugs brnyan rnam par sel bar byed pa'i phyir bye brag yod do zhe'o //
translated: Others say that there is a difference because this Compendium of Emptiness eliminates the imagined nature, while the previous seventeen kinds of emptiness eliminate the reflected image.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya again said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'di dag gis ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa du zhig sdud par bgyid lags ces pa 'di man chad ni bcu gsum pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis ting nge 'dzin gzhan rnams bsdu ba zhes bya ba'i sgo
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'di dag gis ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa du zhig sdud par bgyid lags ces pa 'di man chad ni bcu gsum pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis ting nge 'dzin gzhan rnams bsdu ba zhes bya ba'i sgo
translated: The section beginning with Bhagavan, how many kinds of special samādhis are included by these śamatha and vipaśyanā? is the thirteenth chapter, called The Inclusion of Other Samādhis by Śamatha and Vipaśyanā.

original: zhes bya bar ston to //🔽'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar ston to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is taught by the following.

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This also has two parts: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu ngas ji skad du nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa dpag tu med pa ji snyed bstan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'dis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs🔽pa ste / theg pa gsum po thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'di'i nang du bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ngas ji skad du nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par du 'phags pa dpag tu med pa ji snyed bstan pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad 'dis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ste / theg pa gsum po thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'di'i nang du bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: Son of noble family, you should know that all the immeasurable and exalted concentrations of the śrāvakas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas that I have taught are included in this.”

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan gang yang @197b 'dis ma bsdus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan gang yang @197b 'dis ma bsdus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the second reply of the Tathāgata. You should know that all the immeasurable concentrations of the three vehicles are included in this śamatha and vipaśyanā because there is no other concentration that is not included in this one.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'di dag gi rgyu gang gis bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bcu bzhi ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthang ga rgyu dang 'bras bu dang las byed pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong 'di dag gi rgyu gang gis bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bcu bzhi ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthang ga rgyu dang 'bras bu dang las byed pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here on is the fourteenth chapter, called the explanation of the cause, effect, and function of calm abiding and insight.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into three parts:

original: rgyu bstan pa dang / 'bras bu bstan pa dang / las bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu bstan pa dang / 'bras bu bstan pa dang / las bstan pa ste /
translated: the explanation of the cause, the explanation of the effect, and the explanation of the function.

original: 'di ni dang po rgyu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po rgyu bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the explanation of the cause.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: rigs kyi bu tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam par dag pas de dag gi rgyu byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu tshul khrims rnam par dag pa dang / thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rnam par dag pas de dag gi rgyu byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family, their cause is pure morality and pure right view arisen from hearing and reflection. This is the second, the reply.

original: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i tshul khrims thob pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs su yang thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis de dag gi rgyu byed pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i tshul khrims thob pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs su yang thos pa dang bsams pa'i shes rab gnyis kyis de dag gi rgyu byed pas so //
translated: Thus, because of the concentration of those śamatha and vipaśyanā, the morality of liberation that is attained and, even in the situation of distraction, the two wisdoms of hearing and contemplation act as their cause.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi 'bras bu gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi 'bras bu ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gi 'bras bu gang lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi 'bras bu ston to //
translated: The Bhagavān said, The result of those śamatha and vipaśyanā is the purification of the mind and wisdom.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This also has a request and an answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request.🔽The Bhagavān said, Son of noble family, the result of those is the purification of the mind and wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu sems shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pas de dag gi 'bras bu byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sems shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pas de dag gi 'bras bu byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa lan du yang dag par gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This is the answer.

original: 'di yang rnam grangs gnyis kyis bstan te 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam grangs gnyis kyis bstan te 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is also taught in two ways, and this is the first.

original: de la sems shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de la sems shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Among them, “the mind becomes very pure” is the result of śamatha.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi 'bras bu'o //
translated: “Wisdom becomes very pure” is the result of vipaśyanā.

original: 'di dag ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa'o //
translated: These are taught from the perspective of the result that resembles the cause.

original: dbang gi 'bras bu dang sbyar na ni 'bras bu gnyis gnyis thob par 'gyur ba yin no //🔽yang na sems shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i phyir shin tu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang gi 'bras bu dang sbyar na ni 'bras bu gnyis gnyis thob par 'gyur ba yin no // yang na sems shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i phyir shin tu zhes bya'o //
translated: If applied to the result of dominance, one obtains two results.🔽Alternatively, “the mind becomes very pure” and “wisdom becomes very pure” are called “very” because they are uncontaminated.

original: dpe gzhan kha cig las tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes 'byung ba ni nor to //
analyzed: dpe gzhan kha cig las tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / sems shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes 'byung ba ni nor to //
translated: In some other texts, “morality becomes very pure,” “the mind becomes very pure,” and “wisdom becomes very pure” are taught.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dpe gzhan dag dang gtugs pa las kyang @198a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dpe gzhan dag dang gtugs pa las kyang @198a * //
translated: They do not appear in other sūtras that compare.

original: tshul khrims zhes mi 'byung bas so //
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes mi 'byung bas so //
translated: Therefore, they do not appear.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu nyan thos thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gis thob pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni rnam grangs gnyis pas de dag gi 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu nyan thos thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag gis thob pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya bas ni rnam grangs gnyis pas de dag gi 'bras bu bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, you should know that all the virtuous qualities of the world and beyond the world, such as the hearers and the tathāgatas, are the results of attaining śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: This statement in the sūtra is explained differently by different masters.

original: kha cig na re tshig 'dis ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re tshig 'dis ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that this statement refers to the teachings of the hearers, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' yang bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni byang chub sems dpa' yang bzung ba yin te /
translated: The word etc. in this explanation includes bodhisattvas,

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: because the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The sravakas, bodhisattvas, and pratyekabuddhas...

original: kha cig na re 'dir nyan thos zhes gsungs pa nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas kyang bsdus pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'dir nyan thos zhes gsungs pa nyid kyis rang sangs rgyas kyang bsdus pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the word sravaka here also includes pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The others are as explained earlier.

original: kha cig na re stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsdus pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsdus pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that the word etc. includes pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The others are as explained earlier.

original: de ni 'di skad du theg pa gsum po dag gis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du theg pa gsum po dag gis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag thams cad ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis thob par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being taught: “All the mundane and supramundane virtuous qualities of the three vehicles are the results to be attained by means of serenity and insight.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas brnyes pa'i 'bras bu thams cad ni zag pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas brnyes pa'i 'bras bu thams cad ni zag pa med pa yin na /
translated: If all the results attained by the Tathāgatas are uncontaminated,🔽why are they taught to be mundane?

original: ci'i phyir de dag la 'jig rten pa zhes bstan zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag la 'jig rten pa zhes bstan zhe na smras pa /
translated: It is said:

original: 'jig rten pa ni rnams gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni rnams gnyis te /
translated: Mundane has two senses.

original: dang po ni ngo bo nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po ni ngo bo nyid kyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: First, it is called mundane because it is by nature contaminated.

original: gnyis pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis zag pa med pa yin yang 'jig rten pa la dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis zag pa med pa yin yang 'jig rten pa la dmigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Second, it is called mundane because it takes the mundane as its object, even though it is by nature uncontaminated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i ye shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems la sogs pa'o //
translated: the mind and mental factors associated with the knowledge that is attained subsequently.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la yang 'jig rten pa'i chos mnga'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la yang 'jig rten pa'i chos mnga'o //
translated: Therefore, the Lord also has mundane dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis las gang dag bgyid lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi las ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis las gang dag bgyid lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi las ston to //
translated: What are the actions of serenity and insight? and so on, the third, the action of serenity and insight is taught.

original: 'di yang zhu ba @198b gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba @198b gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol pa nyid do //
translated: This is the question.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag gis 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po dag las rnam par thar par byed do /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag gis 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po dag las rnam par thar par byed do /
translated: Son of noble family, they liberate from two kinds of bondage.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely:

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dag las so zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dag las so zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: from the bondage of signs and the bondage of negative tendencies. This is the second, the Tathāgata's true answer.

original: 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las rnam par thar pa'i las byed de /
analyzed: 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis las rnam par thar pa'i las byed de /
translated: It performs the action of liberation from two kinds of bondage.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely:

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dag las so //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba dag las so //
translated: from the bondage of signs and the bondage of negative tendencies.

original: de mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa nyid de /
analyzed: de mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa nyid de /
translated: Some say: The so-called fetter of signs is the aspect of a sign.

original: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis lta ba'i rnam pa de rang dbang med par byed pas mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis lta ba'i rnam pa de rang dbang med par byed pas mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Because contaminated signs make the aspect of view involuntary, they are called the fetter of signs.

original: mtshan ma nyid 'ching ba yin pas mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma nyid 'ching ba yin pas mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Or because signs are the fetter, they are called the fetter of signs.

original: kha cig na re nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni mtshan ma'i 'ching ba'i ngo bo nyid byed de /
analyzed: kha cig na re nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni mtshan ma'i 'ching ba'i ngo bo nyid byed de /
translated: Some say: The afflicted mind is the nature of the fetter of signs.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi dbang gis gzhan mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan ma dag la rang dbang med par byed pas so zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi dbang gis gzhan mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams dmigs par bya ba'i mtshan ma dag la rang dbang med par byed pas so zhes zer te /
translated: Because the other consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness are made involuntary with regard to the signs of their focal objects through the power of the afflicted mind.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na mtshan ma'i 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na mtshan ma'i 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When applied to this explanation, they are called the fetter of signs because they are the fetter of signs.

original: de la gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are also two kinds of bondage of negative reflex actions:

original: dang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la las su mi rung ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la las su mi rung ba'i ngo bo nyid yod pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The first is the essential unserviceability of all dharmas with outflows, which is called the bondage of negative reflex actions.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dang / gcig pa yang ma yin tha dad pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is neither identical with nor different from dharmas with outflows.

original: bdag nyid gud na med pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gud na med pa'i phyir tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to be not different because it is not separate from itself.

original: spangs pa dang ma spangs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //🔽gnyis pa ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni spyir gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spangs pa dang ma spangs pa tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o // gnyis pa ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni spyir gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said to be not identical because of the difference of what is abandoned and what is not abandoned.🔽The second is the seed of the two hindrances, which is called negative reflex action in general.

original: de yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis sa bon la gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dgongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis sa bon la gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called the seed of negative reflex action in two ways:

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mtshan nyid kyi le'u las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa mtshan nyid kyi le'u las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: The extensive explanation should be understood according to the chapter on the characteristics of ultimate truth.🔽

original: // / bam po bzhi bcu bdun pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bzhi bcu bdun pa /
translated: The extensive differentiation should be understood according to the chapter on the characteristics of ultimate reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gags rnam pa lnga gsungs pa gang lags pa de dag las du ni zhi gnas kyi gags dag lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du gags rnam pa lnga gsungs pa gang lags pa de dag las du ni zhi gnas kyi gags dag lags /
translated: Bhagavan, from among the five obstructions that the Bhagavan has taught, how many are obstructions to śamatha?

original: du ni lhag mthong gi gags dag lags /
analyzed: du ni lhag mthong gi gags dag lags /
translated: How many are obstructions to vipaśyanā?🔽How many are obstructions to both?

original: @199a * // du ni gnyi ga'i gags dag lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bco lnga pa zhi gnas kyi gags dang / gnyen por gyur ba rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: @199a * // du ni gnyi ga'i gags dag lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bco lnga pa zhi gnas kyi gags dang / gnyen por gyur ba rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This is the fifteenth chapter, on the analysis of the antidotes to the obstructions to śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into four parts.

original: gags rnam pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi gags su gyur pa bstan pa'i sgo dang / sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sgrib par bstan pa'i sgo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa lnga ru dbye ba'i sgo dang /
analyzed: gags rnam pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi gags su gyur pa bstan pa'i sgo dang / sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sgrib par bstan pa'i sgo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa lnga ru dbye ba'i sgo dang /
translated: The five obstructions are taught as obstructions to serenity and insight, the five obscurations are taught as obscurations to serenity and insight, the five types of distraction are distinguished,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sgrib pa bcu gcig gi gnyen por gyur pa bstan pa'i sgo ste 'di ni dang po'o //🔽dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sgrib pa bcu gcig gi gnyen por gyur pa bstan pa'i sgo ste 'di ni dang po'o // dang po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: and the eleven obscurations to serenity and insight are taught as their antidotes.

original: zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The first has two parts: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba ste /
translated: This is the first request:

original: gnas rnam pa lnga po de dag las /
analyzed: gnas rnam pa lnga po de dag las /
translated: “From among those five topics,

original: du ni zhi gnas kyi gags lags /
analyzed: du ni zhi gnas kyi gags lags /
translated: how many are obstructions to serenity?

original: du ni lhag mthong gi gags lags /🔽du ni gnyi ga'i gags lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: du ni lhag mthong gi gags lags /🔽du ni gnyi ga'i gags lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How many are obstructions to insight?🔽How many are obstructions to both?”

original: de la gags rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las sems kyi 'ching ba lnga zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la gags rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos de kho na nyid grub pa las sems kyi 'ching ba lnga zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The five obstructions are called the five fetters of the mind in the treatise Establishing Suchness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sdig pa'i chos kyis sems 'ching zhing spong bar mi byed pa'i phyir sems kyi 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sdig pa'i chos kyis sems 'ching zhing spong bar mi byed pa'i phyir sems kyi 'ching ba zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called fetters of the mind because they fetter the mind with the nonvirtuous dharmas of affliction and prevent their abandonment.

original: rang gi lus la chags pa dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod pa lnga po dag la chags pa dang / khyim pa dag dang 'dres par mos pa dang / 'phags pa'i gtam la sems kyis mos pa med pa dang / dge ba'i chos cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi lus la chags pa dang / phyi rol gyi 'dod pa lnga po dag la chags pa dang / khyim pa dag dang 'dres par mos pa dang / 'phags pa'i gtam la sems kyis mos pa med pa dang / dge ba'i chos cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: They are attachment to one's own body, attachment to the five external sense objects, delight in mixing with householders, lack of mental delight in the speech of the aryas and being satisfied with a small amount of virtuous dharmas.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon po sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon po sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The compendium of Abhidharma explains:

original: gags ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gags ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes bshad de /
translated: There are three types of obstructions.🔽Therefore it says:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las gags ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las gags ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three obstructions:

original: 'dod chags kyi gags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi gags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi gags so //
translated: the obstructions of attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: gsum po de dag la gnas pa'i phyir lus dang longs spyod la lta ba dang / blo ma byang ba dang 'dre bar gnas pa dang / dge ba cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pas de'i dbang gis dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgrub pa'i phyir gags zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gsum po de dag la gnas pa'i phyir lus dang longs spyod la lta ba dang / blo ma byang ba dang 'dre bar gnas pa dang / dge ba cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pas de'i dbang gis dge ba'i chos rnams mi sgrub pa'i phyir gags zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because they abide in these three, they are called obstructions since they obstruct the attainment of the ārya path, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of stream entry, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of once-return, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of nonreturn, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of arhat, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of pratyekabuddha, and because they obstruct the attainment of the result of buddha.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The Abhidharma treatise Compendium of Various Dharmas states:🔽Because they abide in these three, they are called obstructions since they obstruct the attainment of the ārya path, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of stream entry, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of once-return, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of nonreturn, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of arhat, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of pratyekabuddha, and because they obstruct the attainment of the result of buddha.

original: blo ma byang ba zhes 'byung ba ni mdo 'di nyid las 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams la 'dod pa bzhin du ma thob pa zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: blo ma byang ba zhes 'byung ba ni mdo 'di nyid las 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams la 'dod pa bzhin du ma thob pa zhes gsungs pa nyid do //
translated: The Abhidharma treatise Compendium of Various Dharmas states:🔽Because they abide in these three, they are called obstructions since they obstruct the attainment of the ārya path, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of stream entry, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of once-return, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of nonreturn, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of arhat, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of pratyekabuddha, and because they obstruct the attainment of the result of buddha.

original: gzhan yang chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /🔽gags rnam pa lnga las brtsams nas @199b gags kyi don ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las / gags rnam pa lnga las brtsams nas @199b gags kyi don ston to //
translated: The Abhidharma treatise Compendium of Various Dharmas states:🔽Because they abide in these three, they are called obstructions since they obstruct the attainment of the ārya path, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of stream entry, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of once-return, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of nonreturn, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of arhat, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of pratyekabuddha, and because they obstruct the attainment of the result of buddha.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: The Abhidharma treatise Compendium of Various Dharmas states:🔽Because they abide in these three, they are called obstructions since they obstruct the attainment of the ārya path, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of stream entry, because they obstruct the attainment of the result of once-return, because

original: gzhan yang lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni sems kyi gags rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa ni sems kyi gags rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas te bstan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the view of the body and so on is taught in terms of five types of mental obstructions.

original: lnga gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: lus la lta ba dang / 'dod pa rnams la lta ba dang / 'dre bar gnas par mos pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i rjes su bstan pa dang / gdams ngag med pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pas sems kyi gags su gyur pa'i phyir sems kyi gags zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: lus la lta ba dang / 'dod pa rnams la lta ba dang / 'dre bar gnas par mos pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i rjes su bstan pa dang / gdams ngag med pa dang / dge ba'i chos rnams la cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pas sems kyi gags su gyur pa'i phyir sems kyi gags zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: They are the view of the body, the view of sensual objects, the inclination to live in a crowd, the inclination to be taught in a way that is not suitable, and the lack of instruction. The mental obstructions are so called because one is satisfied with just a little of virtuous qualities.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa kun las btus pa tha dad par gyur ba yang der las gsum par bstan pa 'dir zhi bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa kun las btus pa tha dad par gyur ba yang der las gsum par bstan pa 'dir zhi bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma and the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma that is different from that are taught in the third chapter here in order to pacify them.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni ming bkod par zad kyi /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni ming bkod par zad kyi /
translated: In the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds, only the names are listed.

original: rnam par bshad pa ni med de /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa ni med de /
translated: There is no explanation.

original: de'i phyir 'dir lnga po dag las brtsams nas zhu ba gsol ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir lnga po dag las brtsams nas zhu ba gsol ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, the request is made with reference to those five.

original: rigs kyi bu lus dang longs spyod la lta ba ni zhi gnas kyi gags yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu lus dang longs spyod la lta ba ni zhi gnas kyi gags yin no //
translated: Son of noble family, the view of the body and enjoyments is an obstruction to śamatha.🔽The non-attainment of the teachings of the noble ones as one wishes is an obstruction to vipaśyanā.

original: 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams la 'dod pa bzhin du ma thob pa ni lhag mthong gi gags yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams la 'dod pa bzhin du ma thob pa ni lhag mthong gi gags yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: Thus, the second, the Tathāgata’s reply, is shown.

original: 'di ltar lus la lta ba dang / longs spyod la lta ba rnam pa gnyis po dag ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed pa 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams las 'dod pa bzhin du ma thob pas des ni bstan pa'i dgongs pa rnams rab tu dbye bar mi nus pas de'i phyir lhag mthong la sgrib🔽par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lus la lta ba dang / longs spyod la lta ba rnam pa gnyis po dag ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed pa 'phags pa'i bstan pa rnams las 'dod pa bzhin du ma thob pas des ni bstan pa'i dgongs pa rnams rab tu dbye bar mi nus pas de'i phyir lhag mthong la sgrib🔽par byed do //
translated: Thus, the two views of the body and enjoyments obstruct śamatha. The non-attainment of the teachings of the noble ones as one wishes obstructs vipaśyanā. Since one is unable to distinguish the intended meaning of the teachings, it obstructs vipaśyanā.

original: 'dre bar gnas par mos pa dang / cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni gnyi ga'i gags yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dre bar gnas par mos pa dang / cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni gnyi ga'i gags yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the obstacles to both are:

original: dang po'i phyir ni sgom par mi byed do //
analyzed: dang po'i phyir ni sgom par mi byed do //
translated: (1) the lack of interest in meditation, due to the first, and

original: gnyis pa'i phyir ni sbyor ba mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i gags bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i phyir ni sbyor ba mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i gags bstan pa ste /
translated: (2) the lack of consummation of the practice, due to the second.

original: 'di ltar gnyi ga'i gags ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽'dre bar gnas bar mos pa de'i dbang gis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par mi byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyi ga'i gags ni rnam pa gnyis te / 'dre bar gnas bar mos pa de'i dbang gis ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom par mi byed la /
translated: Thus, the obstacles to both are twofold:🔽(1) the lack of interest in meditation due to the power of the lack of interest in meditation, and

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom pa mthar thug par mi 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i stobs kyis ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong sgom pa mthar thug par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: (2) the lack of consummation of the practice of meditation due to the power of the lack of interest in the consummation of the practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa lnga po gang lags pa de dag las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa lnga po gang lags pa de dag las /
translated: Bhagavan, from among these five obscurations,

original: du ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa lags /🔽du ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa lags /
analyzed: du ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa lags / du ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa lags /
translated: how many are obscurations to śamatha?🔽How many are obscurations to vipaśyanā?

original: du ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa dag lags @200a * //
analyzed: du ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa dag lags @200a * //
translated: How many are obscurations to both?

original: zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sgrib par bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sgrib par bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The passage beginning with “Thus, the five hindrances” teaches the second part, the gateway to the teaching that the five hindrances are hindrances to serenity and insight.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This has two parts:

original: sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la sgrib par bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong la sgrib par bstan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba man chad kyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur pa nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching that the five hindrances are hindrances to serenity and insight, and the teaching that the path of serenity and insight is perfected.

original: dang po yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: dang po yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: The first is taught by the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //🔽rigs kyi bu rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhu ba gsol ba nyid do // rigs kyi bu rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa yin no //
translated: This is the request at the beginning.🔽“Son of noble family, agitation and worry are hindrances to serenity.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang the tshom ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang the tshom ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Drowsiness, torpor, and doubt are hindrances to insight.”

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //🔽'di ltar sgrib pa lnga po dag las rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o // 'di ltar sgrib pa lnga po dag las rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas kyi sgrib pa yin te /
translated: It should be understood that sensual desire and malice are obscurations to both.

original: rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽rmugs pa dang gnyid dang the tshom ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro // rmugs pa dang gnyid dang the tshom ni lhag mthong gi sgrib pa yin te /
translated: Thus, among the five obscurations, excitedness and regret are obscurations to tranquility because they cause distraction.

original: 'di ltar mi gsal zhing nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi gsal zhing nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems ni gnyi ga'i sgrib pa yin te /
translated: Dullness, drowsiness and uncertainty are obscurations to penetrating the real nature because they are not clear and certain.

original: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pas sgrib pa'i nus pa mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa yin pas sgrib pa'i nus pa mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Sensual desire and malice are obscurations to both because they are the fundamental defilements and have the most powerful obscuring capacity.

original: sgrib pa lnga po 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang nges tshig bstan pa ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽de'i phyir 'di nyid las sgrib pa ni lnga yod de /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang nges tshig bstan pa ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o // de'i phyir 'di nyid las sgrib pa ni lnga yod de /
translated: The nature, characteristics, and definitions of these five hindrances should be understood as they are taught in the Great Exegesis.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, in this text, the hindrances are five:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems kyi sgrib pa dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems kyi sgrib pa dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: They are the hindrance of sensual desire, the hindrance of ill will, the hindrance of lethargy-and-sleep, the hindrance of excitedness-and-regret, and the hindrance of doubt.

original: sgrib pa lnga po 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po 'di dag gi ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of these five hindrances?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa'i khams kyi dngos po sum cu'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa'i khams kyi dngos po sum cu'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: They are the nature of thirty things in the desire realm.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems 'dod pa'i khams kyi sde lnga dang so sor sbyar ba'i dngos po bcu dang / rmugs pa dang rgod pa khams gsum gyi sde lnga po dag dang / so sor sbyar na mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston par yang gtogs pa las /🔽mi dge ba kho na sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po bcu dang gnyid ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sde lnga dang sbyar na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston par yang @200b gtogs pa las /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems 'dod pa'i khams kyi sde lnga dang so sor sbyar ba'i dngos po bcu dang / rmugs pa dang rgod pa khams gsum gyi sde lnga po dag dang / so sor sbyar na mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston par yang gtogs pa las / mi dge ba kho na sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po bcu dang gnyid ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sde lnga dang sbyar na dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston par yang @200b gtogs pa las /
translated: The ten things that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the form realm are the five classes of affliction of the form realm that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, such as attachment to form realm objects and malice.🔽The five things that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the formless realm are the five classes of affliction of the formless realm that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, such as attachment to the formless realm and malice.🔽The ten things that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm are the five classes of affliction of the desire realm that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, such as attachment to desire realm objects and malice.

original: mi dge ba kho na sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po lnga dang 'gyod pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin te /🔽dge ba dang mi dge bar yang gtogs pa las /
analyzed: mi dge ba kho na sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po lnga dang 'gyod pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin te / dge ba dang mi dge bar yang gtogs pa las /
translated: The ten things that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the form realm are the five classes of affliction of the form realm that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, such as attachment to form realm objects and malice.

original: mi dge ba kho na'i sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po gcig dang / the tshom ni khams gsum gyi sde bzhir gtogs te /
analyzed: mi dge ba kho na'i sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po gcig dang / the tshom ni khams gsum gyi sde bzhir gtogs te /
translated: The five things that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the formless realm are the five classes of affliction of the formless realm that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, such as attachment to the formless realm and malice.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston par yang gtogs pa las /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston par yang gtogs pa las /
translated: The four things that are obscurations are included in the non-virtuous and indeterminate.

original: mi dge ba kho na sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba kho na sgrib par gzhag pa'i dngos po bzhi ste /
translated: The four things that are obscurations are included in the non-virtuous and indeterminate.

original: des na sgrib pa lnga po de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dngos po sum cu'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na sgrib pa lnga po de dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dngos po sum cu'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, these five obscurations have the nature of thirty things of the desire realm.

original: sgrib pa la mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: sgrib pa la mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhig yod ce na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the obscurations?

original: btsun pa bshes gnyen gyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: btsun pa bshes gnyen gyis 'di skad du /
translated: The Venerable Mitra says:

original: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de nyid mtshan nyid yin la mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid ni ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de nyid mtshan nyid yin la mtshan nyid gang yin pa de nyid ni ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The nature itself is the characteristic and the characteristic itself is the nature.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid ni phan tshun mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid ni phan tshun mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because the nature and characteristic of all phenomena are inseparable.

original: gzhan yang 'dod pa rnams gnyer zhing tshol pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod pa rnams gnyer zhing tshol pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of desire is the pursuit and search for desires.

original: sems can la mnar sems dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni gnod sems kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sems can la mnar sems dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni gnod sems kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of malice is the harmfulness towards sentient beings.

original: lus dang sems phyir ba gang yin pa de ni rmugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang sems phyir ba gang yin pa de ni rmugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of lethargy is that which makes the body and mind unfit for action.

original: lus dang sems 'phyar zhing g-yo ba gang yin pa de ni rgod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang sems 'phyar zhing g-yo ba gang yin pa de ni rgod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of excitedness is that which makes the body and mind restless.

original: sems mi gsal zhing sdud pa gang yin pa de ni gnyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sems mi gsal zhing sdud pa gang yin pa de ni gnyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of sleep is that which makes the mind unclear and withdrawn.

original: yid la gcags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yid la gcags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of regret is that which makes the mind remorseful.🔽The characteristic of doubt is that which makes the mind uncertain.

original: sems yid gnyis zab gang yin pa de ni the tshom gyi mtshan nyid de sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems yid gnyis zab gang yin pa de ni the tshom gyi mtshan nyid de sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid bshad zin to //
translated: The nature and characteristics of the obscurations have now been explained.

original: nges pa'i tshig 'dir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig 'dir bshad par bya ste /
translated: The etymologies will now be explained.

original: ci'i phyir sgrib pa lnga yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgrib pa lnga yin /
translated: Why are they called the five obscurations?

original: sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word “obscuration”?

original: smras pa / bar du gcod pa'i don gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / bar du gcod pa'i don gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said: That which is the meaning of “hindrance” is this:

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir sgrib pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar du gcod pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir sgrib pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is called an obstruction because it obstructs the path of the noble ones and the roots of virtue that are preparatory to the path of the noble ones.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the same text.🔽The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma explains:

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni dge ba'i phyogs gsal bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni sgrib pa'i don to zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni dge ba'i phyogs gsal bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni sgrib pa'i don to zhes bshad de /
translated: The meaning of obstruction is that which does not illuminate the side of virtue.

original: gong du smos pa'i bstan bcos dag las ni sems la sgrib cing dge ba'i phyogs rnams la 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i bstan bcos dag las ni sems la sgrib cing dge ba'i phyogs rnams la 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The treatises mentioned above explain: Because it obstructs the mind and does not engage in the side of virtue.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni nyon mongs pa la spyir sgrib pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni nyon mongs pa la spyir sgrib pa zhes bshad de /
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Practice explains: Afflictions are generally called obstructions.

original: @201a * // de'i phyir de nyid las de kho na'i don la sgrib g-yogs byed pas na sgrib pa rnams so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: @201a * // de'i phyir de nyid las de kho na'i don la sgrib g-yogs byed pas na sgrib pa rnams so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that very text explains: Because they obscure and cover the meaning of reality, they are called obstructions.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las shes bya'i dngos po la shes pa'i sgrib bar gyur pa'i phyir sgrib pa rnams so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las shes bya'i dngos po la shes pa'i sgrib bar gyur pa'i phyir sgrib pa rnams so zhes bshad do //
translated: “Because they are obscurations to the knowledge of things that are to be known, they are obscurations.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las sgrib ba lnga ni gnas skabs lnga dang mi mthun pa las rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las sgrib ba lnga ni gnas skabs lnga dang mi mthun pa las rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
