translated: Moreover, it should be known that the five obscurations are determined in relation to the five states that are incompatible with them.

original: khyim na gnas ba'i yul gyis phrogs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bstan ba dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i 'dun pa sgrib bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khyim na gnas ba'i yul gyis phrogs pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bstan ba dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i 'dun pa sgrib bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The obscuration that consists in the longing for sense-objects is determined in relation to the incompatibility with the teaching of the noble ones, because one who is at home is carried away by the objects of sense desire.

original: chos mthun pa rnams kyis gleng ba dang / sma dbab ba dang / rjes su bstan pa la sogs pas gdul ba mi bzod bas yang dag bar dga' bar bya ba'i chos dang mi mthun ba'i sgo nas gnod sems kyi sgrib pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: chos mthun pa rnams kyis gleng ba dang / sma dbab ba dang / rjes su bstan pa la sogs pas gdul ba mi bzod bas yang dag bar dga' bar bya ba'i chos dang mi mthun ba'i sgo nas gnod sems kyi sgrib pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The obscuration that consists in malice is determined in relation to the incompatibility with the Dharma of those who are well disposed, because one is unable to bear the admonition, censure and instruction of those who are well disposed.

original: zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa rnam par bzhag go //
translated: The obscuration that consists in sloth and sleep is determined in relation to the incompatibility with meditative concentration.

original: lhag mthong dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: and it is the obscuration to insight.

original: chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam phyin ci log med par rab tu 'byed pa dang / chos spyod pa dang ston pa'i bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa rnam par gzhag go zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'bel ba'i gtam phyin ci log med par rab tu 'byed pa dang / chos spyod pa dang ston pa'i bstan pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa rnam par gzhag go zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is the obscuration to doubt because it is the obscuration to the differentiation of the unerring Dharma teaching, to the practice of the Dharma, to the teaching of the Teacher, and to the aspiration for nirvana.

original: sgrib ba lnga rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po dang / de kho na nyid sgrib ba dang chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib ba lnga rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ni bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po dang / de kho na nyid sgrib ba dang chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of the five obscurations should be understood according to the great treatise on differentiation, the compendium of different doctrines, the levels of spiritual practice and the teaching of the characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci tsam gyis na zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par rnam par dag pa thob ba zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhig nas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci tsam gyis na zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par rnam par dag pa thob ba zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa zhig nas dang lhag mthong gi lam gnyis yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nyid ston to //
translated: From here on, the second part is taught, which shows the perfection of both the path of serenity and the path of insight.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhi gnas kyi lam bstan pa dang / lhag mthong gi lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi lam bstan pa dang / lhag mthong gi lam bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the path of serenity and the teaching on the path of insight.

original: re re la yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: re re la yang zhu ba gsol pa dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: Each of these is taught by a request and a reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhig nas kyi lam du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhig nas kyi lam du zhugs pa'o //
translated: This is the request for the path of serenity.

original: rigs kyi bu ji tsam du rmugs pa dang gnyid yod pa dag yang dag bar legs par rab tu bsal bar gyur ba de tsam gyis na zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par dag ba thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ji tsam du rmugs pa dang gnyid yod pa dag yang dag bar legs par rab tu bsal bar gyur ba de tsam gyis na zhi gnas kyi lam yongs su rdzogs pa rnam par dag ba thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa de
translated: Son of noble family, to the extent that sluggishness and sleep are properly, well, and thoroughly dispelled, to that extent the path of serenity is said to be perfected and attained in its entirety.🔽 This is the reply.

original: @201b bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: @201b bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has answered correctly.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rigs kyi bu dang po'i thob pa lta bu la bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang po'i thob pa lta bu la bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Son of noble family, it is not like the attainment of the first [meditation].

original: ci tsam du rgod ba dang 'gyod pa rab tu bsal te yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: ci tsam du rgod ba dang 'gyod pa rab tu bsal te yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa na /
translated: Only when one has completely eliminated agitation and regret,

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid rab tu sel bar byed pas gdod yongs su rdzogs par thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid rab tu sel bar byed pas gdod yongs su rdzogs par thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and completely eliminated dullness and drowsiness, is it called the attainment of complete perfection. This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs par rnam par dag ba thob pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs bar 'gyur ba zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis na lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs par rnam par dag ba thob pa zhes bgyi lags zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs bar 'gyur ba zhus pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, by what means does one attain the complete perfection and purity of the path of insight? This is the question about the complete perfection of the path of insight.

original: rigs kyi bu ji tsam du rgod pa dang 'gyod pa yod pa dag yang dag par legs par rab tu bsal bar gyur pa de tsam gyis na lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs par rnam par dag pa thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ji tsam du rgod pa dang 'gyod pa yod pa dag yang dag par legs par rab tu bsal bar gyur pa de tsam gyis na lhag mthong gi lam yongs su rdzogs par rnam par dag pa thob pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa
translated: Son of noble family, to the extent that agitation and regret are completely and thoroughly removed, to that extent the path of insight is said to be perfectly complete and pure.🔽This is the second.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has spoken the answer correctly.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rigs kyi bu dang po'i thob ba lta bu la bya ba ma yin gyi ji tsam du rmugs pa rab tu bsal ba nas 'gyod pa'i bar du bsal bar gyur pa de tsam gyis na gdod yongs su rdzogs par thob pa zhes bya bas so zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang po'i thob ba lta bu la bya ba ma yin gyi ji tsam du rmugs pa rab tu bsal ba nas 'gyod pa'i bar du bsal bar gyur pa de tsam gyis na gdod yongs su rdzogs par thob pa zhes bya bas so zhes bya ba'i
translated: Son of noble family, it is not like the first attainment. To the extent that sluggishness is thoroughly removed up to regret is removed, to that extent it is said to be perfectly attained.

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sgrib bar bstan pa las /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgrib pa lnga po dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sgrib bar bstan pa las /
translated: Why are the five hindrances taught to be hindrances to serenity and insight?

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod ba ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed la /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod ba ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed la /
translated: Agitation and regret hinder serenity.

original: lhag mthong la ma yin rmugs pa dang gnyid ni lhag mthong la sgrib par byed la zhi gnas yongs su rdzogs pa la ma yin /
analyzed: lhag mthong la ma yin rmugs pa dang gnyid ni lhag mthong la sgrib par byed la zhi gnas yongs su rdzogs pa la ma yin /
translated: Lethargy and sleep are obscurations to insight, but not to the complete accomplishment of serenity.

original: gong du bstan ba dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gong du bstan ba dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that this contradicts the above explanations,

original: smras pa / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni re re la yang sgrib ba gnyis gnyis yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni re re la yang sgrib ba gnyis gnyis yod de /
translated: we reply: Serenity and insight each have two obscurations.🔽The first is an obscuration to their nature and to their characteristics, and the second is an obscuration to their compatibility.

original: dang po ni ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid dang phan tshun rjes su mthun ba'i sgrib pa yin pas rmugs pa ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed la /
analyzed: dang po ni ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid dang phan tshun rjes su mthun ba'i sgrib pa yin pas rmugs pa ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed la /
translated: Lethargy obscures serenity,

original: rgod pa ni lhag mthong la sgrib par byed /
analyzed: rgod pa ni lhag mthong la sgrib par byed /
translated: and excitement obscures insight.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, the Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: rmugs pa ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: rmugs pa ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed do //
translated: Lethargy obscures serenity.

original: rgod pa ni lhag mthong la sgrib bar byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgod pa ni lhag mthong la sgrib bar byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: Excitement obscures insight.

original: bying ba dang yang zhing rno ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bying ba dang yang zhing rno ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because lethargy and sleep have the same nature and because they are compatible with dullness, they are obscurations to serenity.🔽Because excitement and regret have the same nature and because they are compatible with agitation, they are obscurations to insight.

original: gnyis pa ni do bo nyid dang mtshan nyid dang phan tshun bzlog ba'i sgrib pa yin pas rmugs pa ni lhag mthong la sgrib par byed la /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni do bo nyid dang mtshan nyid dang phan tshun bzlog ba'i sgrib pa yin pas rmugs pa ni lhag mthong la sgrib par byed la /
translated: Thus lethargy obscures vipaśyanā and

original: rgod pa de ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: rgod pa de ni zhi gnas la sgrib par byed de /
translated: excitement obscures śamatha.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun @202a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun @202a * //
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma,

original: las btus pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: las btus pa dang / rnam par bshad pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa la sogs pa las /
translated: the treatise Exposition of the Abhidharma, and the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only and so on explain:

original: ji skad du rmugs pa ni lhag mthong gi gnas skabs dang rgod pa ni zhi gnas kyi gnas skabs dang phan tshun mi mthun ba yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad du rmugs pa ni lhag mthong gi gnas skabs dang rgod pa ni zhi gnas kyi gnas skabs dang phan tshun mi mthun ba yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: Lethargy is incompatible with the state of vipaśyanā and excitement is incompatible with the state of śamatha.

original: de'i phyir sgrib ba'i skabs su ni phan tshun mi mthun pa'i sgrib ba bstan pa la 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrib ba'i skabs su ni phan tshun mi mthun pa'i sgrib ba bstan pa la 'dir yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni /
translated: Therefore, in the context of obscurations, the obscurations that are incompatible with each other are taught.

original: so so nas cig car rjes su mthun ba dang / phan tshun mi mthun ba'i sgrib pa gnyis po dag bsal na yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mngon sum du gyur pa na sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i chos du zhig khong du chud bar bgyi 'tshal lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa rnam par g-yeng ba
analyzed: so so nas cig car rjes su mthun ba dang / phan tshun mi mthun ba'i sgrib pa gnyis po dag bsal na yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa'i phyir ro // bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mngon sum du gyur pa na sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i chos du zhig khong du chud bar bgyi 'tshal lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa rnam par g-yeng ba
translated: because they attain complete perfection by removing the two obscurations, which are mutually incompatible and which are to be eliminated by each of them.🔽Bhagavan, when bodhisattvas have realized śamatha and vipaśyanā, how many dharmas should they understand as causes of distraction?

original: rnam pa lnga rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga rab tu dbye ba'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: From here onward is the third chapter, which is called the explanation of the five types of thorough differentiation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang lan du gsungs pa'o //
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni dang po zhi gnas dang lhag mthong skyes bar gyur pa'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i chos du zhig shes bar bya dgos pa zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po zhi gnas dang lhag mthong skyes bar gyur pa'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i chos du zhig shes bar bya dgos pa zhus pa yin no //
translated: This is the request: when śamatha and vipaśyanā have arisen, how many dharmas should be understood as causes of distraction?

original: rigs kyi bu rnam pa lda shes par bya dgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rnam pa lda shes par bya dgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: The second, the correct answer, is indicated by Son of noble family, you should know that there are five types of distraction.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: This is also explained in three parts:

original: grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: the enumeration and brief answer, the enumeration of the names, and the explanation by analyzing the sequence.

original: 'di ni dang po ste rnam par g-yeng ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga yod par shes par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste rnam par g-yeng ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga yod par shes par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the first. It means that distraction should be understood as having five types in brief.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba de dag kyang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba de dag kyang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: Those distractions are explained differently in the various teachings.

original: mdo 'di las ni rnam pa lngar gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni rnam pa lngar gsungs te /
translated: In this sutra, they are said to be five types.

original: mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood according to what is said in the sutra.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang /
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Intention,

original: rnam pa lngar gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngar gsungs te /
translated: they are said to be five types.

original: ming la tha dad pa yod kyang don ni mthun te /
analyzed: ming la tha dad pa yod kyang don ni mthun te /
translated: The names are different, but the meanings are the same.

original: de'i phyir dgongs ba zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs ba zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang nyon mongs pas rnam par g-yeng ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang nyon mongs pas rnam par g-yeng ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: Distraction is twofold: mental distraction and the distraction of afflictions.

original: gzhan gsum ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun no //🔽lang gi tshe bsgyur @202b ba'i bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang rnam pa lngar bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gsum ni mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mthun no // lang gi tshe bsgyur @202b ba'i bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las kyang rnam pa lngar bstan te /
translated: The other three are consistent with the sutra.

original: mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mi mthun no //
analyzed: mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang mi mthun no //
translated: The treatise Transforming the Body into a Deity also presents five types of distraction, but they are not consistent with the sutra.🔽Therefore, that treatise says:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las rnam par g-yeng ba rnam par sel bar byed pa'i phyir rnam par smod pa zhes bya ste /🔽'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las rnam par g-yeng ba rnam par sel bar byed pa'i phyir rnam par smod pa zhes bya ste / 'dis ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston to //
translated: Because it eliminates distraction, it is called the perfection of meditative stabilization.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel ba las rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam ba lnga yod de /🔽ngo bo nyid kyis rnam bar g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel ba las rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam ba lnga yod de / ngo bo nyid kyis rnam bar g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The commentary to that treatise says that there are five types of distraction:

original: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs lnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes ba'i tshogs lnga'o //
translated: Distraction by nature is the five collections of consciousness.

original: phyi rol du g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: External distraction is when the mind is drawn to pleasant forms, sounds, and so forth.🔽Internal distraction is when the mind is drawn to pleasant thoughts.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa pha rol gyi yul la 'phro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa pha rol gyi yul la 'phro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mental consciousness that is dispersed to the objects of others.

original: nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Internal distraction is as follows:

original: sems mtho dman du gyur nas ro myong ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems mtho dman du gyur nas ro myong ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: When the mind is elevated or depressed, it is the experience, etc.

original: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The distraction of negative reflex actions is as follows:

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the grasping of self and possession, etc.

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The distraction of attention is as follows:

original: sems dman pas theg pa chen po spangs nas theg pa chung ngu pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sems dman pas theg pa chen po spangs nas theg pa chung ngu pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: It is the attention of the Hinayana, which abandons the Mahayana because of a low-minded attitude.

original: rnam pa lnga las mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba bton nas ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba bsnan pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga las mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba bton nas ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba bsnan pas so //
translated: This is because, having extracted the distraction of signs from the five types, the distraction of identity is added.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni rnam bar phye ba med do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni rnam bar phye ba med do //
translated: In the commentaries composed by Master Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva, there is no distinction.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang rnam par g-yeng ba rnam ba drug go zhes bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang rnam par g-yeng ba rnam ba drug go zhes bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: The Abhidharma Synthesis and the Abhidharma Synthesis of Various Topics also explain six types of distraction in accord with the teaching in the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes:🔽Therefore the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes states:

original: de'i phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa drug yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa drug yod de /
translated: Distraction has six types:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: the distraction of nature, external distraction, internal distraction, the distraction of signs, the distraction of negative reflex actions and the distraction of mental activity.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang /
translated: The Exposition of the Abhidharma states:

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed ba las 'byung ba dang mthun par rnam pa drug go zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed ba las 'byung ba dang mthun par rnam pa drug go zhes bshad de /
translated: The Differentiation of the Middle and Extremes explains that there are six types of attention in accordance with the occurrence of attention in the sūtra.

original: de la bye brag yod ba yang yid la byed ba ni dang por bstan la /🔽ngo bo nyid ni drug par 'byung ngo //🔽mdo las ni rnam pa lnga'o zhes gsungs na ci'i @203a * //🔽phyir bstan bcos rnams las yang ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya bas bsnan nas gcig tu bsdus te rnam pa drug go zhes bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la bye brag yod ba yang yid la byed ba ni dang por bstan la / ngo bo nyid ni drug par 'byung ngo // mdo las ni rnam pa lnga'o zhes gsungs na ci'i @203a * // phyir bstan bcos rnams las yang ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya bas bsnan nas gcig tu bsdus te rnam pa drug go zhes bstan zhe na /
translated: The attention that is different in type is taught first and the attention that is different in nature is taught last.🔽If the sūtras state that there are five types of attention, why do the treatises add the attention that is different in nature to make six types?

original: smras pa / bstan bcos rnams kyang mdo la brtan nas rnam pa lnga zhes bstan pa'i rigs pa las logs shig tu bstan par gyur pa yang /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos rnams kyang mdo la brtan nas rnam pa lnga zhes bstan pa'i rigs pa las logs shig tu bstan par gyur pa yang /
translated: The treatises are based on the sūtras, but it is reasonable to teach six types of attention because the treatises teach separately from the five types taught in the sūtras.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs ma gtogs pa gnas skabs gzhan dag na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni rnam par g-yeng ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs ma gtogs pa gnas skabs gzhan dag na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag ni rnam par g-yeng ba kho na yin te /
translated: Except for the stage of buddhahood, the five collections of consciousness are distracted in other states.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pas de'i phyir logs shig tu ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pas de'i phyir logs shig tu ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bstan to //
translated: Since it is not meditative equipoise, therefore it is taught separately as natural distraction.

original: mdo las ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par g-yeng ba zhes ma gsungs pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sgrib par byed pa'i ring du gyur pa'i phyir dang / sgrib ba mchog ma yin pa'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma gsungs so //🔽bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las rnam par g-yeng ba lnga yod par bstan pa de yang skyon rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo las ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par g-yeng ba zhes ma gsungs pa ni ting nge 'dzin la sgrib par byed pa'i ring du gyur pa'i phyir dang / sgrib ba mchog ma yin pa'i phyir mdor bsdus nas ma gsungs so // bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las rnam par g-yeng ba lnga yod par bstan pa de yang skyon rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The sutra does not mention natural distraction because it is not a remote obscuration that obscures concentration and because it is not a supreme obscuration, so it is not mentioned in the sutra in brief.

original: mdo dag dang mi mthun pa dang slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang de lta bu'i bshad pa med pa'i phyir tshad mar gzung du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mdo dag dang mi mthun pa dang slob dpon dbyig gnyen dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang de lta bu'i bshad pa med pa'i phyir tshad mar gzung du mi rung ngo //
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, translated by the life-transference of a cow, teaches that there are five distractions, but that also cannot be accepted as valid because it is not in accord with the sutras and because such an explanation does not exist in the commentaries composed by master Vasubandhu and Asvabhāva.

original: de las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don rnams ni mdo'i tshig thad kar bab pa na ston bas de'i phyir 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i tshig gi don rnams ni mdo'i tshig thad kar bab pa na ston bas de'i phyir 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: The other topics of the verses are taught in the sutra itself, where they are directly relevant, so they are not taught here.

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: The distraction of attention, the distraction of external objects, the distraction of internal mind, the distraction of signs, and the distraction of negative influences.

original: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa btang ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa btang ste /
translated: Son of noble family, if bodhisattvas were to abandon the attention associated with the Great Vehicle,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed par ltung bar gyur na de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste ston to
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed par ltung bar gyur na de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste ston to
translated: and were to fall into the attention associated with the hearers and solitary buddhas, that would be known as the distraction of attention.

original: // rnam par g-yeng ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis su rab tu phye nas /
analyzed: // rnam par g-yeng ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na sgo rnam pa gnyis su rab tu phye nas /
translated: These distractions are, in brief, distinguished as two kinds of doors.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa mdo'i tshig gi don bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dod pa mdo'i tshig gi don bshad par bya'o //
translated: After that, the meaning of the words of the verse should be explained.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nges tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges tshig bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the etymology and the explanation of the nature.

original: de la dang po nges tshig bstan pa yang spyi dang bye brag gis bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po nges tshig bstan pa yang spyi dang bye brag gis bstan te /
translated: Among them, first, the explanation of the etymology is also taught by the general and the specific.

original: de la spyi ni rnam par g-yeng ba lda zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyi ni rnam par g-yeng ba lda zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Among them, the general is taught as “distraction”.

original: de la @203b lnga zhes bya ba ni grangs smos pa'o //
analyzed: de la @203b lnga zhes bya ba ni grangs smos pa'o //
translated: Among them, “five” is the mention of the number.

original: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gis ni sems rnam par 'phro bar byed pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gis ni sems rnam par 'phro bar byed pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
translated: By those such as “mental activity”, because they cause the mind to scatter, they are called “distractions”.

original: rnam par bshad pa rnam ba drug las grangs dang bcas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rnam ba drug las grangs dang bcas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: From the six kinds of explanations, it is the explanation with the number.

original: de la bye brag gi ming yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la bye brag gi ming yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Among them, the specific names are also five kinds.

original: yid la byed pa dang phyi rol gyi sems dang / nang gi sems dang mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang phyi rol gyi sems dang / nang gi sems dang mtshan ma dang / gnas ngan len zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: mental attention, external mind, internal mind, signs, and negative reflex actions.

original: de la yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa btang ste /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni mdo las theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa btang ste /
translated: Among these, mental attention is as follows: A sūtra declares, “Having abandoned mental attention associated with the Great Vehicle,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed par ltung bar gyur na de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed par ltung bar gyur na de ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: if one falls into mental attention associated with śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, this is called distraction of mental attention.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two interpretations of this sūtra passage.

original: kha cig na re yid la byed pa nyid rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re yid la byed pa nyid rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that mental attention itself is distraction.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug la /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na rnam par bshad pa rnam pa drug la /
translated: If this explanation is applied to the six kinds of explanation,

original: 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin ta /
analyzed: 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin ta /
translated: this is the explanation of the function of holding.

original: 'di ltar ming la byed pa de nyid rnam par g-yeng ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming la byed pa de nyid rnam par g-yeng ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the very activity of mental attention is distraction.

original: kha cig na re mdo 'di las ni yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par g-yeng ba 'dren par byed pa'i phyir yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes bstan kyang yang dag pa'i don du rnam par g-yeng ba nyid kyis ngo bo🔽nyid byed do zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo 'di las ni yid la byed pa rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par g-yeng ba 'dren par byed pa'i phyir yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes bstan kyang yang dag pa'i don du rnam par g-yeng ba nyid kyis ngo bo nyid byed do zhes zer te /
translated: But in reality, it is the nature of distraction itself that is mental attention.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This explanation is an explanation in terms of the dominant condition.

original: 'di la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two kinds of objects here.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin par bshad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin par bshad do //
translated: This is mental distraction of bodhisattvas.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: Therefore, the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: yang dag pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes 'byung ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes 'byung ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: This is the distraction of correct mental attention.

original: kha cig na re nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig na re nyan thos kyi yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Some say: It is a distraction of mental attention of sravakas.🔽🔽

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las dman pa'i sems kyis yid la byed pa zhes bstan pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las dman pa'i sems kyis yid la byed pa zhes bstan pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Some say: It is a mental distraction of sravakas because it is taught in the treatise Differentiating the middle and extremes that it is attention by an inferior mind.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad ba ni phyi ma yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad ba ni phyi ma yang dag pa yin te /
translated: Although there are two explanations, the latter is correct.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las /
translated: Thus the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma explains:

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i chos de yang rnam pa drug yod par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i chos de yang rnam pa drug yod par bstan pa yin no //
translated: That distracted dharma exists in six types.

original: de la phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba @204a * //
analyzed: de la phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba @204a * //
translated: Distraction to external objects🔽is as follows.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdo las /
translated: A sutra states:

original: gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga bo dag dang 'dres ba'i mtshan ma rnams la yod pa'i rnam par rtog ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i yul la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga bo dag dang 'dres ba'i mtshan ma rnams la yod pa'i rnam par rtog ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i yul la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: If you let your mind go out to the objects of external objects, to the secondary afflictions of discursive thought that exist in the signs of the five external sense objects with which you are mixed up.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di ni don gyis phyi rol ni rnam pa gsum yod par bstan te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di ni don gyis phyi rol ni rnam pa gsum yod par bstan te /
translated: The meaning of this passage from the sutra is that external objects are of three kinds.

original: dang po ni phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag go //
analyzed: dang po ni phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag go //
translated: The first is the five external sense objects.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams te /
translated: The second is the signs of being mixed up with them.

original: de nyid ni 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma yin te /
translated: That is the sign of distraction.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the Vrtti says:

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag dang / 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag dang / 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The five sense objects and the signs of distraction.

original: gsum pa ni snga ma gnyis ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i phyi rol gyi yul rnams te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni snga ma gnyis ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i phyi rol gyi yul rnams te /
translated: The third is external objects other than the first two.

original: yul rnam pa gsum po dag la rnam par g-yeng ba tha dad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yul rnam pa gsum po dag la rnam par g-yeng ba tha dad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The three objects are the essence of the different kinds of distraction.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This explanation is from the point of view of the dominant condition.

original: de la nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mdo las gal te rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis bying ba'am /
analyzed: de la nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mdo las gal te rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis bying ba'am /
translated: Internal distraction is as stated in a sutra: If one is afflicted by any of the internal passions, such as torpor, sleep,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'am /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'am /
translated: the taste of meditative concentration,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur na de'i nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur na de'i nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: or the secondary passions of meditative concentration, then one should know that the mind is internally distracted.

original: de la nang du sems zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi sems so //
analyzed: de la nang du sems zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi sems so //
translated: Internal mind refers to the internal mind of meditative concentration that is concomitant with meditative concentration.

original: de ni 'di skad du nang gi ting nge 'dzin la sgrib par gyur pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du nang gi ting nge 'dzin la sgrib par gyur pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: This means that there are four kinds of internal obstacles to meditative concentration.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang bying ba la sogs ba'i las kyi nus pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi sems la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir nang gi snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang bying ba la sogs ba'i las kyi nus pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi sems la sgrib par byed pa'i phyir nang gi snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it obscures the mind of internal meditative concentration through any of the secondary afflictions of meditative concentration, such as lethargy, sleep, excitation, regret, and so on, it is called internal meditative concentration.

original: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re rmugs pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag nyid la rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re rmugs pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag nyid la rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the four, lethargy and so on, are the nature of distraction.

original: kha cig na re rmugs pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis drangs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid ces zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re rmugs pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis bskyed pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis drangs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid ces zer te /
translated: Others say that the nature of distraction is drawn out by afflicted minds generated by the power of lethargy and so on.

original: bshad ba rnam pa gnyis kyi don yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad ba rnam pa gnyis kyi don yang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the two explanations should be understood as before.

original: de la mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mdo las gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la @204b brten nas nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma rnams yid la byed na de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o🔽zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mdo las gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la @204b brten nas nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma rnams yid la byed na de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: If you attend to signs that are objects of meditation for internal concentration in dependence on external signs, that is called distraction to signs.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas phyi rol gyi mtshan ma yid la byed kyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas phyi rol gyi mtshan ma yid la byed kyi /
translated: It is said that you attend to external signs in dependence on concentration.🔽When you enter concentration, you are free from verbal expression.

original: ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i tshe na tshig gi brjod pa dang bral bas rgyu dang rkyen des na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sgrib par byed pas mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i tshe na tshig gi brjod pa dang bral bas rgyu dang rkyen des na zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sgrib par byed pas mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That cause and condition obscures calm abiding and insight, so it is called distraction to signs.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid bstan ba ni gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid bstan ba ni gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The nature of the two explanations should be understood as above.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi lus kyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam bar dgrol ba'i mdo las ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi lus kyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:🔽Mentally attending to the signs of the objects of your own body based on external signs is called “distraction by signs.”🔽Also, the treatise Explanation of the “Treasury of Abhidharma” says:

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par bshad ba las ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa la brten nas nang gi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par bshad ba las ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa la brten nas nang gi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Mentally attending to the signs of the objects of your own body based on mentally attending to external signs is called “mentally attending to the signs of the objects of your own body.”

original: de ltar na mdo sde dang bstan bcos rnams las kyang mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang don mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo sde dang bstan bcos rnams las kyang mdo 'di las gsungs pa dang don mthun pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the sūtras and the treatises agree on the meaning of this sūtra.

original: bstan pa gzhan dag las mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i bye brag yod pa ni mdo'i tshig thad kar bab pa'i tshe bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pa gzhan dag las mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i bye brag yod pa ni mdo'i tshig thad kar bab pa'i tshe bshad par bya'o //
translated: The differences between the other teachings and this one will be explained when we reach the relevant passages in the sūtra.

original: de la gnas dan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mdo las gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas ba las byung ba'i tshor ba la gnas ngan len gyi lus kyis nga'o snyam ba'i rlom sems skyed par byed na de ni gnas🔽ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas dan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mdo las gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas ba las byung ba'i tshor ba la gnas ngan len gyi lus kyis nga'o snyam ba'i rlom sems skyed par byed na de ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Sūtra says, “If the internal mental activity generates the pride of ‘I am’ due to the body of negative propensities that arises from the condition of feeling, that is called the distraction of negative propensities.”

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bde ba la bdag gir 'dzin cing gnas dan len gyi lus la nga'o snyam du rlom sems skyed pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i bde ba la bdag gir 'dzin cing gnas dan len gyi lus la nga'o snyam du rlom sems skyed pa'o //
translated: That is, one grasps the pleasure of abiding in samādhi as mine and generates the pride of thinking “I am” in the body of negative propensities.

original: yang na gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba la sogs pas dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa la gnas ngal len gyi sa bon gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i nga rgyal gyis snga
analyzed: yang na gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas pa las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba la sogs pas dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa la gnas ngal len gyi sa bon gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i bdag tu lta ba'i nga rgyal gyis snga
translated: Or, if the internal mental activity generates the pride of thinking “I am” due to the condition of the object of observation of the feeling of pleasure and so on, that is called the distraction of negative propensities.

original: ma'i tshor ba rnams la bdag tu lta ba skyed pa dang / bdag go snyam du nga rgyal bskyed pa ste bdag tu lta ba'i nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba de nyid la gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma'i tshor ba rnams la bdag tu lta ba skyed pa dang / bdag go snyam du nga rgyal bskyed pa ste bdag tu lta ba'i nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba de nyid la gnas ngan len zhes bya'o //
translated: That distraction concomitant with the pride of the view of self is called “negative reflex.”

original: don rnam pa gnyis las bshad ba snga ma dang sbyar na ni gnas ngan len gyi lus la brten nas bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa skyes pas rgyu dang rkyen des bskyed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba la @205a * //🔽gnas ngan len zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: don rnam pa gnyis las bshad ba snga ma dang sbyar na ni gnas ngan len gyi lus la brten nas bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa skyes pas rgyu dang rkyen des bskyed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba la @205a * // gnas ngan len zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: If this is applied to the former explanation of the two topics, it shows that because the view of self and so on are generated in dependence on the body of negative reflex, the distraction generated by those causes and conditions is called “negative reflex.”

original: bshad pa phyi ma dang sbyar na ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir gnas ngan len zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa phyi ma dang sbyar na ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir gnas ngan len zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: If it is applied to the latter explanation, it shows that because it is concomitant with the view of self and so on, it is called “negative reflex.”

original: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here there are also two explanations.

original: kha cig na re bdag tu lta ba dang nga rgyal la sogs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re bdag tu lta ba dang nga rgyal la sogs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Some say: The view of self, pride, etc. are called the distraction of negative instinct.

original: kha cig na re de las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re de las byung ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: They are the nature of distraction that arises from that.

original: de la gnyis po'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: de la gnyis po'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: The explanation of the nature of the two is not consistent.

original: slob dpon yang dag bden pas theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa'i brjed byang byas pa las kyang rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid ston to /
analyzed: slob dpon yang dag bden pas theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa'i brjed byang byas pa las kyang rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid ston to /
translated: Master Samghabhadra's notes on the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle also teaches the nature of the five types of distraction.

original: gzhan nas bstan pa dag dang bye brag tu gyur pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan nas bstan pa dag dang bye brag tu gyur pa med do //
translated: There is no difference from what is taught elsewhere.

original: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni sde pa rnams kyi brjed byang dang bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni sde pa rnams kyi brjed byang dang bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las 'byung ste /
translated: The extensive analysis appears in the notes of the schools and in the treatise Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes.

original: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: mangs kyis dogs nas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: Fearing too much, it is not written here.

original: de la yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Mental distraction is also explained as twofold:

original: kha cig na re lnga kun du 'gro ba las 'di ni yid la byed pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: kha cig na re lnga kun du 'gro ba las 'di ni yid la byed pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Some say: It is the nature of the five omnipresent mental factors,

original: yid la byed pa de yang shes rab rnam pa gsum dang ldan no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa de yang shes rab rnam pa gsum dang ldan no //
translated: and that mental factor is associated with the three types of wisdom.

original: yang na dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum du yang dgongs te /🔽bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las rnam par g-yeng ba ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i rkyen smos nas yid la byed pa zhes bstan pa yin no zhes bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum du yang dgongs te / bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las rnam par g-yeng ba ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i rkyen smos nas yid la byed pa zhes bstan pa yin no zhes bshad do zhe'o //
translated: Or it is the nature of the three types of virtue and so on.🔽The Abhidharma treatise Compendium of Various Dharmas states: Distraction is taught through mentioning the condition of distraction.

original: kha cig na re nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nang nas rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid de yid la byed pa'i rkyen smos nas rnam par g-yeng ba de bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nang nas rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid de yid la byed pa'i rkyen smos nas rnam par g-yeng ba de bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: It is the nature of distraction from among the branch afflictions and distraction is taught through mentioning the condition of mental attention.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: The treatise Differentiating the Middle and Extremes states:

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par g-yeng ba la brten nas phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par g-yeng ba la brten nas phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bshad de /
translated: The nature of secondary afflictions is distraction, which is mental distraction to external objects.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang 'du 'dzi dang yul gzhan gsum po dag la sems rnam par 'phro bar byed pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang 'du 'dzi dang yul gzhan gsum po dag la sems rnam par 'phro bar byed pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of distraction from secondary afflictions because it causes the mind to scatter to the five sense objects, to social interactions, and to the three other objects.

original: de la nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de la nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are also two explanations of internal mental distraction.

original: kha cig na re bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las @205b btus pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin du chos rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid de 'di ltar bying ba dang rgod pa dang ro myang ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las @205b btus pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin du chos rnam pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid de 'di ltar bying ba dang rgod pa dang ro myang ba'o //
translated: Some say that it is the nature of three phenomena, as taught in the treatise Differentiating the Middle and Extremes, the Compendium of Abhidharma, and the Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna: laxity, excitation, and relishing.

original: yang na bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa bzhin du chos bzhi'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: yang na bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa bzhin du chos bzhi'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Alternatively, they are the nature of four qualities, as explained in the treatises and in this very sūtra.🔽🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Or, as the treatise Attainment of Knowledge and this sutra explain, it is the nature of four dharmas:🔽sloth, sleep,

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang dman pa'i rol sred pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang dman pa'i rol sred pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: and the secondary mental afflictions.

original: de la dman pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi rtsal lo //
analyzed: de la dman pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi rtsal lo //
translated: Among them, sloth is the potential of sleep.

original: yang na chos lnga'i ste dman pa nyid ni le lo yin pas so zhe'o //
analyzed: yang na chos lnga'i ste dman pa nyid ni le lo yin pas so zhe'o //
translated: Or, it is the nature of five dharmas, because sloth is laziness.

original: kha cig na re bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i phyir rnam par g-yang bskyed pas bying ba la sogs pas smos nas rnam par g-yeng ba bsten pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i stobs kyis nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i phyir rnam par g-yang bskyed pas bying ba la sogs pas smos nas rnam par g-yeng ba bsten pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: Because it is afflicted by the power of torpor, excitation, etc., it is distraction that is mentioned by the words “torpor, etc.”

original: de la mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mdun rol du thob pa'i mtshan ma rnams nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed par gyur pa'am /🔽yang na phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi mtshan ma la brten nas /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi mdun rol du thob pa'i mtshan ma rnams nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed par gyur pa'am / yang na phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi mtshan ma la brten nas /
translated: The distraction of signs is the attention given to the signs of the sphere of one's own samādhi, or to the signs of external form, on the basis of the signs obtained prior to samādhi.

original: nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o //🔽yang na mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni rgyu ston pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi gzugs kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa'o // yang na mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni rgyu ston pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The distraction of attention is the attention given to the signs of the sphere of one's own samādhi, on the basis of the signs of external form.

original: yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: Or, signs refers to the signs that indicate the cause, and attention refers to the attention that has become the essence.

original: kha cig na re 'di ni yid la byed pa'i rkyen smos nas rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa yin pas snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni yid la byed pa'i rkyen smos nas rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa yin pas snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Some say that this teaches distraction by mentioning the condition of attention, so it should be understood as before.

original: de la gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba la lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi sa bon ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba la lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi sa bon ni gnas ngan len zhes bya ste /
translated: The distraction of negative tendencies refers to the seeds of views and pride, which are called negative tendencies.

original: de dag gis rkyen byas pas bdag nyid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin cing nga'o snyam du rlom par byed pas mngon du spyod pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang pa'o snyam du rlom pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid byed do
analyzed: de dag gis rkyen byas pas bdag nyid kyi bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin cing nga'o snyam du rlom par byed pas mngon du spyod pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang pa'o snyam du rlom pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid byed do
translated: Thus, the first view of self is the nature of the actual practice of the view of self.

original: // yang na bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam du rlom pa las rnam par g-yeng ba 'byung bas rnam par g-yeng ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: // yang na bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam du rlom pa las rnam par g-yeng ba 'byung bas rnam par g-yeng ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhe'o //
translated: Or, the view of self and the conceit I am are the nature of distraction because distraction arises from the view of self and the conceit I am.

original: gong du bstan pa'i bshad pa rnam pa gnyis la gal te bshad pa dang po dang sbyar bar gyur na /
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i bshad pa rnam pa gnyis la gal te bshad pa dang po dang sbyar bar gyur na /
translated: If the above two explanations are applied to the first explanation,

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bstan pa de dag ji ltar khong du chud cing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las bstan pa de dag ji ltar khong du chud cing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: how can one understand and explain the teachings in the Abhidharmasamuccaya and the Abhidharmasamuccayabhāsya?

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: For the Abhidharmasamuccaya states:🔽What is the view of the self?

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid @206a * //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid @206a * //
translated: The nature of distraction

original: de yang rnam pa drug go zhes bstan la /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa drug go zhes bstan la /
translated: It is taught that there are six types of distraction.

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bshad pas so zhe na /
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid la rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bshad pas so zhe na /
translated: But the Compendium of Abhidharma states that the nature of secondary mental affliction is distraction.

original: smras pa / de la ngo bo nyid rnam par g-yeng ba la brten nas rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: smras pa / de la ngo bo nyid rnam par g-yeng ba la brten nas rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: We reply: Since the nature of distraction is taught in dependence on the nature of distraction, there is no contradiction.

original: gal te bshad pa phyi ma dang sbyar bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bshad pa phyi ma dang sbyar bar gyur na /
translated: If you apply the latter explanation,

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa las bstan pa de dag ji ltar khong du chud cing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa las bstan pa de dag ji ltar khong du chud cing rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: how can you understand and explain the teachings in the treatise Differentiating the Middle and the Extremes and so on?

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos de nyid las ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o zhes bshad pas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos de nyid las ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'o zhes bshad pas so zhe na /
translated: For that treatise explains that distraction by nature is the fivefold collection of consciousness.

original: smras pa / rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: He replied: There are two kinds of distraction.

original: dang po ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: dang po ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
translated: The first is the distraction of the secondary mental afflictions,

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na'o //
translated: which is the nature of the mental afflictions themselves.

original: gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni mnyam pa nyid las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir spyir rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams kyi rnam par shes pa lnga po dag ni mnyam pa nyid las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir spyir rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The second is distraction in general, which is the five kinds of consciousness that occur in those who are not buddhas because they do not arise from meditative equipoise.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pa yang yin te /
translated: That is also the conceptualization of a nature.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise The Establishment of Representation-Only says,

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa lnga po dag las rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bstan pa ni gzhan dag las byung ba bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa lnga po dag las rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bstan pa ni gzhan dag las byung ba bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: “Moreover, the teaching that the five kinds of consciousness are distraction is a teaching about what occurs in those who are not buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas las byung ba'i bstan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas las byung ba'i bstan pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung bas /
translated: It is not a teaching about what occurs in buddhas.”

original: des na rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya bas na de'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya bas na de'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since the five consciousnesses are called “distraction,” there is no contradiction between them.

original: don bshad zin to //
analyzed: don bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the term has been explained.

original: da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni tshig gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now the meaning of the term will be explained.

original: 'di yang rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa lnga rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid las rnam pa lngar dbye ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa lnga rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid las rnam pa lngar dbye ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: Since the five types of distraction are distinguished and explained in the above passage, they are classified as five types. This is the first type.

original: de la theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: The passage from the Yogācārabhūmi states: “What is the cultivation of attention associated with the Mahāyāna?

original: 'di ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa 'am /
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas who abide in the reality of bodhisattvas, who have not entered the faultless state of reality,

original: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don la lta ba zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don la lta ba zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The same text says, Those who are not yet engaged in the faultless state of reality, or those who are engaged in the faultless state of reality, but who do not have the view of the benefit of others or the view of the benefit of self, are called 'those who practice the vehicle of the disciples.'

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the teaching in that text.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las de la nyan @206b thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sgom pa gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'di ltar de ni nyan thos kyi chos nyid la gnas pa yang dag pa nyid du skyon med par ma zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las de la nyan @206b thos kyi theg pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa sgom pa gang zhe na / smras pa / 'di ltar de ni nyan thos kyi chos nyid la gnas pa yang dag pa nyid du skyon med par ma zhugs pa'am /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, “What is the cultivation of attention associated with the vehicle of the disciples?

original: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa sems can gyi don la mi lta ba bdag gi don la lta ba zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la zhugs pa sems can gyi don la mi lta ba bdag gi don la lta ba zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said: Those who are not yet engaged in the faultless state of reality, or those who are engaged in the faultless state of reality, but who do not have the view of the benefit of sentient beings, or the view of the benefit of self, are called ‘those who practice the vehicle of the disciples.’

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail according to the teaching in that text.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun par 'byung ste /
translated: The Vyakhyayukti also teaches in a way that accords with the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: de ni 'di skad du yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa spangs nas theg pa 'og ma gnyis dang ldan pa'i yid la byed na zhes bstan par 'gyur ro
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du yang dag pa nyid du skyon med pa la ma zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa spangs nas theg pa 'og ma gnyis dang ldan pa'i yid la byed na zhes bstan par 'gyur ro
translated: That is to say, it is taught that the bodhisattva who has not entered the faultless state of reality should abandon the attention associated with the Great Vehicle and should cultivate the attention associated with the two lower vehicles.

original: // yid la byed pa de yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: // yid la byed pa de yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: Moreover, the explanations of attention in the scriptures are not consistent.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mtshan ma yang dag pa'i dran pa btang ste theg pa gnyis kyi dran pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i mtshan ma yang dag pa'i dran pa btang ste theg pa gnyis kyi dran pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Abandon the signs of true mindfulness associated with the Great Vehicle and cultivate the mindfulness of the two lower vehicles.

original: lang gi tshe bsgyur ba theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
analyzed: lang gi tshe bsgyur ba theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las ni /
translated: Vasubandhu's Commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle says:

original: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The distraction of attention is as follows.

original: dman pa'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i yid la byed pa btang nas theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dman pa'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po'i yid la byed pa btang nas theg pa dman pa'i yid la byed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The inferior attitude is the abandonment of the bodhisattva's attention to the Great Vehicle and the adoption of the attention of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya states,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa bzhag nas theg pa gzhan la 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i rnam par 'phro ba gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa bzhag nas theg pa gzhan la 'jug pa dang gnas pa'i rnam par 'phro ba gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is the scattering of attention to other vehicles and to other meditative concentrations.🔽The commentary to that text states,

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan las snyoms par 'jug pa dang / theg pa gzhan la brten pa snga ma la ltos pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan las snyoms par 'jug pa dang / theg pa gzhan la brten pa snga ma la ltos pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It should be understood that distraction is the scattering of attention to other meditative concentrations and to other vehicles in relation to the previous one.

original: 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba'i dbang du byas te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par g-yeng ba'i dbang du byas te bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained from the perspective of distraction that is the nature of secondary affliction.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par bshad pa la sogs pa las ni yid la byed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par bshad pa la sogs pa las ni yid la byed pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise Differentiating the Middle and Extremes and the Explanation of the Explanation and so on state:

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa rnying 'gyur las ni sems pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa rnying 'gyur las ni sems pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The old translation of Differentiating the Middle and Extremes states:

original: sems pa dang dran pa zhes bya ba yang yid la byed pa'i rnam grangs yin te /🔽lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ming gdags pa mi mthun @207a * //
analyzed: sems pa dang dran pa zhes bya ba yang yid la byed pa'i rnam grangs yin te / lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ming gdags pa mi mthun @207a * //
translated: The terms intention and recollection are synonyms of attention.

original: par gyur pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu brgyad pa /
analyzed: par gyur pa yin no / // / bam po bzhi bcu brgyad pa /
translated: This is because the translators had different ideas and their designations of terms are inconsistent.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag dang 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i yul la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag dang 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i yul la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na /
