translated: If you allow your mind to engage in the mental affliction of conceptualizing the signs of objects that are mixed with the five external sense objects or if you allow your mind to scatter to external objects of meditation,

original: de ni phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba ston to //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa phyi rol du sems rnam par g-yeng ba ston to //
translated: This shows the second kind of mental distraction, external.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This passage from the sutra is divided into two parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the explanation and the summary.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te //
translated: This mental distraction is explained differently in the various teachings.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni dge ba la zhugs pa'i tshe //
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las ni dge ba la zhugs pa'i tshe //
translated: The Abhidharma-samuccaya states that when one is engaged in virtue,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems rnam par 'phro ba'o zhes 'byung ste //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems rnam par 'phro ba'o zhes 'byung ste //
translated: the mind scatters to the five sense pleasures.

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa'i nang nas 'di nyid kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa'i nang nas 'di nyid kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary on this passage from the Abhidharma-samuccaya-vyākhyā says:🔽When one is engaged in the cultivation of virtue such as obtaining,

original: 'di ltar thob pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la sbyor ba bsgom pa na de la dmigs pa btang nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar thob pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la sbyor ba bsgom pa na de la dmigs pa btang nas /
translated: one abandons the object of that virtue and

original: phyi rol du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems rnam par 'phro bar rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems rnam par 'phro bar rig par bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It should be understood that the mind is distracted outwardly when it is engaged with the five sense pleasures.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni phyi rol gyi yul zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni phyi rol gyi yul zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise Madhyāntavibhāga says, “external objects.”

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa gsar 'gyur dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni dmigs pa la sems rnam par 'phro ba zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa gsar 'gyur dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni dmigs pa la sems rnam par 'phro ba zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise Vijñaptimātratāsiddhi says, “the mind is distracted to the object.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las rnam pa gnyis la dmigs na nyams par 'gyur te //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las rnam pa gnyis la dmigs na nyams par 'gyur te //
translated: The treatise Vyakhyāyukti says, “When one focuses on two things, one degenerates.

original: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang // 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang // 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The five sense pleasures and the signs of crowds.”

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni nyams par 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum dang ldan par bshad de /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni nyams par 'gyur ba rnam pa gsum dang ldan par bshad de /
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought explains three things that cause degeneration.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang 'du 'dzi'i gnas dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang 'du 'dzi'i gnas dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to the five sense pleasures, to the distractions of society, and to the signs of conditioned things.

original: mdo 'di nyid las ni yul rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las ni yul rnam pa gsum las brtsams nas phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba ston par mdzad do //
translated: In this very sūtra, external distraction is taught beginning from the three types of objects.

original: de la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid yang dag par bstan te /
analyzed: de la sems rnam par 'phro bar gtong na zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid yang dag par bstan te /
translated: There, if one lets the mind go out indicates the three types of distraction.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems rnam par 'phro ba dang / 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams la rnam par 'phro ba dang / @207b yul snga ma gnyis las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa'i yul la sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la sems rnam par 'phro ba dang / 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams la rnam par 'phro ba dang / @207b yul snga ma gnyis las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa'i yul la sems rnam par 'phro ba'o //
translated: It is the mind going out to the five sense pleasures, going out to the signs of the mixed, and going out to the object of meditation other than the previous two objects.

original: de la gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag ces bya bas ni yul dang po smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag ces bya bas ni yul dang po smos pa yin te /
translated: There, if one lets the mind go out to the external five sense pleasures refers to the first object.

original: sems kyi rjes su mthun pa'i yul lnga po dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su mthun pa'i yul lnga po dag ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: The five objects that are suitable for the mind are called the five sense pleasures.

original: 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du 'dzi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i mtshan ma rnams zhes bya ba ni 'du 'dzi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The phrase “signs of distraction” refers to the characteristics of distraction.

original: yul gnyis pa smos pa'o //
analyzed: yul gnyis pa smos pa'o //
translated: The phrase “two objects” refers to the first two objects.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma zhes ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang 'du 'dzi'i mtshan ma zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, the treatise Differentiation of the Middle and Extremes states, “The five sense pleasures and the signs of distraction.”

original: yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i yul snga ma gnyis kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji snyed yod pa dag las spyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i yul snga ma gnyis kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ji snyed yod pa dag las spyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the secondary affliction of the conception of existence” refers to the secondary afflictions that occur in relation to the first two objects. In general, they are called “conceptions”

original: thams cad la yang dmigs pa la gtong pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yang dmigs pa la gtong pa'i nus pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the power to focus on all objects.

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i yul zhes bya bas ni yul gsum pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa'i yul zhes bya bas ni yul gsum pa smos pa ste /
translated: The phrase “external objects” refers to the third object.

original: snga ma'i yul gnyis po dag las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i yul gnyis po dag las gzhan pa dbang po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
translated: The forms of the sense faculties and so on, which are different from the first two objects, are called “external.”

original: 'dir yang yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la zhes smos pa'i rigs pa las /
analyzed: 'dir yang yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la zhes smos pa'i rigs pa las /
translated: Here, the term “afflictive obstructions of the conceptualization of existence” is a type of term.

original: snga ma'i zlas khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas gsungs te /
analyzed: snga ma'i zlas khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdor bsdus nas gsungs te /
translated: Since it is understood by the prior term, it is stated concisely.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las yul rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i rjes la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las yul rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i rjes la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, after teaching the three types of objects in the Sutra Unraveling the Intention, the Buddha taught the term “afflictive obstructions.”

original: la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rigs pa'i sgo bstan pa las dgar ba'i don yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: la zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos rigs pa'i sgo bstan pa las dgar ba'i don yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The term “and so on” indicates that the treatise Ornament for the Middle Way teaches that the term “and so on” has the meaning of “and so forth.”

original: de ni 'di skad du yul rnam pa gsum po dag la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las khro ba la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dgar zhing sems rnam par 'phro ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gcig kho na
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du yul rnam pa gsum po dag la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las khro ba la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dgar zhing sems rnam par 'phro ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gcig kho na
translated: This is stated as follows: “From among the afflictive obstructions of the conceptualization of the three types of objects, anger and so forth are the afflictive obstructions of the mind being scattered.”

original: phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir la zhes bya ba gsungs so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to teach external distraction, he says, “and” and so on.

original: gal te rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis bying ba'am /
analyzed: gal te rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis bying ba'am /
translated: If one is afflicted by dullness and drowsiness,🔽or by any of the afflictions of relishing meditative concentration or the secondary afflictions of meditative concentration, one should know that internal distraction is present.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba 'am snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur na de'i nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba🔽ston to // mdo'i @208a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba 'am snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur na de'i nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ston to // mdo'i @208a * //
translated: This teaches the third type of internal distraction.

original: tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This passage from the sutra is divided into two parts:

original: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa dang mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the explanation and the summary.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas de'i phyir bstan pa rnams las 'byung ba sngar bstan nas /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba 'di yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas de'i phyir bstan pa rnams las 'byung ba sngar bstan nas /
translated: Since these types of distraction are explained differently in the various teachings, after first teaching the types of distraction that occur in the teachings,

original: de'i 'og tu mdo'i tshig gi don bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mdo'i tshig gi don bstan par bya'o //
translated: the meaning of the sutra passage is then taught.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma says:🔽🔽

original: dge ba la zhugs pa na bying ba dang ro myong bar byed pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge ba la zhugs pa na bying ba dang ro myong bar byed pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma says, “When you are engaged in virtue, laxity and taste are the hindrances.”

original: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa'i nang nas 'di nyid kyi 'grel ba las ni bying ba dang rgod pa dang ro myang ba 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las nyams par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa'i nang nas 'di nyid kyi 'grel ba las ni bying ba dang rgod pa dang ro myang ba 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las nyams par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The commentary on this passage in the Compendium of Abhidharma says, “Because laxity, excitement, and taste cause you to fall from meditative stabilization.”

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba dang / rgod pa ni nang gi g-yeng ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba dang / rgod pa ni nang gi g-yeng ba'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes says, “The taste of meditative stabilization and excitement are internal distractions.”

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna called Changing the Ways of the World says,

original: nang gi sems rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nang gi sems rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Internal mental distraction is as follows:

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems mtho dman du gyur pa dang / ro myang ba'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sems mtho dman du gyur pa dang / ro myang ba'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The mind is distracted and fluctuates between high and low states, and you experience a sense of taste.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition states:

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis dma' bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis dma' bar gyur pa'am /
translated: It is a mental state that is low due to lethargy and sleep,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ro myang ba'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ro myang ba'am /
translated: or it is a mental state that relishes meditative concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir sems rnam par g-yeng bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyir sems rnam par g-yeng bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: or it is a mental state that is distracted due to the secondary afflictions of various meditative concentrations.🔽The Sutra Unraveling the Intention states:🔽If bodhisattvas are overcome by sleep,🔽if they are attached to meditative concentration with the mind,

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni gal te byang chub sems dpa' gnyid kyis non pa dang / sems kyis ting nge 'dzin la mngon par zhen pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan gyi nyon mongs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni gal te byang chub sems dpa' gnyid kyis non pa dang / sems kyis ting nge 'dzin la mngon par zhen pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan gyi nyon mongs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni nang du sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: or if they are afflicted by other meditative concentrations and meditative attainments, that is called “internal mental distraction.”

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de dang mthun par 'byung bas /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang de dang mthun par 'byung bas /
translated: The treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition also states something similar.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa la brten nas mdo'i tshig 'di bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa la brten nas mdo'i tshig 'di bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this statement of the sutra should be explained in reliance on the treatise Exposition of Valid Cognition.

original: 'di ltar na nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar na nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Thus, internal distraction is fivefold:

original: dang po ni rmugs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rmugs pa'o //
translated: The first is lethargy.

original: gnyis pa ni gnyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gnyid do //
translated: The second is sleep.

original: gsum pa ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: The third is doubt.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni zhan pa'i sems zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni zhan pa'i sems zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The Exposition of Valid Cognition states that it is a weak mind.

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid zhan cing ting nge 'dzin gnyer ba'i sems med pas de'i phyir zhan pa'i sems @208b zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid zhan cing ting nge 'dzin gnyer ba'i sems med pas de'i phyir zhan pa'i sems @208b zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called a weak mind because it is the nature of the mind to be weak and it lacks the mind that seeks concentration.

original: le lo'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: le lo'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of laziness.

original: bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba ste /
translated: The fourth is relishing meditative attainment.

original: 'dis 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags bstan to //
translated: This indicates attachment to the desire realm.

original: gong ma'i ting nge 'dzin la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba zhes bya'i thams cad yod par smra ba dag ltar khams gong ma'i 'dod chags la ro myang ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gong ma'i ting nge 'dzin la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba zhes bya'i thams cad yod par smra ba dag ltar khams gong ma'i 'dod chags la ro myang ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not taught that the concentration of the higher realms is a concentration relishing the taste of attachment to the higher realms, as the Sarvastivadins say.🔽

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pas gong mar mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pas gong mar mi 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not taught that the concentration of the upper realms is the concentration of relishing attachment, as the Sarvastivadins say, because one does not proceed to the upper realms through the affliction of attachment.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni nga rgyal mchog tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan dang / theg pa mchog tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan dang / lta ba mchog tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni nga rgyal mchog tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan dang / theg pa mchog tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan dang / lta ba mchog tu gyur pa'i bsam gtan zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti mentions the concentration of pride, the concentration of the supreme vehicle and the concentration of the supreme view.

original: lnga pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas nyon mongs par gyur pa ste /
translated: The fifth is afflicted by any branch affliction of meditative attainment.

original: zil gyi sngon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la sogs pa la sgrib par byed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te /🔽bag med pa dang le lo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zil gyi sngon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la sogs pa la sgrib par byed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te / bag med pa dang le lo la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the secondary afflictions such as heedlessness, laziness, and so on.

original: de ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga po dag gis nyon mongs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga po dag gis nyon mongs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, they are afflicted by five types of secondary afflictions.

original: de la nyon mongs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las nyams par byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las nyams par byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, “afflicted” means that they are afflicted because they cause degeneration of concentration.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni bying ba dang rgod pa dang ro myang bas bsam gtan las nyams par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las ni bying ba dang rgod pa dang ro myang bas bsam gtan las nyams par byed pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: In the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma, it is explained that sinking, excitement, and taste cause degeneration of concentration.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel bshad las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel bshad las /
translated: Moreover, in the commentary Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes, it says:

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dang phyi rol du g-yeng bas ni ma thob pa gang yin pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dang phyi rol du g-yeng bas ni ma thob pa gang yin pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By the intrinsic nature and external distraction, one does not obtain what has not been obtained.

original: nang gi dang mtshan ma'i gnyis kyis ni thob zin pa yang nyams par byed do //
analyzed: nang gi dang mtshan ma'i gnyis kyis ni thob zin pa yang nyams par byed do //
translated: By the internal and sign distractions, one loses what has been obtained.

original: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng bas ni rnam par grol ba thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng bas ni rnam par grol ba thob par mi byed do //
translated: By the distraction of negative reflex actions, one does not obtain the liberation.

original: drug pa yid la byed pa'i g-yeng bas ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi byed pas /
analyzed: drug pa yid la byed pa'i g-yeng bas ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi byed pas /
translated: By the distraction of mental orientation, one does not obtain the supreme enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir rmugs pa la sogs pas ni thob zin pa las kyang nyams par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmugs pa la sogs pas ni thob zin pa las kyang nyams par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that by dullness, etc., one loses what has been obtained.

original: yang na bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel bshad las ni mtshan nyid re re so sor phye ba yin pas /🔽yang dag pa'i don du na rmugs pa la sogs pa ni kun kyang ma @209a * //
analyzed: yang na bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel bshad las ni mtshan nyid re re so sor phye ba yin pas / yang dag pa'i don du na rmugs pa la sogs pa ni kun kyang ma @209a * //
translated: Or, in the Madhyāntavibhāga-ṭīkā, each characteristic is distinguished individually.

original: thob pa las nyams par byed pas sgrib pa nyid du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa las nyams par byed pas sgrib pa nyid du mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In reality, dullness, etc., are all established as obscurations because they cause the loss of what has not been obtained.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas /
translated: If, on the basis of external signs,🔽one attends to the signs that are the domain of internal meditative concentration, this is called “distraction by signs.”

original: nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma rnams yid la byed na de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma rnams yid la byed na de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the fourth, distraction by signs.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: These distractions are explained differently in the individual texts.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las 'di lta ste /
translated: The Abhidharma-samuccaya says, “It is as follows:

original: gzhan yid ches par bya ba sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yid ches par bya ba sngon du btang ste /
translated: Having first gained the trust of others,

original: rgyus dge ba la sbyor bar ston pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyus dge ba la sbyor bar ston pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: one teaches them to apply themselves to virtue through causes.”

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las gzhan gyis bdag la yon tan dang ldan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de'i mtshan ma ston pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las gzhan gyis bdag la yon tan dang ldan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de'i mtshan ma ston pa ste /
translated: The commentary to this text explains, “In order to gain the trust of others that one has good qualities, one displays the signs of those qualities.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des dge ba la zhugs pa khad kyis nyams par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des dge ba la zhugs pa khad kyis nyams par rig par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Through those causes and conditions, one should understand that one’s practice of virtue will gradually decline.”

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Differentiating the middle and extremes states:

original: rgyus mtshan ma bstan nas ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyus mtshan ma bstan nas ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Because it displays signs of the cause, it is called distraction.🔽Its commentary explains:

original: de nyid kyi 'grel pa las sa 'og ma'i yid da dung ma nges shing nye bar ma zhi bas mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'grel pa las sa 'og ma'i yid da dung ma nges shing nye bar ma zhi bas mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Since the mind of the lower level is not yet ascertained and is not pacified, it is called distraction displaying signs.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin thob mod kyis 'go ma pa'i yid da dung nges par ma gyur cig nye bar ma zhi bas rgyus mtshan ma de ston pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin thob mod kyis 'go ma pa'i yid da dung nges par ma gyur cig nye bar ma zhi bas rgyus mtshan ma de ston pa'o //
translated: Even though one has attained concentration, the mind of the lower level is not yet ascertained and is not pacified, so it displays signs of the cause.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni /
translated: The treatise Exposition of Valid Knowledge states:

original: mtshan ma'i sems rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i sems rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Distraction of signs is as follows:

original: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is attention to the signs of internal objects in dependence on external signs.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Intention states:

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi lus kyi nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' phyi rol gyi mtshan ma la brten nas nang gi lus kyi nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: If a bodhisattva attends to the signs of the sphere of meditative concentration within the internal body, based on external signs, that is called distraction by signs.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las bstan pa ni mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang don mthun no //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las bstan pa ni mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa dang don mthun no //
translated: The explanation in the Treatise on Designation and the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning is consistent with the meaning of this sutra.

original: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The internal sphere of meditative concentration refers to the following.

original: nang gi ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa na mngon sum gyi mtshan mas brjod du med pa'i mtshan ma sna tshogs thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa na mngon sum gyi mtshan mas brjod du med pa'i mtshan ma sna tshogs thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: When one abides in internal meditative concentration, one attains the signs of the inexpressible through the signs of direct perception.

original: de ni 'di skad du ting nge 'dzin @209b ma thob pa'i mdun rol du phyi rol gyi yul la brten nas 'di snyam du nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma thob bo snyam pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ting nge 'dzin @209b ma thob pa'i mdun rol du phyi rol gyi yul la brten nas 'di snyam du nang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma thob bo snyam pa ste /
translated: This is what is being said: prior to attaining meditative concentration, one thinks, “I have attained the sign of the object of meditation of internal meditative concentration,” on the basis of an external object.

original: 'di ni nang gi gang yin pa de phyi rol gyi mtshan ma dang mtshungs par bstan pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni nang gi gang yin pa de phyi rol gyi mtshan ma dang mtshungs par bstan pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the teaching that what is internal is taught to be similar to an external sign.

original: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na yang dag par ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi mtshan ma ma thob kyang /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam grangs gzhan du na yang dag par ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi mtshan ma ma thob kyang /
translated: Another explanation is that even though one has not attained the sign of one’s own meditative concentration,

original: mtshan ma cung zad cig mngon sum du gyur pa la yang dag par rang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma thob bo snyam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma cung zad cig mngon sum du gyur pa la yang dag par rang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma thob bo snyam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: one thinks, “I have attained the sign of my own meditative concentration,” because a slight sign has become manifest. This is called “distraction.”

original: gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la gnas ngan len gyi lus kyis nga'o snyam du rlom sems skyed par byed na de ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la gnas ngan len gyi lus kyis nga'o snyam du rlom sems skyed par byed na de ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
translated: If, due to internal attention, feeling that arises from conditions generates the conceit “I am” in the body of negative propensities, that should be known as the distraction of negative propensities.

original: lnga pa gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the distraction of negative propensities.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la bdag gi'o snyam du 'dzin cing gnas ngan len gyi lus la bdag go snyam du nga rgyal bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la bdag gi'o snyam du 'dzin cing gnas ngan len gyi lus la bdag go snyam du nga rgyal bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the distraction of negative propensities.

original: yang na gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas pa las byung ba bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa la /
analyzed: yang na gal te nang gi yid la byed pas rkyen byas pa las byung ba bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba dmigs pa'i yul du gyur pa la /
translated: Or, if internal attention acts as a condition, and feeling such as pleasure becomes the object of observation,

original: gnas ngan len gyi sa bon gyis rgyu dang rkyen byas nas bskyed pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam du nga rgyal skyed par byed pas lta ba dang nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba nyid la gnas ngan len ces bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi sa bon gyis rgyu dang rkyen byas nas bskyed pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang nga'o snyam du nga rgyal skyed par byed pas lta ba dang nga rgyal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba nyid la gnas ngan len ces bya ste /
translated: The view of self and the pride thinking I that are generated through the power of the seeds of negative tendencies are called negative tendencies that are the distraction concomitant with view and pride.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon par sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon par sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: Thus the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi stobs la brten nas /🔽dge ba'i chos sgom pa'i tshe tshor ba byung ba rnams la nga 'am nga yi zhe 'am /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi stobs la brten nas / dge ba'i chos sgom pa'i tshe tshor ba byung ba rnams la nga 'am nga yi zhe 'am /
translated: The distraction of negative tendencies is the power of the negative tendencies of the side of the view of the transitory collection and the pride thinking I that thinks I or mine or thinks I.🔽When cultivating virtuous Dharmas, the feelings that arise are mixed with the apprehension of I or mine or the thought I.

original: nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang 'dres pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang 'dres pa dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is the apprehension of signs.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las /
translated: The Autocommentary states:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi stobs kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba byung ba rnams la bdag go zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi stobs kyis bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba byung ba rnams la bdag go zhe'am /
translated: Because of the power of the negative reflex actions of self-habits, etc., the Bodhisattvas, when they experience feelings of pleasure, etc., think “I,” “mine,” or “I am.”🔽Thus, they do not purify the side of virtue.🔽The Lord: Subhuti, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the perfection of giving, etc.

original: bdag gi'o zhe 'am nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir dge ba'i phyogs yongs su ma dag par bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bdag gi'o zhe 'am nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir dge ba'i phyogs yongs su ma dag par bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the perfection of morality, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de @210a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de @210a * //
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the perfection of patience, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the perfection of vigor, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the perfection of concentration, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the perfection of wisdom, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the applications of mindfulness, etc.

original: dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the right efforts, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the supernatural powers, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the faculties, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the powers, etc.🔽The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the limbs of enlightenment, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du sgrib pa gang dag gi gnyen por gyur pa lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrib pa bcu gcig gi gnyen por gyur pas bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston te /🔽'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du sgrib pa gang dag gi gnyen por gyur pa lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bzhi pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgrib pa bcu gcig gi gnyen por gyur pas bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston te / 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the path, etc.

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the fruit of a Streamwinner, etc.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: The Lord: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, should course in perfect wisdom, if they course in the

original: rigs kyi bu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag sa dang po la ni ngan song pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las ngan skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa lnga'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par ni gnyis pa de bzhin
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag sa dang po la ni ngan song pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las ngan skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa lnga'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par ni gnyis pa de bzhin
translated: Son of noble family, those śamatha and vipaśyanā are the antidotes to the five afflictions that give rise to the afflictions and bad karma of the lower realms on the first bhūmi.

original: gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has spoken correctly and in detail.

original: 'di yang sgrib pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis rnam pa bcu gcig tu dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang sgrib pa rnam pa bcu gcig gi gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis rnam pa bcu gcig tu dbye ste /
translated: This is also classified into eleven types by way of being the antidotes to the eleven types of obscurations.

original: 'di ni sa dang po'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //🔽'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni so so'i skye bo'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni sa dang po'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o // 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni so so'i skye bo'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the teaching on the obscurations of the first bhūmi.🔽In the commentary on the Ten Bhūmis, it says “the obscurations to the characteristics of the state of being an ordinary being.”

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary composed by Ācārya Vasubandhu, it says “the obscurations to being an ordinary being.”

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / mdo 'di nyid las ni ming bkod par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / mdo 'di nyid las ni ming bkod par zad kyi rnam par bshad pa ni med do //
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Intention and this very sutra merely list the obscurations, but do not explain them.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyi ma rig pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyi ma rig pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The commentary on the treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna, translated by the life-extending cow, states, “It is the ignorance of being an ordinary being.”

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang mdo tsam du ston to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang mdo tsam du ston to //
translated: It also teaches the characteristics of the nature in brief.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bshad de /
translated: The treatise Proof of Consciousness Only explains it as the “obstruction of being an ordinary being.”

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi rgya cher ston pas de'i phyir 'dir re zhig rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos dang sbyar nas sgrib pa de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi rgya cher ston pas de'i phyir 'dir re zhig rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa'i bstan bcos dang sbyar nas sgrib pa de dag gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya'o //
translated: Since it extensively teaches the characteristics there, here I will first teach the characteristics of those obscurations in accordance with the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only.

original: de la sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang don rnam pa gnyis yod do /
analyzed: de la sgrib pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yang don rnam pa gnyis yod do /
translated: Therein, the teaching on the essence of the obscurations has two topics.

original: dang po ni ming gi rjes su ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni ming gi rjes su ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The first is the teaching of the nature of reality following the name.

original: de ni sgrib pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de ni sgrib pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: It is the nature of the conception of the two obscurations.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Perception Only explains:

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of the state of ordinary being is as follows.

original: sgrib pa gnyis las rnam par rtog pa las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis las rnam par rtog pa las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which arises from the conception of the two obscurations.

original: de'i sa bon la brten nas so so'i skye bo nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes @210b bshad do //
analyzed: de'i sa bon la brten nas so so'i skye bo nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes @210b bshad do //
translated: Because the state of ordinary being is posited in dependence on its seed.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las bdag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir bstan pa'i so so'i skye bo'i ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las bdag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir bstan pa'i so so'i skye bo'i ngo bo nyid do zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: Moreover, that same text says, “The confusion that is the manifest clinging to a self and phenomena is the nature of the state of ordinary being taught here.”

original: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa nyid las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa nyid las brtsams nas ngo bo nyid bstan pa ste /
translated: The second is the teaching of the nature of reality beginning with reality.

original: 'di ni kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: This is the nature of the twenty-two varieties of delusion and their negative tendencies.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only explains:

original: mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i tshe ngan song ba'i las rnams dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa spong mod kyi /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i tshe ngan song ba'i las rnams dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa spong mod kyi /
translated: “When the path of insight arises, karma for miserable realms and its effects, etc., are abandoned.

original: 'di ni re zhig nyon mongs pa 'byung bar byed pa nyid rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir de nas sa dang po pas kun du rmongs pa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan len spong bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig nyon mongs pa 'byung bar byed pa nyid rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir de nas sa dang po pas kun du rmongs pa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan len spong bar bshad do //
translated: However, since the root of the arising of the afflictions is the two delusions and their negative tendencies, the first stage abandons the two delusions and their negative tendencies.”

original: dang po ni bdag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni bdag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The first is the delusion of clinging to a self and to phenomena.

original: de ni 'dir bstan pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir bstan pa'i so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: This is the obscuration of the state of ordinary being taught here.

original: gnyis pa ni ngan song ba'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ngan song ba'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The second is the delusion of miserable realms.

original: de ngan song ba'i las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yin par rig par bya ste kun du rmongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyang kun du rmongs pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ngan song ba'i las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yin par rig par bya ste kun du rmongs pa'i phyogs thams cad kyang kun du rmongs pa zhes bshad do //
translated: It should be understood that these are the karma and results of the lower realms, and all the aspects of complete confusion are explained as complete confusion.

original: yang na de dag gis sgrib pa rnon po dang rtul pa gang yin pa gnyi ga las kun du rmongs pa gnyis 'byung ba kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: yang na de dag gis sgrib pa rnon po dang rtul pa gang yin pa gnyi ga las kun du rmongs pa gnyis 'byung ba kho nar bstan to //
translated: Or, it is taught that both the sharp and dull obscurations that arise from those two are the two confusions.

original: de'i gnas ngan len ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam pa gnyis po de dag gam /
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len ces bya ba'i tshig gis ni rnam pa gnyis po de dag gam /
translated: The phrase “their negative tendencies” indicates that those two aspects

original: yang na gnyis po dag las 'byung ba'i las su mi rung ba nyid rab tu bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na gnyis po dag las 'byung ba'i las su mi rung ba nyid rab tu bstan to zhes 'byung ste /
translated: or the unserviceability of karma that arises from those two are fully taught.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Compendium of Abhidharma.

original: gzhan yang mdo nyid las ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yang dag pa las brtsams nas sa dang po la sgrib pa gnyis kyi gnyen por gyur pa la sogs pas ngo bo nyid byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo nyid las ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir yang dag pa las brtsams nas sa dang po la sgrib pa gnyis kyi gnyen por gyur pa la sogs pas ngo bo nyid byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: you should understand that, beginning from the authentic, the essence of the first ground is to be the antidote to the two obscurations and so on.🔽The explanation of the teachings is from the commentary on the noble ten grounds, which teaches, “The obscuration of the characteristics of ordinary beings,”

original: bstan pa rnams brda sprod pa yang 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las so so'i skye bo dag gi mtshan nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bstan pa dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: bstan pa rnams brda sprod pa yang 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las so so'i skye bo dag gi mtshan nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bstan pa dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: and from the commentary composed by master Vasubandhu,🔽which teaches, “The obscuration of being an ordinary being,”

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bstan pa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: and from the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna, which was translated as the “change of the life of a bull.”

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi ma rig pa zhes 'byung ba ni bdag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyi ma rig pa zhes 'byung ba ni bdag dang chos su mngon par zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The statement “ignorance that is the state of ordinary being” is the same as the statement “delusion that is the adherence to the belief in the true existence of the individual and phenomena.”

original: da la bye brag yod pa yang lang gi tshe bsgyur ba'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: da la bye brag yod pa yang lang gi tshe bsgyur ba'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Now, with regard to the differences, the commentary on the Translation: The commentary on the Translation of the Difficult Points of the Summary of the Five Heaps states:

original: @211a * // bstan pa'i ming ni spangs pa ma yin te ma rig pa zhes ston to //
analyzed: @211a * // bstan pa'i ming ni spangs pa ma yin te ma rig pa zhes ston to //
translated: “The term ‘ignorance’ is not a synonym for ‘abandonment.’

original: 'grel pa gzhan las bstan pa'i ming ni spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'grel pa gzhan las bstan pa'i ming ni spangs pa yin te /
translated: Other commentaries state that the term ‘abandonment’ is a synonym for ‘obscuration’

original: sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught by the word ‘obscuration.’

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Intention states:🔽“The afflictions of the miserable realms, karma of the miserable realms, and the afflictions of birth are the afflictions.”

original: ngan song ba'i las dang skye ba dang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngan song ba'i las dang skye ba dang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The statement in this sutra is the same as the statement “delusion that is the afflictions of the miserable realms.”

original: mdo 'di gnyis dang 'grel pa gsum pa las ni so so nas kun du rmongs pa re re smos la /
analyzed: mdo 'di gnyis dang 'grel pa gsum pa las ni so so nas kun du rmongs pa re re smos la /
translated: The two sutras and the third commentary each mention one kind of confusion.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa las brtsams te /
translated: But the Saṃdhinirmocana Sūtra teaches two kinds of confusion, etc., and therefore, beginning with reality,

original: brjod pa kun du rmongs pa gnyis po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa kun du rmongs pa gnyis po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that the two kinds of confusion, etc., are the nature of expression.

original: yang na mdo gnyis kyang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa dang mthun te /
analyzed: yang na mdo gnyis kyang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa dang mthun te /
translated: Or, the two sutras are in agreement with the teaching of the treatise, the Saṃdhinirmocana Sūtra, which teaches two kinds of confusion, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis shes bya'i sgrib pa bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis shes bya'i sgrib pa bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The word “afflictions” includes the obscurations to knowledge,

original: ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i ming gis bstan no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i ming gis bstan no //
translated: because they are similar in nature, they are taught by the name “afflictions.”

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang so so'i skye bo nyid kyi sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The teaching of the etymology is the obscuration of the state of ordinary beings, which is an explanation from the perspective of the dominant condition.

original: sgrib pa gnyis la brten nas so so'i skye bo'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis la brten nas so so'i skye bo'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the ordinary man is established in dependence upon the two obscurations.

original: ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes gsungs pa ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes gsungs pa ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The afflicted states of the evil destinies, the karma and rebirth of the ordinary man are described as the obscuration that consists in moral defilement.🔽The obscuration that consists in the knowable is described as the obscuration that consists in karma and rebirth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po dag sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po dag sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The obscuration that consists in the latter is described as the obscuration that consists in karma and rebirth because the three kinds of afflicted states are obscurations.

original: sa gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la ni ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: On the second spiritual level, the counteragent to the obscuration that consists in the occurrence of the error of the subtle transgression is the second spiritual level.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang / des bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i ltung ba las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang / des bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i ltung ba las gsum po dag gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is the essential nature of the three kinds of obscuration that consist in the knowable, i.e. one part of that which is innate and the error that is generated by that.

original: kun du 'byung ba dang sa bon dang kun du brtags pa las ni kun du 'byung ba dang sa bon dang bag chags kyang gtogs so //
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba dang sa bon dang kun du brtags pa las ni kun du 'byung ba dang sa bon dang bag chags kyang gtogs so //
translated: The arising, seed, and imputation are also the arising, seed, and instinct.

original: de las bag chags ni las su mi rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de las bag chags ni las su mi rung ba nyid de /
translated: Among them, the instinct is the unserviceability of karma.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise, the Establishment of Representation Only, says,

original: gnyis pa log par sgrub pa gnyis las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang / des bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i @211b ltung ba las gsum po dag go zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa log par sgrub pa gnyis las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang / des bskyed pa'i 'khrul pa'i @211b ltung ba las gsum po dag go zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: “The second is the two kinds of wrong practice: one part of the innate and the three kinds of downfalls of error generated by that.”

original: de ni mdo las ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa zhes gsungs pa nyid de zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni mdo las ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du rmongs pa dang / las kyi rnam pa sna tshogs la kun du rmongs pa zhes gsungs pa nyid de zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is the error of the subtle downfall, the confusion about the various kinds of karma, as stated in the sutra.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni sems can gyi lus la sogs pa'i las la spyod pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni sems can gyi lus la sogs pa'i las la spyod pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The commentary to the Sutra of the Ten Stages says that it is the obstruction to the practice of the karma of the body, etc. of sentient beings.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni sems can gyi dngos po rnams la log par sgrub pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba las ni sems can gyi dngos po rnams la log par sgrub pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu says, “It is a wrong practice with regard to the entities of sentient beings.”

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul ba zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul ba zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning also says, “It is a mistake about subtle downfalls.”

original: kun du 'byung ba yang don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba yang don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: Origination also has three meanings.

original: las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na ni las rnam pa gsum po dag gis ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na ni las rnam pa gsum po dag gis ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: When applied to the explanation of the thorough afflictions of karma, the three types of karma create the essence.

original: bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na ni ma rig pas ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa dang sbyar na ni ma rig pas ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: When applied to the explanation of the dominant condition, ignorance creates the essence.

original: don gyi mthar gtugs te brjod na ni las rnam pa gsum dang ma rig pas ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: don gyi mthar gtugs te brjod na ni las rnam pa gsum dang ma rig pas ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: When the meaning is stated in terms of the final meaning, the three types of karma and ignorance create the essence.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las lus kyi las kyis sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i ma rig pa zhes bstan pa yang don rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las lus kyi las kyis sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i ma rig pa zhes bstan pa yang don rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, translated by Vangīśa, explains the ignorance that is the wrong practice with respect to sentient beings through physical actions in two ways.

original: gal te ming gi rjes su brjod na ni ma rig pas ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: gal te ming gi rjes su brjod na ni ma rig pas ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: If one follows the literal meaning, ignorance creates the essence.

original: yang dag pa'i don gyi dbang du byas te brjod na ni ma rig pa dang las kyis ngo bo nyid byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don gyi dbang du byas te brjod na ni ma rig pa dang las kyis ngo bo nyid byed do //
translated: If one expresses it in terms of the correct meaning, ignorance and karma create the essence.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: With regard to the explanation of the etymology, the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle says:

original: log par sgrib pa skyed pa'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ba ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: log par sgrib pa skyed pa'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ba ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The ignorance that generates wrong obscurations is explained as the karma that is appropriated.

original: mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa las ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs par gsungs pa yang snga ma bzhin du bdag po'i dbang du byas pa dang las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin par rab tu dbye🔽bar bya ste /🔽'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid la sogs pa las ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs par gsungs pa yang snga ma bzhin du bdag po'i dbang du byas pa dang las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin par rab tu dbye bar bya ste / 'khrul pa kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: And the statement in this sutra and so on that the error of subtle downfalls is an obscuration to the arising of error is to be distinguished as an explanation in terms of the former, that is, the obscuration that is the dominant condition, and in terms of the latter, that is, the obscuration that is the appropriator of karma.🔽The obscuration to the arising of error is an obscuration because it is the cause of the arising of error.

original: yang na 'khrul ba kun du 'byung ba nyid sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'khrul ba kun du 'byung ba nyid sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the arising of error itself is an obscuration.

original: sa gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgrib pa gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa gsum pa la ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgrib pa gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa gsum pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: On the third level, the obscuration to the passion of desire is the antidote.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only states:

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i @212a * //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i @212a * //
translated: The innate obscurations to omniscience

original: phyogs gcig gis ni 'di ltar sa gsum pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par can bsgom pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed la 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pas ni gzungs dang / thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed pas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis ni 'di ltar sa gsum pa'i ting nge 'dzin khyad par can bsgom pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed la 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pas ni gzungs dang / thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab la sgrib par byed pas /
translated: One part obscures the wisdom that meditates on the special concentration of the third level, while the affliction of attachment obscures the wisdom of retention, hearing, contemplation and meditation.

original: brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pas ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad do /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa dang / shes bzhin ma yin pas ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad do /
translated: Thus it is explained that forgetfulness and lack of vigilance are their essence.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Thus the treatise Establishing Knowledge as Mere Consciousness states:

original: rmongs pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration of delusion is as follows:

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i chos brjed par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i chos brjed par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is forgetfulness of the Dharma of hearing, contemplation and meditation due to one part of innate obscuration that is an object of knowledge.

original: des gsum pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs khyad par du 'phags pa dang / gzungs kyis bskyed pa'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa gsum la sgrib par byed la kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun du rmongs pa dang /
analyzed: des gsum pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs khyad par du 'phags pa dang / gzungs kyis bskyed pa'i shes rab khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa gsum la sgrib par byed la kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun du rmongs pa dang /
translated: It obscures three things: the concentration of the third meditative stabilization, the especially exalted retention, and the especially exalted wisdom generated by retention.

original: thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun du rmongs pa yang sdud par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽bsags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa la kun du rmongs shing chos rnams brjed par gyur pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thos pa'i gzungs yongs su rdzogs pa la kun du rmongs pa yang sdud par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no // bsags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa la kun du rmongs shing chos rnams brjed par gyur pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It also subsumes the delusion of attachment to desire realm objects and the delusion of not perfecting the retention of what is heard.🔽The Ten Grounds Sutra states that it is an obscuration that is a delusion about amassing virtue,

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa dag la rmongs rtul zhing brjed ngas pa dang bcas pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni thos pa dang / bsams pa dang bsgoms pa dag la rmongs rtul zhing brjed ngas pa dang bcas pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and the commentary by the master Vasubandhu states that it is a delusion about hearing, contemplating, and meditating and an obscuration that causes one to forget the Dharma.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni sems rtse gcig pa myur du mi shes pa'i ma rig pa dang / thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa brjed par byed pa'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni sems rtse gcig pa myur du mi shes pa'i ma rig pa dang / thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa brjed par byed pa'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The ignorance of not quickly knowing one-pointedness and the ignorance that causes one to forget what one has heard, contemplated, and meditated on.

original: don gyis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: don gyis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: This accords with the explanation of the two kinds of confusion in the treatise Establishing the Existence of Consciousness Only.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Intention says:🔽The fault of wanting to obtain virtuous dharmas.

original: dge ba'i chos thob par 'dod pa'i nyes pa zhes 'byung ba dang mdo 'di nyid las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun du rmongs pa zhes gsungs pa ni kun du rmongs pa dang po bsdus pa yin yang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thob par 'dod pa'i nyes pa zhes 'byung ba dang mdo 'di nyid las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun du rmongs pa zhes gsungs pa ni kun du rmongs pa dang po bsdus pa yin yang /
translated: The statement in this sutra, “confusion about attachment to sense objects,” includes the first confusion.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na kun du rmongs pa gnyi ga la ngo bo nyid du sdud de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na kun du rmongs pa gnyi ga la ngo bo nyid du sdud de /
translated: However, in terms of their true nature, both confusions are included in the second.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as in the treatise, the Proof of Consciousness Only.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang gzhan dag @212b las rmongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bstan pa ni 'di ltar 'dod chags nyid rmongs pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir rmongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang gzhan dag @212b las rmongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bstan pa ni 'di ltar 'dod chags nyid rmongs pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir rmongs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
translated: As for the explanation of the term, the treatise states that it is the obstruction of delusion, because desire itself is the obstruction of delusion.

original: 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation in terms of the function of grasping karma.

original: yang na rmongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ming yin te /
analyzed: yang na rmongs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ming yin te /
translated: Alternatively, delusion is a name for the passions,

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa la rmongs pa zhes bstan pa ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa la rmongs pa zhes bstan pa ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obstruction to knowledge is called delusion, as stated in the treatise, because of the identity of substance.

original: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dang sbyar na ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: If this explanation is applied to the above, it is an explanation in terms of the dominant result,

original: rmongs pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the obstruction of delusion.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi sgrib pa zhes bya ba ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: As for the statement that it is the obstruction of desire realm desire, this is an explanation in terms of the dominant result.

original: yang na chos la sred pa ni 'dod chags yin pa'i phyir las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos la sred pa ni 'dod chags yin pa'i phyir las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: Or, since craving for dharmas is attachment, it is explained as the karma that appropriates.

original: sa bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang chos la srid pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa bzhi pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang chos la srid pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa bzhi pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: On the fourth stage, it is the antidote to the obscuration of craving for meditative absorption and craving for dharmas. This is the teaching of the obscurations of the fourth stage.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang chos la sred pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang chos la sred pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: In the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only, it is explained as having the nature of the view of self that arises simultaneously with mental consciousness, craving for meditative absorption, and craving for dharmas.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid la bzhin pa ni nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid la bzhin pa ni nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, in that treatise, the obscuration to the arising of subtle afflictions is as follows.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a part of the obscuration of the knowable that is innate and it is included in the afflicted view of the self and so on that is concomitant with mental consciousness.

original: de las bzhi pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la sred par byed de /
analyzed: de las bzhi pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos la sred par byed de /
translated: It is craving for the factors of enlightenment on the fourth level.

original: sa bzhi ba la zhugs pa la yongs su spong par byed do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa bzhi ba la zhugs pa la yongs su spong par byed do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is abandoned on the fourth level.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in that text.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni thog ma med pa'i shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sred pa dang / chos la sred pa yang bsdu ba ste /🔽snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa de dag ni sa gsum pa dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed pas sa bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni thog ma med pa'i shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sred pa dang / chos la sred pa yang bsdu ba ste / snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa de dag ni sa gsum pa dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed pas sa bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i tshe /
