translated: The words afflicted view of the self and so on include the obscuration of the knowable that has existed since beginningless time, craving for meditative attainment and craving for phenomena.

original: gdod yongs su spong bar byed de /
analyzed: gdod yongs su spong bar byed de /
translated: Since craving for meditative attainment and craving for phenomena are increased by those on the third level, they are abandoned when one enters the fourth level.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ni de dag dang shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos ni de dag dang shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the factors conducive to enlightenment are incompatible with them.

original: gzhan yang mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis so zhes ston par mdzad de /
translated: Moreover, this same sutra teaches two kinds of confusion:

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / @213a * //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / chos la sred pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / @213a * //
translated: confusion about craving meditative attainment and confusion about craving the Dharma.

original: de'i gnas ngan len ces ston pas so //🔽bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i ma rig pa zhas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i gnas ngan len ces ston pas so // bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i ma rig pa zhas 'byung ngo //
translated: The term their negative reflex is taught.🔽In the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna, translated by Devakṣema, it says: The arising of subtle afflictions is ignorance such as the view of the transitory collection.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las kyang bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the commentary composed by Ācārya Vasubandhu, it says: The fourth is the arising of subtle afflictions included in the innate view of the transitory collection and so on.

original: bstan bcos gong ma gnyis po 'di gnyis kyang don gyis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos gong ma gnyis po 'di gnyis kyang don gyis bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: Also, these two former treatises are explained in accordance with the teaching in the treatise Establishing the Existence of Consciousness Only.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word “etc.” is used.

original: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir 'phags pas bcu pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ci'i phyir 'phags pas bcu pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: If that is so, why does the commentary to the tenth chapter of the noble Asanga’s Compendium of the Mahāyāna say:

original: chos kyi nga rgyal gyi sgrib pa zhes bstan ce na /🔽smras pa / sa gsum pa la chos kyi bstan pa so sor yang dag par rig par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: chos kyi nga rgyal gyi sgrib pa zhes bstan ce na / smras pa / sa gsum pa la chos kyi bstan pa so sor yang dag par rig par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: “The obscuration of the pride of Dharma.”

original: chos yang dag par rig pa'i nga rgyal skyed pa nyid kyi chos la sred pa yang skye ba'i phyir sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa yang so so nas de na re re smos pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: chos yang dag par rig pa'i nga rgyal skyed pa nyid kyi chos la sred pa yang skye ba'i phyir sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa yang so so nas de na re re smos pas phan tshun 'gal ba med do //
translated: We say: When the third ground is attained, the pride of knowing Dharma arises, and because craving for Dharma also arises, the commentary to the tenth chapter and so on each mention one of these, and there is no contradiction between them.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i sems kyi kun du rmongs pa zhes 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sred pa yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i sems kyi kun du rmongs pa zhes 'byung ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sred pa yin te /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says that the confusion of craving meditative absorption is a craving for meditative stabilization.

original: lo ts'a ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lo ts'a ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the translators had different ideas.

original: mdo 'di nyid la sa snyoms par 'jug pa dang / chos la sred pa zhes gsungs pa ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis cig car bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid la sa snyoms par 'jug pa dang / chos la sred pa zhes gsungs pa ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis cig car bsdu ba'o //
translated: In this sutra, the phrase “craving for meditative absorption” is used to include both confusions.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes ma gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes ma gsungs pa ni /
translated: It does not mention the view of the perishing aggregates.

original: yang dag par kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis kho nar ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis kho nar ma zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there are not only two types of confusion.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The Compendium of Knowledge, a commentary on the Compendium of Abhidharma, explains the terms for these two:

original: nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration that is the arising of subtle afflictions is this:

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba gang yin pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: it is the innate view of the perishing aggregates.

original: bstan bcos de las phra mo zhes 'byung ba ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: bstan bcos de las phra mo zhes 'byung ba ni don rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: The term “subtle” in the treatise has three meanings:

original: phyogs ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi dmigs pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / yun ring por kun du 'byung ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs ma yin pa'i phyir dang / yid kyi dmigs pa mi byed pa'i phyir dang / yun ring por kun du 'byung ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not a side, it does not act as the object of the mental faculty, and it is a long-term latent tendency.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes 'byung ba ni de dang nyon mongs pa bdag nyid gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes 'byung ba ni de dang nyon mongs pa bdag nyid gcig tu 'byung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: The term “affliction” is taught because it arises as the same entity as the affliction.

original: de nyid nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung @213b ba'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs pa phra mo kun du 'byung @213b ba'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the subtle affliction that is the obscuration to the arising of the path.

original: 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation from the perspective of the dominant condition.

original: mdo 'di las snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa'i sgrib pa zhes gsungs pa yang bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo 'di las snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa dang / chos la sred pa'i sgrib pa zhes gsungs pa yang bdag po'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The obscuration of craving meditative attainment and craving the Dharma that is mentioned in this sutra is also taught from the perspective of the dominant condition.

original: yang na las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: Or this is an explanation of the retention of karma.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa yang sred pa'i ming thob pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa yang sred pa'i ming thob pa yang yin pas /
translated: Thus, the obscurations to omniscience are also called craving.

original: de'i phyir chos la sred pa la sogs pa sred pa zhes bya bas las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la sred pa la sogs pa sred pa zhes bya bas las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, craving for dharmas and so on are called craving and are explained as the appropriator of karma.

original: gzhan yang sred pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kho na'i ming yin pas las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa nyid du mngon par grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sred pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kho na'i ming yin pas las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa nyid du mngon par grub pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, since craving is a name for just the afflictions, it is clearly established as the explanation of the appropriator of karma.

original: 'di ltar sngar ni spyi'i ming gis shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar ni spyi'i ming gis shes bya'i sgrib pa'i bdag nyid bstan pa yin la /
translated: Thus, previously the nature of the obscurations to omniscience was taught by its general name.

original: de'i 'og tu ni sgrib pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni sgrib pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: After that, it was taught as the obscurations.

original: bstan bcos gzhan dag las nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni mangs pas 'dir ma brjod do //
analyzed: bstan bcos gzhan dag las nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni mangs pas 'dir ma brjod do //
translated: The etymologies taught in other treatises are not mentioned here because they are too numerous.

original: sa lnga pa la ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa lnga pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa la ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa lnga pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: On the fifth ground, it is the antidote to the obscurations that are directed exclusively toward samsara and that are directed toward nirvana.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang / kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis las ni 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig dang / kun du rmongs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis las ni 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa dang /
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only explains that the obscurations to omniscience are the single class of innate obscurations and the twenty-two types of confusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i kun du rmongs pas ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i kun du rmongs pas ngo bo nyid byed do zhes bshad de /
translated: It explains that the obscurations to omniscience are created by the confusion that is directed exclusively toward samsara and by the confusion that is directed toward nirvana.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las lnga pa theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las lnga pa theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only explains that the obscurations to the Hinayana nirvana are as follows.

original: shes bya'i sgrib ba las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis 'khor ba la shin tu skyo ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mos pas theg pa 'og ma gnyis dang mtshungs par sdug bsngal la skyo zhing 'gog pa la spro bas des sa lnga pa'i khyad par med pa'i lam la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib ba las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis 'khor ba la shin tu skyo ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mos pas theg pa 'og ma gnyis dang mtshungs par sdug bsngal la skyo zhing 'gog pa la spro bas des sa lnga pa'i khyad par med pa'i lam la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is a part of the obstruction to omniscience.

original: kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yang mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas ji skad du /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis rnam par bshad pa yang mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas ji skad du /
translated: The explanation of the two kinds of confusion is also in this sutra, as it says:

original: 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa zhes @214a * //🔽gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba la gcig tu mi phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la gcig tu mngon du phyogs pa nyid yid la byed pa zhes @214a * // gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “The attention that is not at all directed to cyclic existence and the attention that is directed to nirvana.”

original: 'phags pa sa bcu ba'i 'grel pa las ni lus yongs su gtsang ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu ba'i 'grel pa las ni lus yongs su gtsang ngo snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi sgrib pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The commentary to the Dashabhumika Sutra says that it is the obstruction of pride that thinks the body is completely pure.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ma rig pa zhes bstan pa dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las theg pa 'og ma'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba yang kun du rmongs pa gcig bsdus pa yin yang don gyis ni kun du rmongs pa gnyi ga bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ma rig pa zhes bstan pa dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las theg pa 'og ma'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba yang kun du rmongs pa gcig bsdus pa yin yang don gyis ni kun du rmongs pa gnyi ga bstan to //
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, translated by Trila, explains it as “ignorance about the nirvana of the Lesser Vehicle,” and the commentary composed by Vasubandhu explains it as “the obscuration to the nirvana of the lower vehicle.” Although these two commentaries subsume the two obscurations into a single ignorance, in fact they teach two kinds of ignorance.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang don gyis mdo 'di dang mthun par ston to //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang don gyis mdo 'di dang mthun par ston to //
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Intention also teaches this point in a way that accords with this sutra.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya bas ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis yang dag par bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la gcig tu phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya bas ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis yang dag par bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The phrases “one-sided” and “directed” in relation to samsara and nirvana subsume the two kinds of ignorance.

original: ming nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: ming nyid kyis brda phrad par zad do //
translated: This is simply a matter of using a name to convey a meaning.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: The treatise Establishing a Direct Perception of Consciousness explains:

original: theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa zhes bstan pa ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa zhes bstan pa ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The obscuration to the nirvana of the Basic Vehicle is taught because it is the dominant condition.

original: theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the obscuration to the nirvana of the Basic Vehicle.

original: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa ni las yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation in this very sutra is from the perspective of the function of the obscurations.🔽It is the obscuration to the knowledge of the knowable because it is the knowledge of complete discouragement and turning away.🔽The sixth is the antidote to the obscuration of the arising of many signs.

original: yongs su skyo zhing rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid shes bya'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pas drug pa la ni mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su skyo zhing rgyab kyis phyogs pa nyid shes bya'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pas drug pa la ni mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa drug pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the obscurations of the sixth ground.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig pa des sa gsum pa dag tu bden pa bzhi sgom par byed de /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig pa des sa gsum pa dag tu bden pa bzhi sgom par byed de /
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge Only explains that the third ground Bodhisattvas meditate on the four truths in order to abandon one part of the innate apprehension of the true existence of phenomena that is the object of abandonment by the path of meditation that is the object of abandonment by the third ground.

original: bden pa bzhi po dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid du 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid du 'dzin par byed de /
translated: They apprehend the four truths as having the character of affliction and purification.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They think,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba 'khor bar 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba 'khor bar 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: “The truth of suffering and the truth of origin, which is the entry to samsara, have the character of the afflicted class.

original: 'gog pa dang lam lugs las ldog pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid do snyam du sems so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam lugs las ldog pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid do snyam du sems so zhes bshad de /
translated: The truth of cessation and the truth of the path, which is the reversal of samsara, have the character of the purified class.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las drug pa mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las drug pa mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore the same treatise says that the sixth is the obscuration that is the arising of coarse signs.

original: @214b shes bya'i sgrib pa lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas des sa drug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: @214b shes bya'i sgrib pa lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas des sa drug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
translated: That obscures the path of the sixth level, which is without affliction and without purification.

original: sa drug par zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pa des na /
analyzed: sa drug par zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pa des na /
translated: When one enters the sixth level, one completely abandons that.

original: sa drug pas ni kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong bar byed de /
analyzed: sa drug pas ni kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, the sixth level abandons the two kinds of confusion and their negative tendencies.

original: dang po ni 'khor bar 'jug pa so sor rtog pa kun du 'byung ba rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni 'khor bar 'jug pa so sor rtog pa kun du 'byung ba rmongs pa ste /
translated: The first is the confusion that is the occurrence of the discrimination of entering samsara.

original: de ni 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa la 'khor bar 'jug pa'i spyod pa rnams yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa la 'khor bar 'jug pa'i spyod pa rnams yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is included in the afflicted class because it is the apprehension of the existence of the activities of entering samsara that is affliction.

original: gnyis pa ni mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i rmongs pa ste /
translated: The second is the delusion of the appearance of many signs.

original: de ni 'dir rnam par byang ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de ni 'dir rnam par byang ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing /
translated: It is said that this is the holding of the existence of purification,

original: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir mtshan ma mang po kun 'byung bas yun ring du mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor gnas par mi nus pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir mtshan ma mang po kun 'byung bas yun ring du mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor gnas par mi nus pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: because of the appearance of many signs, one is unable to remain for a long time in the yoga of signlessness.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni bag chags phra mo'i sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni bag chags phra mo'i sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary on the Dashabhumika, it is explained as the obstruction of subtle propensities.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary on the Mahayana-samgraha, translated by Trila, it is called the ignorance of the appearance of subtle signs.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba dag ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni rnam par rig pa tsam gyi mtshan ma rags pa kun du 'byung ba dag ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa'o //
translated: In the commentary by Master Vasubandhu, it is said that the appearance of coarse signs of mere representation is the appearance of signs.

original: ming rnam par gzhag cing ngo bo nyid brjod pa yang spyir rmongs pa gnyis bsdus par bshad na yang don du 'gal ba med pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ming rnam par gzhag cing ngo bo nyid brjod pa yang spyir rmongs pa gnyis bsdus par bshad na yang don du 'gal ba med pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And the explanation of the establishment of names and the nature of things as including the two kinds of confusion is not inconsistent with the meaning.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las mtshan ma rnams kun du 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa dang / don gyis bstan bcos rnams las 'byung ba dang mthun te /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las mtshan ma rnams kun du 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba zhes gsungs pa dang / don gyis bstan bcos rnams las 'byung ba dang mthun te /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning speaks of the occurrence of signs, and this sutra speaks of the occurrence of many signs, which is consistent with what appears in the treatises.

original: don 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no inconsistency in the meaning.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni thams cad kyang bdag po'i dbang du byas par bshad pa dag yin te /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni thams cad kyang bdag po'i dbang du byas par bshad pa dag yin te /
translated: With regard to the explanation of the verbal roots, all are explained in terms of the dominant condition.

original: mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan ma mang po kun du 'byung ba'i mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are signs because they are the occurrence of many signs.

original: brtags na brda phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags na brda phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you analyze them, you will understand the terms.

original: sa bdun pa las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa bdun pa'i sgrib pa bstan te /
analyzed: sa bdun pa las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa bdun pa'i sgrib pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the obscurations on the seventh level.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las @215a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las @215a * //
translated: Thus, from among the obscurations to omniscience,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis snga ma'i sa drug pa la /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis snga ma'i sa drug pa la /
translated: one part of the innate obscurations is eliminated on the sixth level.🔽On the seventh level, one meditates on the twelve links of dependent arising and one fully apprehends the subtle attributes of entry into samsara and the existence of the attributes of the reverse order.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis nyid du sgom zhing 'khor bar 'jug pa'i mtshan ma phra mo dang / lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan ma yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas mtshan ma de gnyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir sa bdun pa'i gya nom pa mtshan ma med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis nyid du sgom zhing 'khor bar 'jug pa'i mtshan ma phra mo dang / lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan ma yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas mtshan ma de gnyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir sa bdun pa'i gya nom pa mtshan ma med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
translated: Thus, the apprehension of those two attributes obscures the path of the subtle attributes of the seventh level.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only states:

original: bdun pa mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdun pa mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The seventh level is the obscuration that prevents the arising of subtle attributes.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas des sa bdun pa'i gya nom pa mtshan ma med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin pas des sa bdun pa'i gya nom pa mtshan ma med pa'i lam la sgrib par byed de /
translated: One part of the obscuration to omniscience is the apprehension of the subtle signs of production and disintegration as existing. It obstructs the path of signlessness that is the subtle excellence of the seventh level.

original: sa bdun par zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pas des na sa bdun pas ni kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong bar bshad de /
analyzed: sa bdun par zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pas des na sa bdun pas ni kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong bar bshad de /
translated: When one enters the seventh level, one completely abandons it. Therefore the seventh level is explained as abandoning the two kinds of confusion and their negative tendencies.

original: dang po ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i rmongs pa ste /
translated: The first is the confusion of the occurrence of subtle signs,

original: de 'dir skye ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing 'khor bar 'jug pa'i skye ba phra mo'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dir skye ba yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing 'khor bar 'jug pa'i skye ba phra mo'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because here one apprehends the existence of production and one takes up the subtle signs of production that enter into samsara.

original: gnyis pa ni gcig tu mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pas gnyer ba'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gcig tu mtshan ma med pa'i yid la byed pas gnyer ba'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The second is the confusion of striving for the attention of complete signlessness.

original: de ni 'di 'gog pa la yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir gcig tu mtshan ma med pa nyid yid la byed pas nan tan gyis yongs su tshol bar byed kyang stong pa nyid la spyod pa khyad par du 'phags🔽pa bskyed pas mi nus pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di 'gog pa la yod pa nyid du 'dzin cing lugs las ldog pa'i mtshan ma len pa'i phyir gcig tu mtshan ma med pa nyid yid la byed pas nan tan gyis yongs su tshol bar byed kyang stong pa nyid la spyod pa khyad par du 'phags pa bskyed pas mi nus pa'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because it is the apprehension of existence in the cessation of that, and because it is the taking of signs in the reverse of the system, it is not able to generate the special practice of emptiness by the earnest practice of attention to signlessness alone.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan ma phra mo'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan ma phra mo'i bag chags kyi sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary on the noble Ten Stages, it is explained as the obstruction of the instinct for subtle signs.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In the commentary on the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, translated by the one called Vṛddhi, it is called the ignorance that is the arising of subtle signs.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las ni mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary composed by the master Vasubandhu, it is explained as the arising of subtle signs.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa zhes bstan to //🔽dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i nyes pa zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib @215b pa zhes gsungs pa ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa las ming du gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las kyang mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib pa zhes bstan to // dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i nyes pa zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba'i sgrib @215b pa zhes gsungs pa ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa las ming du gzhag pa dang /
translated: The treatise Establishing Knowledge Only also teaches the obscuration of the arising of subtle signs.🔽The Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought teaches the fault of the arising of subtle signs, and this very sutra teaches the obscuration of the arising of subtle signs.

original: kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis bsdu ba yin pas /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis bsdu ba yin pas /
translated: These are statements about the same thing, for they are included in the two kinds of confusion about the nominal and the substantial.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba med pa yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba med pa yang gong ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as above, there is no contradiction between them.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang de dag thams cad bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang de dag thams cad bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the etymologies of these two obscurations is an explanation from the perspective of their dominant condition.

original: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as above.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the obscurations on the eighth level.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis mtshan ma med pa sgom pa rang gi ngang gis mi 'byung ba dang / kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyang bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis mtshan ma med pa sgom pa rang gi ngang gis mi 'byung ba dang / kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyang bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is the one part of the obscurations to knowledge that is not naturally eliminated that is the cause for not meditating on the absence of attributes and it also includes the two kinds of complete delusion.

original: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: The delusion of striving after the absence of attributes and the delusion of not mastering the presence of attributes.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: For this reason, the treatise Establishing Knowledge as Mere Cognizance states:

original: brgyad pa mtshan ma med pa las rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa mtshan ma med pa las rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscurations that consist of striving after the absence of attributes on the eighth level are as follows.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis mtshan ma med par bsgom pa rang gi ngang gis mi skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis mtshan ma med par bsgom pa rang gi ngang gis mi skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the non-spontaneous cultivation of signlessness by one part of the obstruction to knowledge.

original: sa snga ma lnga po dag tu mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor ni mang la /
analyzed: sa snga ma lnga po dag tu mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor ni mang la /
translated: On the first five stages, the yoga with signs is more frequent,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor ni nyung ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor ni nyung ngo //
translated: and the yoga without signs is less frequent.

original: sa drug pa la ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor ni nyung la /
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor ni nyung la /
translated: On the sixth stage, the yoga with signs is less frequent,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor ni mang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor ni mang ngo //
translated: and the yoga without signs is more frequent.

original: sa bdun pa la ni gcig tu mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor rgyun du mngon sum du 'gyur yang rtsol ba dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la ni gcig tu mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor rgyun du mngon sum du 'gyur yang rtsol ba dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: On the seventh stage, the yoga without signs is always manifest, but it is still accompanied by effort.🔽Thus, because of the effort in signlessness, one is not able to manifest the signless spontaneously.

original: 'di ltar mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis mtshan ma dang zhing ston par mi nus so zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis mtshan ma dang zhing ston par mi nus so zhes bya ba nas rgya cher bshad pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is explained in detail.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las mtshan ma med pa'i mngon bar 'du byed pa zhes bshad pa dang /🔽bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las mtshan ma med pa'i mngon bar 'du byed pa zhes bshad pa dang / bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: the commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna explains it as the manifest effort of signlessness,🔽and the treatise Proof of Consciousness Only explains it as the obscuration that is the effort of signlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba kun du rmongs pa gcig tu bsdus pa yin pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba kun du rmongs pa gcig tu bsdus pa yin pas 'di lta ste /
translated: Since all of these are included in a single confusion, it is as follows.

original: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa'o //🔽bstan @216a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa'o // bstan @216a * //
translated: It is the confusion that is the effort of signlessness.

original: bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ming gcig smos pa yang spyir kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ming gcig smos pa yang spyir kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The treatise Proof of Consciousness Only mentions one name, and in general it includes two confusions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang du ma gyur pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa dang / mtshan ma la dbang du ma gyur pa'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: and confusion about the absence of signs, and confusion about not mastering signs.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgol  ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgol  ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: In the sutra of profound intention,

original: mtshan ma med pa la rang gi ngang gis rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la rang gi ngang gis rtsol ba med par 'jug pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: it is said that this is the antidote to the automatic, effortless entry into the absence of signs.

original: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Here, there are two explanations.

original: kha cig na re sa brgyad pa la mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa'i spyod pa rtsol ba med pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas 'dis de la sgrib pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa la rang gi ngang gis rtsol ba med par 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs
analyzed: kha cig na re sa brgyad pa la mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa'i spyod pa rtsol ba med pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas 'dis de la sgrib pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa la rang gi ngang gis rtsol ba med par 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs
translated: Some say that on the eighth stage, the activity of the cognition of the absence of signs is effortless and automatic, and since this obscures that stage, it is called the automatic, effortless entry into the absence of signs.

original: te / 'di ni rnam pa gnyis las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: te / 'di ni rnam pa gnyis las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: This is one of two kinds of confusion about the absence of signs.

original: kha cig na re mdo de yang dgongs pa zab mo nges par dgrol pa'i mdo dang mthun par kun du rmongs pa gnyis cig car smos pa yin te /🔽de la dang po mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba nyid de //
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo de yang dgongs pa zab mo nges par dgrol pa'i mdo dang mthun par kun du rmongs pa gnyis cig car smos pa yin te / de la dang po mtshan ma med pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba nyid de //
translated: Some say: That sutra also mentions two confusions simultaneously in accordance with the sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning.

original: gnyis pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du 'gyur ba'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du 'gyur ba'i kun du rmongs pa zhes bya ba nyid do //
translated: The first is called the practice of signlessness and the second is called the fault of automatic engagement.

original: sgrib pa 'di gcig gis ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis tshang bar bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa 'di gcig gis ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis tshang bar bsdus pa yin te /
translated: These two confusions are subsumed by one obstruction.

original: mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: They should be understood as stated in the sutra.

original: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol pa'i sgrib pa zhes bstan pa ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa yang bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol pa'i sgrib pa zhes bstan pa ni bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: In the Proof of Consciousness Only, it is taught that the obscuration to striving for the absence of attributes is an obscuration in terms of its dominant condition.

original: 'di ltar mtshan ma med pa'i dbang gis rtsol ba'i shes pa 'byung bas rtsol ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan ma med pa'i dbang gis rtsol ba'i shes pa 'byung bas rtsol ba'i shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sgrib pa yin te /
translated: Thus, since a striving consciousness arises due to the power of the absence of attributes, the nature of a striving consciousness is an obscuration.

original: 'di ni rtsol ba'i shes pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsol ba'i shes pa'i sgrib pa yin pa'i phyir bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since this is an obscuration to a striving consciousness, it is an explanation in terms of its dominant condition.

original: mdo 'di nyid las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa zhes gsungs pa yang bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las mtshan ma med pa la rtsol ba dang mtshan ma dang bcas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa zhes gsungs pa yang bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This very sutra also speaks of the obscuration that is the lack of mastery with regard to striving for signlessness and with regard to that which possesses signs.🔽This is explained from the perspective of the dominant condition.🔽The ninth is the antidote to the obscuration that is the lack of mastery with regard to all aspects of skill in means.

original: @216b sa dgu pa las ni rnam pa thams cad du tshig mkhas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @216b sa dgu pa las ni rnam pa thams cad du tshig mkhas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni sa dgu pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the obscuration of the ninth bhumi.

original: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i chos la sgrib par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i chos la sgrib par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: In this way, one part of the obscuration to omniscience obscures the four correct and discerning awarenesses with regard to phenomena.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing the Mind-Only System says:

original: dgu pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa sgrub par mi 'dod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgu pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa sgrub par mi 'dod pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ninth is the obscuration that is the lack of desire to accomplish benefiting others.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po la rtson par mi 'dod cing rang gi don la mos pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po la rtson par mi 'dod cing rang gi don la mos pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the unwillingness to strive to benefit sentient beings with one's body, due to one's being obscured with regard to the means of benefiting others, and it is the wish to benefit oneself.

original: des sa dgu pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: des sa dgu pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la sgrib par byed de /
translated: It obscures the four detailed and thorough knowledges on the ninth level.

original: sa dgu pa la zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pas des nas dgu pas kun du rmongs pa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan len spong ngo zhes bstan te /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pas des nas dgu pas kun du rmongs pa gnyis dang de'i gnas ngan len spong ngo zhes bstan te /
translated: When one enters the ninth level, one completely eliminates it.

original: dang po ni chos bstan pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa dang / gzungs kyi dbang la kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni chos bstan pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge dpag tu med pa dang / gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa dang / gzungs kyi dbang la kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: The first is the confusion about the infinite names, words and letters of the teachings, about the higher and higher wisdom and eloquence and about the power of retention.

original: de la chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa'i gzungs la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la chos bstan pa dpag tu med pa'i gzungs la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The power of retention of the infinite teachings is as follows.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pas brjod par bya ba'i gzungs la dbang thob pas don gcig gi nang du don thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pas brjod par bya ba'i gzungs la dbang thob pas don gcig gi nang du don thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The retention of the meaning is the power over the retention of the expressible meaning, because it reveals all meanings within a single meaning.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge dpag tu med pa'i gzungs la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge dpag tu med pa'i gzungs la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The retention of the inexhaustible name, phrase, and syllable is the power over the retention of inexhaustible name, phrase, and syllable.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pas rjod par byed pa'i gzungs la dbang thob pas ming dang tshig dang yi ge gcig gi nang du ming dang tshig dang yi ge thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pas rjod par byed pa'i gzungs la dbang thob pas ming dang tshig dang yi ge gcig gi nang du ming dang tshig dang yi ge thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The retention of the expressible is the power over the retention of the expressible, because it reveals all names, phrases, and syllables within a single name, phrase, and syllable.

original: gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa dang gzungs la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gong nas gong du shes rab dang spobs pa dang gzungs la dbang ba zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The retention of the higher and higher wisdom, eloquence, and retention is the power over the retention of the higher and higher wisdom, eloquence, and retention.

original: tshig so so yang dag par rig pas sgra skad gcig gis gcig rnam par bshad pa'i gzungs la dbang thob pas sgra skad gcig gi nang du thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig so so yang dag par rig pas sgra skad gcig gis gcig rnam par bshad pa'i gzungs la dbang thob pas sgra skad gcig gi nang du thams cad ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The retention of the explanation of one by one is the power over the retention of the explanation of one by one, because it reveals all in a single sound.

original: gnyis pa ni spobs pa la dbang ba'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni spobs pa la dbang ba'i kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: The second is the confusion about mastery of eloquence.

original: de la spobs pa la dbang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la spobs pa la dbang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, mastery of eloquence is as follows:

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas dbang po la mkhas shing chos ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas dbang po la mkhas shing chos ston pa la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By means of the analytical knowledge of eloquence, one is skilled in the faculties and skilled in teaching the Dharma.

original: kun du rmongs pas dbang rnam pa bzhi po dag la sgrib par byed pa @217a * //
analyzed: kun du rmongs pas dbang rnam pa bzhi po dag la sgrib par byed pa @217a * //
translated: The four kinds of confusion that obscure the four kinds of mastery

original: gang yin pa de dag ni 'dir sgrib pa dgu pas bsdus pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yin pa de dag ni 'dir sgrib pa dgu pas bsdus pa yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: are included here in the nine obscurations.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni sems can la legs par phan mi 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa'i 'grel pa las ni sems can la legs par phan mi 'dogs pa'i sgrib pa zhes bshad do //
translated: In the commentary on the noble Ten Stages, it is explained as the obscuration that does not properly benefit sentient beings.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba rtsol ba la mi ltos pa'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ba dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba rtsol ba la mi ltos pa'i ma rig pa zhes 'byung ba dang / slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary on the treatise Compendium of the Great Vehicle, translated by the one called Vangīsa, it is called ignorance that does not depend on the effort of the activity of benefiting sentient beings, and in the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu,

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mi byed pa zhes 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i bya ba mi byed pa zhes 'byung ba ni /
translated: The phrase “not performing the action of benefiting sentient beings”

original: gnyi ga yang kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus pa yin pas don du 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus pa yin pas don du 'gal ba med de /
translated: means that both are included in the two kinds of confusion. In fact, there is no contradiction,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different.🔽The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says, “Not mastering the teaching of Dharma in all its aspects.”🔽And this sutra itself says, “The obstruction to not mastering verbal skill in all its aspects.”

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las rnam pa thams cad du chos bstan pa la dbang du ma gyur pa zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las rnam pa thams cad du tshig la mkhas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa zhes gsungs pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las rnam pa thams cad du chos bstan pa la dbang du ma gyur pa zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las rnam pa thams cad du tshig la mkhas pa la dbang du ma gyur pa'i sgrib pa zhes gsungs pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of these passages.

original: kha cig na re 'di ni spobs pa la dbang ba'i kun du rmongs pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni spobs pa la dbang ba'i kun du rmongs pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: Some say that this is just the confusion about eloquence.

original: kha gcig na re spyir kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha gcig na re spyir kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that in general it includes the two kinds of confusion.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad du tshig la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la spyir rnam pa thams cad tshig la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad du tshig la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la spyir rnam pa thams cad tshig la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, skill in words is the four correct knowledges. In general, all aspects are called skill in words.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni gong du bstan pa'i bstan bcos dang / 'grel pa rnam pa bzhi dang mdo gnyis po dag las bstan pa thams cad kyang bdag po'i dbang du mdzad pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni gong du bstan pa'i bstan bcos dang / 'grel pa rnam pa bzhi dang mdo gnyis po dag las bstan pa thams cad kyang bdag po'i dbang du mdzad pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: Here, the teaching of the etymologies is that all teachings from the four treatises and two sutras explained above are explanations from the perspective of the master,

original: brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu dug pa /
analyzed: brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro / // / bam po bzhi bcu dug pa /
translated: and if examined, one will understand.

original: sa bcu pa la ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba ma thob pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba ma thob pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sa bcu pa'i sgrib pa bstan pa'o //
translated: On the tenth ground, it is the antidote to the obscurations to attaining the full realization of the dharmakāya. This is the explanation of the obscurations of the tenth ground.

original: 'di yang shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang shes bya'i sgrib pa las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig yin no //
translated: This is also one part of the innate obscurations to omniscience.

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas bstan pa dang sbyar na kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyang bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las 'og nas bstan pa dang sbyar na kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis kyang bsdus pa yin te /
translated: And if it is applied to the teaching of the treatise and the later part of this very sutra, it also includes the two kinds of delusion.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Thus the SaJldhinirmocana says:

original: bcu pa chos rnams la dbang ma thob pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu pa chos rnams la dbang ma thob pa'i sgrib pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The obscuration to the nonacquisition of mastery over phenomena is as follows.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa las @217b lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis chos rnams la dbang thob par mi byed pas des sa bcu pa'i chos chen po'i sprin gyi shes pa dang / yongs su sbas pa dang des bskyed pa'i bya ba dag la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa las @217b lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig gis chos rnams la dbang thob par mi byed pas des sa bcu pa'i chos chen po'i sprin gyi shes pa dang / yongs su sbas pa dang des bskyed pa'i bya ba dag la sgrib par byed de /
translated: One part of the obscuration to omniscience does not allow mastery over phenomena to be acquired, and thus it obscures the cognition of the great Dharma cloud of the tenth level, the complete protection of that cognition, and the activities generated by it.

original: sa bcu par zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pa des na sa bcu pas kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong bar byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa bcu par zhugs pa'i tshe yongs su spong bar byed pa des na sa bcu pas kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong bar byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: When one enters the tenth level, one completely abandons it. Therefore the tenth level abandons the two kinds of delusion and their negative tendencies.

original: sa dang po ni mngon par shes pa chen po la kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: sa dang po ni mngon par shes pa chen po la kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The first level is confusion about the great higher perceptions.

original: de ni 'di ltar des bskyed pa'i bya ba dag la sgrib par byed pa zhes bstan pa nyid do /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar des bskyed pa'i bya ba dag la sgrib par byed pa zhes bstan pa nyid do /
translated: It is taught that it obscures the activities generated by those.

original: gnyis pa ni gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug cing khong du chud pa la kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug cing khong du chud pa la kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The second is confusion about engaging in and comprehending the secret.

original: de ni 'dir chos chen po'i sprin gyi shes pa dang yongs su sbas pa la sgrib par byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir chos chen po'i sprin gyi shes pa dang yongs su sbas pa la sgrib par byed pa nyid do zhes bstan pa nyid do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is taught that it obscures the cognition of the great Dharma cloud and complete concealment.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las chos rnams la dbang ma thob pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba ni kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis las gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug cing khong du chud pa la kun du rmongs pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu'i 'grel pa dang / bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las chos rnams la dbang ma thob pa'i sgrib pa zhes 'byung ba ni kun du rmongs pa rnam pa gnyis las gsang ba'i rjes su 'jug cing khong du chud pa la kun du rmongs pa zhes bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The commentary on the Ten Stages and the commentary on the Mahayana Compendium translated by Trilaksa speak of the obscuration that is the non-acquisition of power over things, which is taught to be the confusion that engages in and penetrates the secret.

original: yang na spyir kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus par bstan to //
analyzed: yang na spyir kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus par bstan to //
translated: Or, in general, it is taught to be included in the two confusions.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las sa bcu pa las ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba'i gnyen po'o zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las sa bcu pa la ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba ma thob pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes gsungs pas kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus par bshad na yang don du 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las sa bcu pa las ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba'i gnyen po'o zhes gsungs pa dang / mdo 'di nyid las sa bcu pa la ni chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa mngon du bya ba ma thob pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes gsungs pas kun du rmongs pa gnyis bsdus par bshad na yang don du 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, although it is explained that the two obscurations are subsumed within the two confusions, there is no contradiction in the meaning.

original: logs shig tu ma sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: logs shig tu ma sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not applied separately.

original: mdo 'di nyid las chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa ma thob pa zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi sku'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa ma thob pa zhes gsungs pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi sku'i dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The statement in this sutra that the complete perfection of the body of attributes is not attained is taught from the perspective of the body of suchness.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Compendium of Higher Knowledge says:

original: de la chos kyi sku ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The body of attributes is as follows.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa gtan du spangs shing gnas gyur pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa gtan du spangs shing gnas gyur pas bsdus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of the knowledge of all things in every way, and it is the relinquishment and transformation of the obstructions to that which is to be known.

original: de yang sa bcu pa las ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sa bcu pa las ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And that is called “complete” in the Ten Stages.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni mngon par grub pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni mngon par grub pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: And on the stage of the Tathāgata it is called “perfected.”

original: de la nges pa'i @218a * //
analyzed: de la nges pa'i @218a * //
translated: Here the explanation is in terms of the master.

original: tshig bstan pa ni bstan bcos rnam pa bzhi dang / mdo 'di nyid las bstan cing gsungs pa'i ming la tha dad pa yod kyang thob pa'i ming du mtshungs pas bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig bstan pa ni bstan bcos rnam pa bzhi dang / mdo 'di nyid las bstan cing gsungs pa'i ming la tha dad pa yod kyang thob pa'i ming du mtshungs pas bdag po'i dbang du byas pa'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the terms is as follows: although there are different names taught and mentioned in the four treatises and in this very sūtra, the explanation is in terms of the master because the names are the same in terms of attainment.

original: rigs kyi bu zhig nas dang lhag mthong de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra ba mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs par ni sgrib pa
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhig nas dang lhag mthong de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra ba mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs par ni sgrib pa
translated: “Son of noble family, those śamatha and vipaśyanā on the stage of the Tathāgata are the antidotes to the most subtle, the most extremely subtle, afflictive and cognitive obstructions.”

original: bcu gcig pa bstan to //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa bstan to //
translated: This is the eleventh explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: yongs su spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa bstan pa dang / sgrib pa spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa bstan pa dang / sgrib pa spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa ste /
translated: the teaching of the obscurations to be abandoned, and the teaching of the benefits of abandoning the obscurations.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sgrib pa gnyis las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis las lhan cig skyes pa'i phyogs gcig go //
translated: one part of the innate obscurations.

original: de la shin tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de la shin tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Among them, “very subtle” refers to the afflictive obscurations.

original: mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: “Extremely subtle” refers to the knowledge obscurations.

original: yang na shin tu phra ba dang / mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa gnyis ka dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na shin tu phra ba dang / mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa gnyis ka dang yang sbyar te /
translated: Or, “very subtle” and “extremely subtle” are applied to both obscurations.

original: gnas skabs mthar thug pas yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ni shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs mthar thug pas yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ni shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “very subtle” because they are to be abandoned by the final stage.

original: gnas skabs mchog gis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ni mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs mchog gis yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ni mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “extremely subtle” because they are to be abandoned by the supreme stage.

original: gzhan yang kun du rmongs pa shin tu phra ba med pas shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang kun du rmongs pa shin tu phra ba med pas shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is called subtle because there is no very subtle confusion.

original: shin tu phra ba mchog tu gyur pa med pas mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba mchog tu gyur pa med pas mchog tu ches shin tu phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called very subtle because there is no supreme subtlety.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las sgrib pa gnyis las mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni sa dang po pas spangs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i 'grel pa las sgrib pa gnyis las mthong bas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni sa dang po pas spangs so //
translated: In the commentary to the noble Buddha Land, it is said that the bodhisattva abandons on the first stage those obscurations that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba las shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos rnams las bstan pa dag dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba las shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos rnams las bstan pa dag dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: And it is said that the obscurations to omniscience that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are in accordance with the teachings of the scriptures and treatises.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams las lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni snga ma'i sa bcu po rnams su ched du bzhag nas mi spong gi / sangs rgyas kyi sar gdod spong ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams las lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni snga ma'i sa bcu po rnams su ched du bzhag nas mi spong gi / sangs rgyas kyi sar gdod spong ste /
translated: As for the innate afflictions, they are not abandoned on the first ten stages, but are set aside and abandoned only on the stage of buddhahood.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Establishing the Cognition Only says:

original: sa 'dir chos la dbang thob mod kyi sgrib pa lhag ma dang bcas pas shin tu mthar thug pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: sa 'dir chos la dbang thob mod kyi sgrib pa lhag ma dang bcas pas shin tu mthar thug pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Although one obtains power over phenomena on this level, it is not called “ultimate” because it still has remaining obscurations.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo dang / rang gi rang gis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa gang yin pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur @218b pa na de dag cig car spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar 'jug pas des na sangs rgyas kyi sar
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig skyes pa'i shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo dang / rang gi rang gis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa gang yin pa rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur @218b pa na de dag cig car spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar 'jug pas des na sangs rgyas kyi sar
translated: Thus, the subtle innate cognitive obscurations and the seeds of the afflictive obscurations that occur naturally are simultaneously eliminated when the vajralike samadhi manifests and one enters the tathagata stage.

original: kun du rmongs pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong ngo zhes bshad do /
analyzed: kun du rmongs pa gnyis dang / de'i gnas ngan len spong ngo zhes bshad do /
translated: Therefore, it is explained that on the buddha stage, the two kinds of complete confusion and their negative tendencies are eliminated.

original: dang po ni shes bya thams cad la chags pa phra mo'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni shes bya thams cad la chags pa phra mo'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The first is the complete confusion of subtle attachment to all objects of knowledge.

original: de ni 'dis shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dis shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra mo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught to be the extremely subtle cognitive obscuration.

original: gnyis pa ni thogs pa shin tu phra mo'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni thogs pa shin tu phra mo'i kun du rmongs pa ste /
translated: The second is the complete confusion of subtle obstruction.

original: de ni 'dir rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon zhes bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni 'dir rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i sa bon zhes bstan pa nyid de /
translated: That is called the seed of the obscuration that is the innate affliction here.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon par kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon par kun las btus pa las /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma,🔽it is taught:

original: de byang chub thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa cig car spong ba'o //
analyzed: de byang chub thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa cig car spong ba'o //
translated: When he attains enlightenment, he simultaneously abandons the obscuration that is the affliction and the obscuration that is the object of knowledge.

original: cig car dgra bcom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: cig car dgra bcom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur te /
translated: Simultaneously he becomes an arhat and a tathāgata.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang / byang chub chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang / byang chub chen po thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: He attains the great nirvāṇa and the great enlightenment.

original: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa 'di ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las gsungs pa 'di ni kun du rmongs pa gnyis bstan pa nyid do //
translated: This sūtra itself teaches the two confusions.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: In the Sūtra Unraveling the Profound Thought,🔽it says:

original: sa bcu gcig pa la ni shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra ba dang mchog tu ches shing tu phra ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni phyogs gcig tu shes bya'i sgrib pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa la ni shes bya'i sgrib pa shin tu phra ba dang mchog tu ches shing tu phra ba'i gnyen por gyur pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni phyogs gcig tu shes bya'i sgrib pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: On the eleventh level, it is the antidote to the extremely subtle and most subtle of the obscurations to omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa 'di ni bstan bcos gzhan dag las mi ltos pas de'i phyir 'dir ma sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sgrib pa 'di ni bstan bcos gzhan dag las mi ltos pas de'i phyir 'dir ma sbyar ro //
translated: This obscuration on the level of buddhahood is not dependent on other treatises, and so it is not applied here.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni rnam par bshad pa drug las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni rnam par bshad pa drug las yongs su 'dzin pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the term is the explanation of the term “obscuration” as an apprehension, as stated in the Six Expanses:

original: de ltar sgrib pa de dag yongs su bcom pa'i phyir mthar thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thob cing dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa la brten nas chos kyi sku shin tu rnam par dag pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sgrib pa spangs pa'i phan yon ston to //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa de dag yongs su bcom pa'i phyir mthar thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thob cing dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa la brten nas chos kyi sku shin tu rnam par dag pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sgrib pa spangs pa'i phan yon ston to //
translated: Thus, in order to completely conquer those obscurations, in the end, one attains unobstructed knowledge and vision with regard to everything, and on the basis of the object of the perfected transcendent state, the extremely pure Dharma Body is established. This is the second, showing the benefit of abandoning the obscurations.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This statement of the sutra is divided into two parts.

original: dang po ni sgrib pa spangs nas shes pa dang / mthong ba thob par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni sgrib pa spangs nas shes pa dang / mthong ba thob par bstan pa ste /
translated: The first is the teaching on attaining knowledge and vision by abandoning the obscurations.

original: 'di ltar sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis gtan du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis gtan du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like this because the two types of obscurations are completely abandoned.

original: go rims bzhin du mthar chos stong pa nyid kyis chags pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thams cad 'thob pa dang / gang zag stong pa nyid kyi thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thams cad 'thob par 'gyur te /
