analyzed: go rims bzhin du mthar chos stong pa nyid kyis chags pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thams cad 'thob pa dang / gang zag stong pa nyid kyi thogs pa med pa'i shes pa dang / mthong ba thams cad 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: In order, the knowledge free from attachment to the ultimate, the emptiness of phenomena, and the unobstructed knowledge of the emptiness of persons, respectively, obtain all sights.

original: de'i phyir @219a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @219a * //
translated: Thus,

original: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: in the treatise Establishing Cognition Only,🔽it says:

original: de la chags pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya'i sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: de la chags pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya'i sgrib pa yin no //
translated: “Attachment” is the obscuration of knowables.🔽“Obstruction” is the afflictive obscuration.

original: thogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yin no zhes 'byung bas chos stong pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i shes rab ni chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thogs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yin no zhes 'byung bas chos stong pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i shes rab ni chags pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus the wisdom meditating on the emptiness of phenomena is called “free from attachment.”

original: gang zag stong pa nyid du sgom pa'i shes pa ni thogs pa med pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag stong pa nyid du sgom pa'i shes pa ni thogs pa med pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge meditating on the emptiness of persons is called “unobstructed.”

original: gnyis pa ni dmigs par bya ba las chos kyi sku rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dmigs par bya ba las chos kyi sku rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The second is the presentation of the dharmakāya from the perspective of the object of observation.

original: 'di ltar bzhi po dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa la brten nas sgrib pa gnyis yongs su spangs pa rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku rnam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar bzhi po dgongs pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa la brten nas sgrib pa gnyis yongs su spangs pa rnam par dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi chos kyi sku rnam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: Thus, on the basis of the object of the four kinds of realization of the accomplished intent, the Dharma Body of Suchness, which is pure in having completely abandoned the two obstructions, is established.

original: yang na chos kyi sku rnam pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos kyi sku rnam pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Or else, the two kinds of Dharma Body are established.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Bodhisattva Maitreya again addressed the Lord:🔽Lord, how is it that the Bodhisattvas, on the basis of calm abiding and insight, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment in order to practice?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas nan tan du bsgrub pa'i slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas nan tan du bsgrub pa'i slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni
translated: From here on, in the section beginning with this question,

original: bcu drug pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis byang chub thob par bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcu drug pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis byang chub thob par bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: it teaches the sixteenth chapter called The Door of Teaching the Attainment of Awakening through Calm Abiding and Insight.

original: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also shown by the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the request itself.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa de dag gis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas nan tan du bsgrubs pa'i slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa de dag gis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas nan tan du bsgrubs pa'i slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur
translated: How is it that the bodhisattvas who have attained serenity and insight, by means of serenity and insight, will fully awaken to supreme genuine enlightenment through practice?

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' byams pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa dang de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpa' byams pa zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa dang de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te /
translated: “Son of good family, the bodhisattva Maitreya has attained serenity and insight. He will fully awaken to supreme genuine enlightenment through practice by means of serenity and insight, beginning with the seven aspects of suchness.

original: ci ltar thos pa dang bsams pa'i chos dag la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems khyad par can gyis legs par gtan la 'bebs pa dang / legs par bsams pa dang / legs par gzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid de nyid nang du yang dag par yid la byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to /
analyzed: ci ltar thos pa dang bsams pa'i chos dag la mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems khyad par can gyis legs par gtan la 'bebs pa dang / legs par bsams pa dang / legs par gzhag pa'i de bzhin nyid de nyid nang du yang dag par yid la byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to /
translated: The second, the Tathagata's reply, is indicated by the passage beginning, He properly determines the Dharma that he has heard and contemplated with a special mind of meditative equipoise, and he attends properly and correctly to the suchness of what he has properly contemplated and properly settled.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: @219b rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: @219b rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: an explanation and a summary.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The first is also taught in two parts:

original: rgyu'i gnas skabs su spyod pa rnams brtson 'grus kyis sgrub par bstan pa dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs byang chub thob par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i gnas skabs su spyod pa rnams brtson 'grus kyis sgrub par bstan pa dang / 'bras bu'i gnas skabs byang chub thob par bstan pa'o //
translated: the practice at the stage of the cause, which is taught as the accomplishment through effort, and the result at the stage of the effect, which is taught as the attainment of enlightenment.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into three parts:

original: don nyid bstan pa dang / dpes bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: don nyid bstan pa dang / dpes bstan pa dang / dpe dang don du sbyar ba'o //
translated: the teaching on the meaning itself, the teaching through examples and the application of the examples to the meaning.

original: don nyid bstan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: don nyid bstan pa la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are also two kinds of explanations of the teaching of the meaning itself.

original: kha cig na re 'di ni lam rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas bstan pa yin pas rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni lam rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas bstan pa yin pas rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: Some say: Since this is taught in terms of the four paths, it is classified as fourfold.

original: tshogs kyi gnas skabs bstan pa dang / des zhes bya ba man chad kyis sbyor ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / de phan chad ces bya ba man chad kyis mthong ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / gong ma gong ma zhes bya ba man chad kyis bsgom pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi gnas skabs bstan pa dang / des zhes bya ba man chad kyis sbyor ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / de phan chad ces bya ba man chad kyis mthong ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / gong ma gong ma zhes bya ba man chad kyis bsgom pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa'o //
translated: The stage of the path of accumulation is taught, the stage of preparation is taught by the passage beginning with “by that,” the stage of seeing is taught by the passage beginning with “beyond that” and the stage of meditation is taught by the passage beginning with “higher than that.”

original: 'di ni dang po'i tshogs kyi lam gyi gnas skabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'i tshogs kyi lam gyi gnas skabs bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the stage of the path of accumulation.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This passage of the sutra is also classified as twofold.

original: dang po ni tshogs kyi lam la gnas pa'i gang zag zhi gnas dang lhag mthor thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni tshogs kyi lam la gnas pa'i gang zag zhi gnas dang lhag mthor thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the teaching of the yogi who obtains serenity and insight on the path of accumulation.

original: gnyis pa ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te zhes bya ba man chad kyis ni yul la brten nas lhag mthong skye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te zhes bya ba man chad kyis ni yul la brten nas lhag mthong skye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The second is indicated by the passage beginning with “from the seven aspects of thusness.”

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye'o //
translated: This also is divided into three parts.

original: de la dang po de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni brtag par bya ba'i yul smos pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni brtag par bya ba'i yul smos pa ste /
translated: The first is indicated by the passage beginning with “from the seven aspects of thusness,” which refers to the object of investigation.

original: 'di ltar tshogs kyi gnas skabs su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshogs kyi gnas skabs su zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de dag la brten nas /
translated: Thus, in the context of the accumulations, on the basis of śamatha and vipaśyanā,

original: de bzhin nyid bdun po dag la rtog par byed pas so //🔽gnyis pa ji ltar thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi gnas bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bdun po dag la rtog par byed pas so // gnyis pa ji ltar thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi gnas bstan te /
translated: one investigates the seven aspects of thusness.🔽The second is indicated by the passage beginning with “as heard,” which teaches the basis of the three types of wisdom.

original: de la ji ltar thos pa zhes bya ba'i thos pa'i shes rab kyi gnas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de la ji ltar thos pa zhes bya ba'i thos pa'i shes rab kyi gnas bstan pa ste /
translated: The first is the basis of the wisdom of hearing, which is indicated by the passage beginning with “as heard.”

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni nyan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni nyan par byed pa'o //
translated: “Hearing” means listening.

original: de ni rna ba'i dbang pos rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed na bstan pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rna ba'i dbang pos rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed na bstan pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the ear faculty generates the ear consciousness, one hears the teachings.

original: bsams pa'i chos dag la zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'i shes rab kyi gnas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bsams pa'i chos dag la zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'i shes rab kyi gnas bstan pa ste /
translated: With regard to the Dharma that is contemplated, the basis of wisdom that is contemplated is indicated.

original: 'di ltar bsams pa'i shes rab ni bstan pa dag la sems par byed pas shes rab skyed nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams pa'i shes rab ni bstan pa dag la sems par byed pas shes rab skyed nas /
translated: Thus, wisdom that is contemplated generates wisdom that is reflected upon,

original: chos rnams la sems shing rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la sems shing rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one contemplates and thoroughly differentiates phenomena.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems khyad par can zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i gnas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems khyad par can zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i gnas bstan pa ste /
translated: The special mind of meditative equipoise is indicated as the basis of meditation.

original: bsgom pa ni goms par byed @220a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni goms par byed @220a * //
translated: Meditation is cultivation,

original: pa ste / de ni ting nge 'dzin khyad par can gyi shes rab skyed nas gnyen po sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ste / de ni ting nge 'dzin khyad par can gyi shes rab skyed nas gnyen po sgom par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates wisdom that is special meditative stabilization and cultivates the antidote.

original: legs par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag gis bskyed pa'i shes rab bstan pa ste /
analyzed: legs par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag gis bskyed pa'i shes rab bstan pa ste /
translated: The wisdom that is generated by those is indicated by “correct ascertainment” and so on.

original: de la thos pa'i shes rab kyis ni de bzhin nyid bdun la brten nas lags par gtan la 'bebs so //
analyzed: de la thos pa'i shes rab kyis ni de bzhin nyid bdun la brten nas lags par gtan la 'bebs so //
translated: The wisdom of hearing, based on the seven kinds of reality, determines reality well.

original: legs par bsams pas zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: legs par bsams pas zhes bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The wisdom arisen from reflection.

original: legs par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas nang du yid la byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: legs par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas nang du yid la byed pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: The wisdom arisen from meditation, based on the seven kinds of reality, is the mental orientation to reality internally.

original: kha cig na re 'di ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: Some say that this is divided into three parts:

original: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / mthong ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / mthong ba'i gnas skabs bstan pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the stage of application, the teaching on the stage of seeing, and the teaching on the path of meditation.

original: sbyor ba'i lam bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam bstan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The teaching on the path of application is divided into two parts:

original: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i sgom pa bstan pa dang / des zhes bya ba man chad kyis mtshan ma rnam par sel ba bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid yid la byed pa'i sgom pa bstan pa dang / des zhes bya ba man chad kyis mtshan ma rnam par sel ba bstan pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the teaching on the meditation of mental orientation to reality and the teaching on the elimination of signs, from “by that” on.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su phye nas bstan te /
translated: This passage of the sutra is also taught by dividing it into two parts.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas yid la byed pa sgom pa bstan pa dang / legs par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba man chad de kho na nyid du sgom pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas yid la byed pa sgom pa bstan pa dang / legs par gtan la 'bebs pa zhes bya ba man chad de kho na nyid du sgom pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of mental attention based on the seven aspects of reality is taught, and the cultivation of reality itself is taught from the point of “correct ascertainment.”

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams nas ci ltar thos pa dang bas mas pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa khyad par can gyi stobs kyis dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs su kun du tshol ba bzhi po dag gis legs par gtan la 'bebs shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las brtsams nas ci ltar thos pa dang bas mas pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa khyad par can gyi stobs kyis dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo'i gnas skabs su kun du tshol ba bzhi po dag gis legs par gtan la 'bebs shing /
translated: Thus, beginning with the seven aspects of reality, bodhisattvas, by the power of their special meditative equipoise on what they have heard and reflected on, correctly ascertain with the four thorough investigations in the state of heat and the peak.

original: nang gi mtshan ma'am phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: nang gi mtshan ma'am phyi rol gyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: The internal sign, the external sign,

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa nang la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa nang la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa gsum pa'o //
translated: and the sign of both internal and external are the second, the three kinds of signs of internal and so on.

original: phyi nang la sogs pa de yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: phyi nang la sogs pa de yang mdor bsdu na bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: In brief, there are three explanations of internal and external.

original: kha cig na re rang gi lus gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re rang gi lus gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: The body itself is called internal.

original: gzhan gyi lus gang yin pa de ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus gang yin pa de ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
translated: Other bodies are called external.

original: gnyi ga bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni phyi nang zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni phyi nang zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: That which includes both is called internal and external.

original: kha cig na re dbang po drug po dag ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re dbang po drug po dag ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: The six sense faculties are called internal.

original: yul drug po dag ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul drug po dag ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
translated: The six objects are called external.

original: gnyi ga bsdus pa ni phyi nang zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga bsdus pa ni phyi nang zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: That which includes both is called internal and external.

original: kha cig na re sems can gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re sems can gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: Sentient beings are called internal.

original: sems can ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyi @220b rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyi @220b rol zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-sentient beings are called external.

original: gnyi ga bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni phyi nang zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga bsdus pa gang yin pa de ni phyi nang zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: That which includes both is called internal and external.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las phyi nang gi chos kyi bye brag rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las phyi nang gi chos kyi bye brag rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: The Great Exegesis explains that there are three types of internal and external phenomena.

original: dang po 'brel ba'i phyi nang ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po 'brel ba'i phyi nang ni 'di lta ste /
translated: First, external and internal in terms of connection is as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus la yod pa gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus la yod pa gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever exists in one's own body is called internal.

original: gzhan gyi lus la yod pa dang sems can ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus la yod pa dang sems can ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni phyi rol zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever exists in another's body and whatever is not a sentient being is called external.

original: gnyis pa gnas kyi phyi nang ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa gnas kyi phyi nang ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Second, external and internal in terms of basis is as follows.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rten gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i rten gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the basis of the mind and mental factors is called internal.

original: dmigs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni phyir rol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba gang yin pa de ni phyir rol zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the object of observation is called external.

original: gsum pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i phyi nang ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i phyi nang ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Third, external and internal in terms of sentient beings and non-sentient beings is as follows.

original: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni nang zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever phenomena belong to the category of sentient beings is called internal.

original: sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni phyi rol zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems can ma yin pa'i grangs su gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni phyi rol zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Whatever phenomena belong to the category of non-sentient beings is called external.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo las ni gong ma'i bshad pa gnyis dang mthun par bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo las ni gong ma'i bshad pa gnyis dang mthun par bshad de /
translated: The noble Perfection of Wisdom sutras and so on explain in accordance with the two above explanations.🔽Therefore, the same sutra says:

original: de'i phyir de nyid las nang stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las nang stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is as follows:

original: nang gi skye mched drug po dag go //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug po dag go //
translated: The six internal sense spheres.

original: phyi stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena is as follows:

original: phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skye mched drug po dag go //
translated: The six external sense spheres.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of external and internal phenomena is as follows:

original: phyi nang gi skye mched drug po dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi nang gi skye mched drug po dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The six internal and external sense spheres.

original: bdag gis sems can gyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can gyi don la sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The sign called “I will apply myself to the welfare of sentient beings” is the teaching of the third sign, which is the benefit of others.

original: 'di ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: 'di ni bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: This is taught in the Commentary on the Compendium of Abhidharma:

original: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa zhes bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa zhes bstan pa nyid de /
translated: The practice of benefiting sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is because they benefit sentient beings through these four means of gathering disciples.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i nang na gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i nang na gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i spyod pa'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, in that same text, it is said that the conduct that benefits others is the best of all conducts.

original: rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in detail as it is taught in the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mtshan ma'am de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mtshan ma'am de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The sign of correct knowledge or the sign of suchness is the teaching on the sign of correct wisdom and suchness.

original: yang na 'dir mtshan ma rnam pa lnga rab tu dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'dir mtshan ma rnam pa lnga rab tu dbye ba yin te /
translated: Or else, here the five kinds of signs are distinguished.

original: mtshan ma ni ming dang rgyu mtshan rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni ming dang rgyu mtshan rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The sign is name, causal process, imagination, correct knowledge, and suchness.

original: gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir 'di re zhig mtshan ma gnyis pa @221a * //
analyzed: gtso bo'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir 'di re zhig mtshan ma gnyis pa @221a * //
translated: From the point of view of the principal, these are the two kinds of signs.

original: bstan te / ming la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa lnga rgya cher 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan te / ming la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa lnga rgya cher 'byed pa ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The five kinds of signs, such as name, are extensively distinguished in the Yogācārabhūmi Sāstra.

original: legs par sems par byed pas rnam par shes pa ni 'jog la mtshan ma ni rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: legs par sems par byed pas rnam par shes pa ni 'jog la mtshan ma ni rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: The consciousness is placed by proper mental attention, and the sign is eliminated.

original: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa bzhi po dag gis de bzhin nyid la legs par bzhag nas /
analyzed: bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsgom pa bzhi po dag gis de bzhin nyid la legs par bzhag nas /
translated: In the stage of acquiescence and the supreme mundane quality, one properly places suchness by means of the four correct meditations on reality,

original: nang gi yang dag par yid la byed pas 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam par sel bar byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: nang gi yang dag par yid la byed pas 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa yang rnam par sel bar byed do zhe'o //
translated: and by means of internal correct attention, one eliminates the consciousness that grasps.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid rgya cher bshad pa ni sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid rgya cher bshad pa ni sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The characteristics of these are explained extensively above.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang 'dir re zhig bshad pa phyi ma dang sbyar nas bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang 'dir re zhig bshad pa phyi ma dang sbyar nas bstan to //
translated: Although there are two kinds of explanations, here the latter is applied to the explanation.

original: des de bzhin nyid yang dag par yid la byas pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba thams cad las yang btang snyoms su 'jog na mtshan ma rags pa dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa
analyzed: des de bzhin nyid yang dag par yid la byas pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung ba thams cad las yang btang snyoms su 'jog na mtshan ma rags pa dag la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa
translated: Since he has correctly attended to reality, he is indifferent to all the arising of subtle signs of mind, so what need is there to mention coarse signs?🔽This is the second

original: mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: elimination of signs.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: rnam par sel ba nyid bstan pa dang / des de ltar spyod pa de dag la mang du gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis sems legs par sbyor ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par sel ba nyid bstan pa dang / des de ltar spyod pa de dag la mang du gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis sems legs par sbyor ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on elimination itself and the teaching on the proper mental application of those who practice in that way, from “because they abide in that much” onward.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum ste mtshan ma rnam par sel ba mdor bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad yongs su bsal bar bya ba'i mtshan ma bstan pa dang / kun du 'byung ba de dag ces bya ba man chad kyis rnam par sel ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum ste mtshan ma rnam par sel ba mdor bstan pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad yongs su bsal bar bya ba'i mtshan ma bstan pa dang / kun du 'byung ba de dag ces bya ba man chad kyis rnam par sel ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
translated: The first is also threefold: the brief indication of the elimination of signs, the indication of the signs to be eliminated beginning with “O son of noble lineage,” and the correct teaching of the elimination itself beginning with “those arising.”

original: 'di ni dang po'o //🔽'di ltar sbyor ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i des de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas yang dag par yid la byas pa'i phyir so sor rtog par byed pa'i sems des sems kyi len pa la sogs pa mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o // 'di ltar sbyor ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i des de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun la brten nas yang dag par yid la byas pa'i phyir so sor rtog par byed pa'i sems des sems kyi len pa la sogs pa mtshan ma phra mo kun du 'byung
translated: This is the first.

original: ba yang yongs su spong bar byed na /
analyzed: ba yang yongs su spong bar byed na /
translated: Thus, because the bodhisattva who is situated in the application correctly attends to reality on the basis of these seven aspects, the mind that discriminates completely abandons even the subtle signs of the mind’s appropriation and so on that arise.

original: mtshan ma rags pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma rags pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How much more so the gross signs. This is the meaning.

original: de la mtshan ma rags pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs ston pas yongs su bzung ba'i mtshan ma rnams so //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma rags pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnas skabs ston pas yongs su bzung ba'i mtshan ma rnams so //
translated: The so-called gross signs are the signs that are taken up because they indicate the state of distraction.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun du 'byung ba'i mtshan ma thams cad do //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun du 'byung ba'i mtshan ma thams cad do //
translated: Or, they are all the signs that are the origin of affliction.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i khams sa 'og ma'i mtshan ma rnams te /🔽de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rags pa'i mtshan @221b ma gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i khams sa 'og ma'i mtshan ma rnams te / de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rags pa'i mtshan @221b ma gang zhe na /
translated: Or, they are the signs of the lower stages of the realm of desire.

original: sa 'og ma la rags par lta ba'i mtshan ma rags pa thams cad do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la rags par lta ba'i mtshan ma rags pa thams cad do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says, “What are gross signs? They are all gross signs that are seen as gross in the lower stages.”

original: rigs kyi bu de la mtshan ma phra mo ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de la mtshan ma phra mo ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, subtle signs are as follows:

original: sems kyis len pa'i mtshan ma'am /🔽myong ba'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sems kyis len pa'i mtshan ma'am / myong ba'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: signs that are taken up by the mind,🔽signs that are experienced,

original: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma 'am /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma 'am /
translated: signs that are cognized,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yongs su bsal bar bya ba'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yongs su bsal bar bya ba'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The sign of complete affliction and purification, etc. indicates the second, the sign of what is to be eliminated.

original: yongs su bsal bar bya ba'i mtshan ma de yang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig yod de /
analyzed: yongs su bsal bar bya ba'i mtshan ma de yang rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gcig yod de /
translated: That sign of what is to be eliminated is of twenty one types,

original: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig tu bsdus nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu gcig tu bsdus nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: and it is taught as being summarized in eleven aspects.

original: 'di ni dang po len pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po len pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the first, the teaching of the four signs of appropriation, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i yul dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i yul dang sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be applied respectively to the objects of the applications of mindfulness of body, feeling, mind and phenomena.

original: de ni 'di skad du len pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du len pa la brten nas /
translated: This is what is being said: based on appropriation,

original: gzugs brnyan du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma phra mo zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mtshan ma phra mo zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: whatever is reflected is called a subtle sign.

original: 'og ma rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o /
analyzed: 'og ma rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o /
translated: The others should be understood in the same way.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni lnga pa bden pa bzhi'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni lnga pa bden pa bzhi'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of suffering, origin, cessation, and path are the fifth, the teaching of the characteristics of the four noble truths.

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam so so nas mtshan nyid ci dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam so so nas mtshan nyid ci dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of each of the four noble truths, suffering, origin, cessation, and path?

original: btsun pa rtsibs na re rab tu nyam nga ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: btsun pa rtsibs na re rab tu nyam nga ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says: The characteristic of suffering is that which is extremely miserable.

original: skye zhing 'phel bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skye zhing 'phel bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of origin is that which causes birth and increase.

original: rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of cessation is that which is peace.

original: nges par 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni lam gyi mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa gang yin pa de ni lam gyi mtshan nyid do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The characteristic of the path is that which definitely delivers.

original: rgya cher de nyid las rnam grangs rnam pa bzhis bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las rnam grangs rnam pa bzhis bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in accordance with the four modes of teaching in the great treatise, the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma 'am 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni drug pa 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma 'am 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni drug pa 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The signs of the conditioned and the signs of the unconditioned are the sixth presentation of signs.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The signs of the conditioned are those that possess the four characteristics of arising, etc.

original: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ste /🔽rgya cher ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ste / rgya cher ni bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The signs of the unconditioned are those that are the opposite of that.

original: rtag pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: They should be understood in detail as they are presented in the Abhidharma treatise, the Compendium of Abhidharma and the Great Treasury of Detailed Explanation.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bdun pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma @222a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bdun pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan ma @222a * //
translated: The signs of the permanent and the signs of the impermanent are the seventh presentation of signs.

original: bstan pa'o // sngar bstan pa'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / ngo bo nyid bye brag med kyang don tha dad pa'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa'o // sngar bstan pa'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dang / ngo bo nyid bye brag med kyang don tha dad pa'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conditioned and unconditioned that were previously presented are not different in nature, but are presented as different in meaning.

original: sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi mtshan ma'am /
translated: The sign of the transformation of suffering,🔽or the sign of the non-transformation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the eighth sign, the sign of the transformation of suffering, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i tshor ba gnyis ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i tshor ba gnyis ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: the two feelings of pleasure and pain are called the sign of the transformation of suffering.

original: btang snyoms kyi tshor ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi tshor ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The feeling of indifference is called the sign of the non-transformation of suffering.

original: gzhan yang brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the imagined nature and the other-dependent nature are called the sign of the transformation of suffering.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam par 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyi mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfected nature is the sign of the non-transformation of suffering.

original: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni bden pa bzhi po dag ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum du gtogs par rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ni bden pa bzhi po dag ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum du gtogs par rgya cher ston to //
translated: In the Madhyantavibhāga and the Vijñaptimātratāsiddhi, the four truths are extensively taught to belong to the three natures.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi las can zhes 'byung ba de ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pas so //🔽'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi las can zhes 'byung ba de ni lo ts'a ba dag gi bsam pa tha dad pas so // 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: In the Gāthārthasaṃ-graha-sūtra, the words “the function of the non-transformation of suffering and origination” are different from the thoughts of the translators.🔽The sign of the different characteristics of the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid 'dra ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dgu pa 'dus byas gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid 'dra ba'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni dgu pa 'dus byas gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: or the sign of the similar characteristics of the unconditioned, is the teaching of the ninth sign of the sameness and difference of the conditioned.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo las /
translated: The noble Perfection of Wisdom Sūtras say,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “The individual characteristic is this:

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The individual characteristic of all phenomena is this:

original: ci ltar rnam par 'gyur zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ci ltar rnam par 'gyur zhing thogs pa dang bcas pa ni gzugs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The individual characteristic of form is that it is a transformation and has resistance.

original: myong ba ni tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: myong ba ni tshor ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The individual characteristic of feeling is experience.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The individual characteristic of discrimination is apprehending a sign.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'du byed kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni 'du byed kyi rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The individual characteristic of formation is formation.🔽The individual characteristic of consciousness is cognition.”

original: rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa rnams so //
translated: There are limitless individual characteristics such as these.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /🔽chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste / chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The general characteristic is this:🔽The general characteristic of all phenomena is this:

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal ba ni zag pa @222b dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal ba ni zag pa @222b dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Suffering is the general characteristic of all contaminated phenomena.

original: mi rtag pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Impermanence is the general characteristic of all contaminated things.🔽Emptiness and selflessness are the general characteristics of all phenomena.

original: stong pa dang bdag med pa ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa rnams so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid dpag tu med pa rnams so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, there are innumerable general characteristics.

original: thams cad la thams cad yin pa nyid du rig nas thams cad yod pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bcu pa thams cad shes pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //🔽thams cad la thams cad yin pa nyid du rig nas zhes bya ba ni de yan chad du mtshan ma rnams rnam par phye ste bshad nas 'dir ni mtshan ma rnams spyir ston pas yongs su shes par byed pa'i shes pa smos nas yongs su shes par bya
analyzed: thams cad la thams cad yin pa nyid du rig nas thams cad yod pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bcu pa thams cad shes pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o // thams cad la thams cad yin pa nyid du rig nas zhes bya ba ni de yan chad du mtshan ma rnams rnam par phye ste bshad nas 'dir ni mtshan ma rnams spyir ston pas yongs su shes par byed pa'i shes pa smos nas yongs su shes par bya
translated: Having understood that all are in all, the sign of the existence of all is taught.

original: ba'i mtshan ma rab tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ba'i mtshan ma rab tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: Having understood that all are in all, having explained the signs in terms of the distinctions of all, here, in terms of the general, the knowledge that fully understands is mentioned, and the sign of full understanding is taught.

original: 'dis ni chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the intrinsic characteristics of phenomena.

original: thams cad yod pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya bas ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan te /
analyzed: thams cad yod pa'i mtshan ma zhes bya bas ni bye brag gi mtshan nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the sign of the existence of everything” indicates the specific characteristics of the signs.

original: re re la yang bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa la sogs pa'i thams cad ces bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re la yang bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa la sogs pa'i thams cad ces bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Each of the signs is called “everything” because it is the sign of both the existent and the nonexistent.

original: yang na snga ma ni ji snyed yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na snga ma ni ji snyed yod pa nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, the former phrase refers to the existence of everything in its variety.

original: phyi ma ni thams cad ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid do //🔽gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'am /
analyzed: phyi ma ni thams cad ces bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid do // gang zag bdag med pa'i mtshan ma'am /
translated: The latter phrase refers to the existence of everything in its real nature.

original: chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa dag ste zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa bdag med pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o //🔽de la bud ka la ni bsgyur na yang sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa'i mtshan ma gang yin pa dag ste zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa bdag med pa'i mtshan ma bstan pa'o // de la bud ka la ni bsgyur na yang sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase “the sign of the emptiness of essential nature” and “the sign of the insubstantiality of the person” indicates the eleventh and twelfth signs.

original: yang nas yang du 'gro ba rnams len pas so //
analyzed: yang nas yang du 'gro ba rnams len pas so //
translated: The former is the sign of the emptiness of essential nature, and the latter is the sign of the insubstantiality of the person.🔽The term “sign” should be understood as it is explained in the Yogācārabhūmi.

original: bdag med pa 'di gnyis kyang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa 'di gnyis kyang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The term “sign” should be understood as it is explained in the Yogācārabhūmi.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las gang zag bdag med pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams las don tha dad pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos bdag med pa ni rten cing 'bral bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag bdag med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las gang zag bdag med pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams las don tha dad pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro // chos bdag med pa ni rten cing 'bral bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag bdag med de /
translated: Therefore, in that treatise, the selflessness of persons is taught to be the selflessness of a self that is a different object from the dependently arisen formations.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽kun du 'byung ba de dag las sems btang snyoms su 'jog go zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rnam par sel ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no // kun du 'byung ba de dag las sems btang snyoms su 'jog go zhes bya ba ni gsum pa rnam par sel ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is taught to be the selflessness of those dependently arisen formations, because they are impermanent.🔽The statement “he places his mind in equanimity with regard to those that have arisen” teaches the third, the thorough knowledge of elimination.

original: gong du bstan pa'i kun du 'byung ba'i mtshan ma rnams de bzhin nyid du bsgom pa'i sems kyis yang dag par sel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i kun du 'byung ba'i mtshan ma rnams de bzhin nyid du bsgom pa'i sems kyis yang dag par sel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mind that meditates on the reality of those signs that have arisen eliminates them.

original: mtshan ma de dag ni gzhan gyi dbang yin na /🔽ci'i phyir de dag la rnam @223a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma de dag ni gzhan gyi dbang yin na / ci'i phyir de dag la rnam @223a * //
translated: If those signs are dependent,

original: par sel bar bya ba zhes bstan ce na /
analyzed: par sel bar bya ba zhes bstan ce na /
translated: why are they taught to be that which is eliminated?🔽The answer is that they are eliminated by the mind that meditates on reality.

original: smras pa / gong du bstan pa bzhin du mngon du mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya'i /
analyzed: smras pa / gong du bstan pa bzhin du mngon du mi snang ba'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya'i /
translated: He replied: Because it does not appear as previously taught, it is called “elimination”.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rigs pa yang yongs su bsal ba las rnam par sel ba zhes bya bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rigs pa yang yongs su bsal ba las rnam par sel ba zhes bya bas ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not called “elimination” because the reasoning of dependent origination in the relative is completely eliminated.

original: gzhan yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang spangs pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang spangs pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it is called “elimination” because the relative is abandoned due to affliction.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, in the treatise Stages of Yogācāra,

original: spong bar nus shing dbral bar nus pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: spong bar nus shing dbral bar nus pa'i phyir rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o zhes bshad do //
translated: it is explained: “Because it can be abandoned and separated, it is called ‘elimination’.”

original: des de ltar spyod pa de dag la mang du gnas pa'i phyir dus dus su gags dang / sgrib pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad las legs par sems rnam par sbyong par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sems legs par sbyong ba ston to //
analyzed: des de ltar spyod pa de dag la mang du gnas pa'i phyir dus dus su gags dang / sgrib pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad las legs par sems rnam par sbyong par byed do zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sems legs par sbyong ba ston to //
translated: Thus, because they frequently abide in those practices, from time to time they thoroughly purify the mind from all hindrances, obscurations, and distractions. This is the second, teaching the thorough purification of the mind.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid la so sor rtog pa'i phyir gong du bstan pa'i gags rnam pa lnga dang / sgrib pa lnga dang / rnam par g-yeng ba lnga po dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pas so //🔽de phan chad de bzhin nyid bdun po dag la so sor nang gi rang gis rig pa bdun yod pas rtogs pas shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mthong ba'i lam
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid la so sor rtog pa'i phyir gong du bstan pa'i gags rnam pa lnga dang / sgrib pa lnga dang / rnam par g-yeng ba lnga po dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed pas so // de phan chad de bzhin nyid bdun po dag la so sor nang gi rang gis rig pa bdun yod pas rtogs pas shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa mthong ba'i lam
translated: Thus, because of the discernment of reality, the mind is purified from the five obstructions and five obscurations and five distractions taught above.🔽From that point on, the arising of the knowledge that is the realization of the seven realities by means of the seven internal self-awarenesses is called the path of seeing.

original: gyi gnas skabs ston to //
analyzed: gyi gnas skabs ston to //
translated: From here on is the second, the explanation of the state of the path of seeing.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: mthong ba'i lam nyid yang dag par bstan pa dang / de thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam nyid yang dag par bstan pa dang / de thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis mthong ba'i lam gyi phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the path of seeing itself and the explanation of the benefits of the path of seeing from “in order to attain that” on.

original: 'di ni dang po mthong ba'i lam nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po mthong ba'i lam nyid yang dag par bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first, the explanation of the path of seeing itself.

original: thog ma kho nar don mthong ba yin pa'i phyir lam mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar don mthong ba yin pa'i phyir lam mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the path of seeing because it is the first to see the meaning.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis byas pa'i bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, Master Bhāviveka’s commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna says,

original: sngon ma mthong ba'i chos kyi dbyings khyad par du 'phags pa mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba'i chos kyi dbyings khyad par du 'phags pa mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Because it sees the exalted dhātu of phenomena that was not seen before, it is called the path of seeing.”

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las /
translated: Also, the treatise Establishing the Unreality of the External World says,

original: sbyor ba bar chad med pa'i shes pa 'di skyes pa'i tshe de bzhin nyid khong du chud par 'gyur bas rab tu rtog pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bar chad med pa'i shes pa 'di skyes pa'i tshe de bzhin nyid khong du chud par 'gyur bas rab tu rtog pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya'o //
translated: “When this uninterrupted cognition of application arises, it is called the stage of thorough investigation because it comprehends suchness.

original: dang po kho nar don mthong ba yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dang po kho nar don mthong ba yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it is the first to see the meaning, it is called the path of seeing.”

original: mthong ba'i lam de yang @223b rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de yang @223b rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This path of seeing is twofold:

original: dang po de kho na nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po de kho na nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam ni 'di lta ste /
translated: First, the path of seeing that is reality is as follows.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog par chad med pa skyes pas cig car gang zag dang / chos stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid mngon du gyur nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad cig car spong ba gang yin pa de ni de kho na nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog par chad med pa skyes pas cig car gang zag dang / chos stong pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid mngon du gyur nas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad cig car spong ba gang yin pa de ni de kho na nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: The supreme mundane quality is the uninterrupted path. At that time, the suchness of the emptiness of persons and phenomena is directly perceived and all afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are simultaneously abandoned. This is called the path of seeing that is the suchness of reality.

original: 'dir so sor nang gi rang gis rig pa'i de bzhin nyid bdun gsungs pa ni brjod par bya ba las brtsams nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir so sor nang gi rang gis rig pa'i de bzhin nyid bdun gsungs pa ni brjod par bya ba las brtsams nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the seven types of suchness that are individually realized and personally experienced are taught from the perspective of the topics to be expressed.

original: 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi don mngon sum du gyur pa'i mtha' la ltos na /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid kyi don mngon sum du gyur pa'i mtha' la ltos na /
translated: From the perspective of the culmination of directly perceiving the suchness of the phenomena of samsara,

original: so so nas de bzhin nyid gcig skye ba nas /
analyzed: so so nas de bzhin nyid gcig skye ba nas /
translated: the suchness of the individual is born.

original: de bzhin du so so nas bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid kyi don mngon du 'gyur ba'i mtha' la ltos na /
analyzed: de bzhin du so so nas bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid kyi don mngon du 'gyur ba'i mtha' la ltos na /
translated: Similarly, from the perspective of the culmination of directly perceiving the suchness of the four truths,

original: so so nas bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid skye ba'i bar du 'gyur ba la bya'i /
analyzed: so so nas bden pa bzhi'i de kho na nyid skye ba'i bar du 'gyur ba la bya'i /
translated: the suchness of the individual four truths is born.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i mthong ba'i lam 'di'i gnas skabs snga phyi dus bdun po dag so so nas nang gi rang gis rig pa la bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i mthong ba'i lam 'di'i gnas skabs snga phyi dus bdun po dag so so nas nang gi rang gis rig pa la bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The seven times, earlier and later, of this path of seeing without signs are not individually the activity of inner self-awareness.

original: gnyis pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i mthong ba'i lam ni sems rnam pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i mthong ba'i lam ni sems rnam pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: The second, the path of seeing with signs, is the three kinds of mind, as follows:🔽The cognition that focuses on the mere designation of sentient beings, the cognition that focuses on the mere designation of phenomena, and the cognition that focuses on the complete elimination of the mere designations of sentient beings and phenomena.

original: sems can du btags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / chos su btags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / sems can dang chos btags pa tsam yongs su sel ba la dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / sems bcu drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can du btags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / chos su btags pa tsam la dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / sems can dang chos btags pa tsam yongs su sel ba la dmigs pa'i shes pa dang / sems bcu drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: The sixteen minds are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The forbearance of the knowledge of phenomena with regard to suffering and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam gnyis po de yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gnyis po de yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa dang / mtshan nyid bstan pa dag las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: These two paths of seeing should be understood in accordance with the treatises that prove cognition only, the Levels of Yogic Deeds, and the Teaching of Characteristics.

original: de la thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because of that attainment, he is said to have entered into the bodhisattva's faultless reality, and to have been born into the family of the Tathagatas.

original: sa dang po thob pa yin no //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa yin no //
translated: He has attained the first stage.

original: gzhan yang sa de ni phan yon yang yongs su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa mthong ba'i lam gyi phan yon ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang sa de ni phan yon yang yongs su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyis pa mthong ba'i lam gyi phan yon ston to //
translated: Moreover, this stage is also the experience of benefits, etc. This shows the benefits of the path of insight, which is the second stage.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: phan yon rnam pa bzhi bstan pa dang / des zhes bya ba man chad kyis dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'i phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa bzhi bstan pa dang / des zhes bya ba man chad kyis dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'i phan yon bstan te /
translated: The teaching of the four kinds of benefits, and the benefits of the object of observation of the ultimate reality, which is indicated by the words beginning with “because of that.”

original: 'di ni dang po'o //🔽phan yon de yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du @224a * //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o // phan yon de yang bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du @224a * //
translated: This is the first part.🔽The benefits are explained in the treatise Demonstration of Consciousness Only as follows:

original: grub pa las bstan pa dang sbyar na mthong ba'i lam gyi phan yon ni rnam pa brgyad do zhes bshad de /
analyzed: grub pa las bstan pa dang sbyar na mthong ba'i lam gyi phan yon ni rnam pa brgyad do zhes bshad de /
translated: “The benefits of the path of insight are said to be eightfold.”

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam thob par 'gyur ba'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshe rigs su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam thob par 'gyur ba'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshe rigs su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, that treatise teaches that when a bodhisattva obtains the path of seeing, he is born in the family of the Tathagata.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: He abides in the ground of Supreme Joy.

original: chos kyi dbyings legs par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings legs par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: He realizes the expanse of reality.

original: chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid thob par 'gyur /
translated: He obtains the sameness of all phenomena.

original: rtag par sangs rgyas kyi 'khor 'dus pa chen po rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag par sangs rgyas kyi 'khor 'dus pa chen po rnams su skye bar 'gyur /
translated: He is always born in the great assemblies of the retinue of the Buddha.

original: chos kyi sgo brgya pa mang po la dbang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo brgya pa mang po la dbang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He obtains mastery over many hundreds of doors of Dharma.

original: bdag nyid ring po mi thogs par byang chub chen bo thob par shes so //
analyzed: bdag nyid ring po mi thogs par byang chub chen bo thob par shes so //
translated: He knows that he will soon obtain great enlightenment.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' ji srid par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang sbyar na ni /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' ji srid par thams cad la phan 'dogs par byed do zhes bstan pa yin no // bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang sbyar na ni /
translated: He benefits all beings for as long as the world exists.

original: phan yon rnam pa drug yod par ston te /
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa drug yod par ston te /
translated: If the Ornament of Clear Realization is applied to the treatise Compendium of the Mahayana, it teaches that there are six kinds of benefit.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore, that treatise teaches:

original: sa rab tu dga' ba la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba la zhugs pa yin /
translated: One enters the ground of Supreme Joy.

original: chos kyi dbyings legs par rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings legs par rtogs pa yin /
translated: One realizes the ultimate expanse.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin /
translated: One is born into the family of the tathagatas.

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin /
translated: One attains the state of mind that is the same toward all sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin /
translated: One attains the state of mind that is the same toward all bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: One attains the state of mind that is the same toward all buddhas.

original: phan yon rnam pa drug po 'di rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa drug po 'di rgya cher rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: The extensive classification of these six benefits

original: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med dang dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slob dpon ngo bo nyid med dang dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: is presented in the commentaries composed by the masters Asvabhava and Vasubandhu.

original: phan yon rnam pa brgyad dang / rnam pa bcu ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa brgyad dang / rnam pa bcu ni theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The eight and ten benefits are presented in the commentary on the Compendium of the Great Vehicle, translated by the Indian abbot Tilaka and the translator Patsap Nyima Drak.

original: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las ni phan yon rnam pa bzhi ston te /
analyzed: 'dir mdo 'di nyid las ni phan yon rnam pa bzhi ston te /
translated: In this sutra, four benefits are taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa dang / sa dang po thob pa dang / sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa dang / sa dang po thob pa dang / sa de'i phan yon yang nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: He has entered into the faultless state of the Bodhisattva, he has been born into the family of the Tathagatas, he has attained the first stage, and he experiences the benefits of that stage.

original: de la yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the expression “faultless state,”

original: yang dag pa nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: the “faultless state” is the noble path.

original: skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du brtags pa'i nyon mongs pas 'gro ba drug dang / skye ba rnam pa bzhi po rnams su skye bar byed pa dag ni dper na zas ma tshos pas nad rnams @224b slong ba dang 'dra bar dpe las ming du btags pa'i phyir skyon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba kun du brtags pa'i nyon mongs pas 'gro ba drug dang / skye ba rnam pa bzhi po rnams su skye bar byed pa dag ni dper na zas ma tshos pas nad rnams @224b slong ba dang 'dra bar dpe las ming du btags pa'i phyir skyon zhes bya'o //
translated: The “faults” are the six destinies and the four kinds of birth, which are produced by the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing and which are called “faults” because they are like indigestion that produces illness.

original: mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i tshe gang du bstan pa lta bu'i kun du brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa dag dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skyes pa'i tshe gang du bstan pa lta bu'i kun du brtags pa'i nyon mongs pa dag dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of the path of seeing, one is free from the afflictions of the class of views, as explained above, and thus it is called faultless.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang sbyar na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / bzod pa la yang ming rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos dang sbyar na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / bzod pa la yang ming rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: In the Abhidharmakośa, the knowledge of the dharma of suffering and the receptivity to the knowledge of the dharma of suffering have two names.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las 'di nyid ni yang dag pa nyid skyon med par zhugs pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las 'di nyid ni yang dag pa nyid skyon med par zhugs pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Therefore the same text says, “It is also called entry into the faultless state of reality.

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ste /🔽de'i dbang gis thog ma kho nar yang dag pa nyid skyon med par zhugs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa zhes bya ste / de'i dbang gis thog ma kho nar yang dag pa nyid skyon med par zhugs pa yang yin la /
translated: It is called entry into reality.🔽Because of that, one first enters the faultless state of reality,

original: thog ma kho nar yang dag pa nyid du nges par zhugs pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽mdo dag las yang dag pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar yang dag pa nyid du nges par zhugs pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro // mdo dag las yang dag pa nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and one first enters the state of certainty in reality.

original: mya ngan la sa 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan la sa 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the sūtras, reality is said to be nirvāṇa.

original: yang na yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Or else, the meaning of “reality” is that it arises from the cause of the noble path.

original: skyon ni nyon mongs pa'am yang na dbang po yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: skyon ni nyon mongs pa'am yang na dbang po yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: “ Fault” means the afflictions or the unripened faculties.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyis yongs su bzla bar nus pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o //🔽nges pa kho nar mya ngan las 'das pa len pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyis yongs su bzla bar nus pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o // nges pa kho nar mya ngan las 'das pa len pa'am /
translated: It is called “faultless” because it is able to be transformed by the noble path.🔽It is called “the path of seeing” because it definitely takes nirvana,

original: bden pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yang nges pa'i ming thob pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i mtshan nyid nges pa nyid du byed pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yang nges pa'i ming thob pa yin no //
translated: or because it definitely makes the characteristics of the truths its object.

original: gnas skabs 'dir phyin pa la ni zhugs pa zhes bstan to zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir phyin pa la ni zhugs pa zhes bstan to zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: It is taught that one who has reached this stage is called “entered.

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las yang dag pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las yang dag pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: ” The treatise Abhidharmakośa states, “Reality is twofold: nirvana and the noble path.

original: skyon yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas dang po ni nyon mongs pa'i skyon te /
analyzed: skyon yang don rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pas dang po ni nyon mongs pa'i skyon te /
translated: “ Fault” has two meanings. The first is the fault of the afflictions,

original: dper na zas ma tshos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zas ma tshos pa lta bu'o //
translated: like indigestion.

original: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yongs su ma smin pas ni skyon zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
