analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yongs su ma smin pas ni skyon zhes bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The second is called a fault because the arya path is not fully matured.

original: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa dang gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: bstan bcos yang dag pa'i rigs pa dang / rjes su mthun pa dang gzhung rab tu bstan pa las kyang mdzod kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba dang mthun par bstan to //
translated: The treatise called Correct Reason and Conformable Explanation also explains that the Abhidharmakośa is consistent with the Abhidharmasamuccaya.🔽The great treatise Vibhāṣā also explains that the Teacher taught the two types of objects in the first chapter, stating:

original: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang don rnam pa gnyis kyis ston pas dang po mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni zas ma tshos pa lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las kyang don rnam pa gnyis kyis ston pas dang po mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ni zas ma tshos pa lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are like uncooked food.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las /
translated: Therefore the same treatise states:

original: gzhan yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas ni sems can rnams ngan 'gro rnams su @225a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas ni sems can rnams ngan 'gro rnams su @225a * //
translated: Moreover, sentient beings who are afflicted by the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing

original: ltung zhing sdug bsngal drag po myong bar byed de /
analyzed: ltung zhing sdug bsngal drag po myong bar byed de /
translated: fall to the lower realms and experience intense suffering.

original: dper na zas ma tshos pa yun ring por khong du lus na sdug bsngal gyi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs skyed pa dang 'dra bas /
analyzed: dper na zas ma tshos pa yun ring por khong du lus na sdug bsngal gyi dngos po rnam pa sna tshogs skyed pa dang 'dra bas /
translated: For example, if undigested food remains in the stomach for a long time, it generates various kinds of suffering.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'di la skyon zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'di la skyon zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore this affliction is called a fault.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'gog par byed pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o //🔽gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yod pa dag shin tu gdul bar dka' zhing /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'gog par byed pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o // gzhan yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yod pa dag shin tu gdul bar dka' zhing /
translated: It is called faultless because the path of seeing stops it.

original: gcan gzan ltar bka' blo mi bde ba'i phyir skyon zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gcan gzan ltar bka' blo mi bde ba'i phyir skyon zhes bshad de /
translated: Moreover, the existence of afflicted view of the self and so on is very difficult to tame and is like a wild animal that is hard to train.🔽Therefore it is called a fault.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'gog par byed pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'gog par byed pa'i phyir skyon med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is called faultless because the path of seeing stops it.

original: yang na dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pas skyon zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pas skyon zhes bya ste /
translated: Or it is called a fault because the roots of virtue are not fully ripened.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: Therefore the Great Exegesis says:

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa thams cad dang 'dod chags dang / sred pa rnams kyis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par mi 'gyur zhing sred pa rnams brlan nas nyes pa 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir skyon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa thams cad dang 'dod chags dang / sred pa rnams kyis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par mi 'gyur zhing sred pa rnams brlan nas nyes pa 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir skyon zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, all afflictions, attachment and craving are called faults because they do not ripen the roots of virtue and they cause faults to arise by moistening craving.

original: mthong ba'i lam skyes nas de'i stobs nyams smad cing yang nyes pa 'byung ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas de nas mthong ba'i lam gcig pu la skyon med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam skyes nas de'i stobs nyams smad cing yang nyes pa 'byung ba'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas de nas mthong ba'i lam gcig pu la skyon med pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: After the path of seeing arises, its power declines and one is no longer subject to the arising of faults. Therefore, from then on, the path of seeing alone is called faultless.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is extensively taught in that text.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa zhes bya ba ni slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis 'grel pa las /
translated: Regarding being born into the family of the tathāgatas, Ācārya Svābhāvika’s commentary says:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ste /
translated: The dharmadhātu of the buddhas is called the family of the tathāgatas.

original: der mngon sum du 'gyur zhing khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: der mngon sum du 'gyur zhing khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i phyir skyes pa zhes bshad do //
translated: It is called “born” because it becomes manifest and is realized.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: The commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu states:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi gdung rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams kyi gdung rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: “Born into the family of the tathāgatas” means that, by its power, the lineage of the buddhas does not come to an end.🔽The Explanation of the Ten Stages states:

original: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa las sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa bcu'i bshad pa las sangs rgyas rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the family of the buddhas is called the family of the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam du 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam du 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those bodhisattvas continuously enter the path of the tathāgatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs zhes bya'o zhes bshad de /
translated: it is called the family of the tathāgatas.

original: rgya cher de nyid las rnam grangs mang pos bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las rnam grangs mang pos bstan pa las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in accordance with the many enumerations that appear in that very text.

original: @225b de las dang po thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: @225b de las dang po thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The first of these is taught below.

original: gzhan yang sa de'i phan yon yang yongs su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las phan yon gzhan drug bstan pa dag bsdus par ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang sa de'i phan yon yang yongs su myong ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las phan yon gzhan drug bstan pa dag bsdus par ston to //
translated: Moreover, he experiences the benefits of that stage. This shows that the benefits of the other six topics taught in the treatise Establishing the Cognition Only are included in this.

original: des sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyang thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des sngar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyang thob par 'gyur te /
translated: He also obtains the two kinds of objects because he has previously obtained calming and discerning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of a conceptual image and the object of a non-conceptual image.

original: des da ltar mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir yang dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis pa dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'i phan yon ston to //
analyzed: des da ltar mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir yang dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis pa dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'i phan yon ston to //
translated: He also obtains the object of the limit of existence because he has now obtained the path of insight. This shows the benefit of the second, the object of the limit of existence.

original: 'di ltar sngar sa'i mdun rol du dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar sa'i mdun rol du dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because one previously obtained the two aspects of observation prior to the stage of the path of insight,

original: mthong ba'i lam 'dir yang gsum pa dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'i bye brag gi mtshan ma thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'dir yang gsum pa dngos po'i mtha'i dmigs pa'i bye brag gi mtshan ma thob par 'gyur te /
translated: on this path of insight one also obtains the third aspect of observation, the sign of the culmination of things.

original: sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar gong du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as previously explained.

original: yang gong ma gong ma'i sa thams cad du bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs pas dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed de zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs ston to //
analyzed: yang gong ma gong ma'i sa thams cad du bsgom pa'i lam la zhugs pas dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag nyid yid la byed de zhes bya ba ni gsum pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs ston to //
translated: Again, one who has entered the path of cultivation in all the higher stages should attend to those three aspects of observation. This shows the third stage, the path of cultivation.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This passage of the sutra is divided into two parts.

original: dang po ni bsgom pa la brtson par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dang po ni bsgom pa la brtson par bstan pa ste /
translated: The first part shows that one should strive in cultivation.

original: de la bsgom pa ni 'phel zhing gsal bar 'gyur ba'i don te /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa ni 'phel zhing gsal bar 'gyur ba'i don te /
translated: Here, cultivation means that the path increases and becomes clear.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du phyi ma'i sa dgu po rnams su bsgom pa'i shes pa khad kyis 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du phyi ma'i sa dgu po rnams su bsgom pa'i shes pa khad kyis 'phel bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, after the path of insight, the knowledge of cultivation gradually increases in the nine subsequent stages.

original: yang na gong ma gong ma zhes bya bas ni sa bcu po dag tshang bar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gong ma gong ma zhes bya bas ni sa bcu po dag tshang bar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the phrase higher and higher indicates that all ten levels are complete.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du sa bcu yod de /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du sa bcu yod de /
translated: There are ten levels above the path of seeing,

original: gcig kho na ma yin pas tshig zlos bur gong ma gong ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig kho na ma yin pas tshig zlos bur gong ma gong ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: but since it is not just one, the phrase higher and higher is used.

original: gnyis pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa rnam pa gsum dang ldan par bstan te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dmigs pa rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dmigs pa rnam pa gsum dang ldan par bstan te /
translated: The second is indicated by the phrase endowed with three kinds of objects and so on.

original: 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis nang gi dngos po'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i yul yang dag par yid la byed kyi gzugs brnyan sprul bar ni mi byed de /🔽rjes las thob pa'i ye shes ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi spyod @226a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis nang gi dngos po'i mtha'i de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i yul yang dag par yid la byed kyi gzugs brnyan sprul bar ni mi byed de / rjes las thob pa'i ye shes ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi spyod @226a * //
translated: Thus, nonconceptual gnosis correctly focuses on the reality of the ultimate inner truth, but it does not create a reflected image or emanation.

original: yul rnam pa gnyis yid la byed pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: yul rnam pa gnyis yid la byed pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Subsequently attained gnosis does not focus on the two kinds of objects of the reflected image with concepts and the reflected image without concepts.

original: gtan tshigs des nas bcu po kun la yang yul rnam pa gsum po dag tshang bar yod par mngon no /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des nas bcu po kun la yang yul rnam pa gsum po dag tshang bar yod par mngon no /
translated: The reason is that all ten grounds are seen to be complete in the three aspects of the object.🔽

original: // / bam po lnga bcu pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga bcu pa /
translated: By this reason, it is evident that all ten stages have the three aspects of the object complete.🔽For example, someone says that a very small puppy gives birth to a very large puppy.

original: dper na la la zhig khyi gu ches phra mos khyi gu ches sbom po 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dper na la la zhig khyi gu ches phra mos khyi gu ches sbom po 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa dpes bstan pa'o //
translated: The second is taught by an example.

original: dper na 'jig rten pa rnams shing gsheg pa na /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten pa rnams shing gsheg pa na /
translated: For example, when worldly people cut wood,

original: sngar ni khyi gu sbom po spyod la /
analyzed: sngar ni khyi gu sbom po spyod la /
translated: first they use a large puppy,🔽and later they use a small puppy.

original: de'i 'og tu ni khyi gu phra mo spyod ba dag 'di ltar khyi gu phra mos khyi gu sbom po 'byin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni khyi gu phra mo spyod ba dag 'di ltar khyi gu phra mos khyi gu sbom po 'byin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In this way, it is as if a small puppy gives birth to a large puppy. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba lta bu'i thabs 'di la brten nas nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba lta bu'i thabs 'di la brten nas nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva, based on this method of a puppy giving birth to a puppy, in order to eliminate internal signs,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan ma thams cad rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: eliminates all signs that are in accord with the aspect of affliction.

original: mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba'i phyir gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ston to //
analyzed: mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba'i phyir gnas ngan len rnams kyang rnam par sel bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa dpe dang don du sbyar ba ston to //
translated: This is the third example, which is applied to the meaning.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: sa dang por 'ching ba gnyis las grol bar bstan pa dang / sa gzhan rnams su sems rnam par sbyong ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang por 'ching ba gnyis las grol bar bstan pa dang / sa gzhan rnams su sems rnam par sbyong ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on liberation from the two bonds on the first stage, and the teaching on the purification of mind on the other stages.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: 'di ltar sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' yang khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba lta bu'i thabs 'phags pa'i lam de la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' yang khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba lta bu'i thabs 'phags pa'i lam de la brten nas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva on the first stage, by relying on that noble path, like a puppy emerging from its den,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi nang gi mtshan ma rnam par sel bar byed do //
translated: eliminates the internal signs of concentration.

original: mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba thams cad rnam par sel to //
analyzed: mtshan ma yongs su bsal ba'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba thams cad rnam par sel to //
translated: In order to eliminate the signs, he also eliminates all the bonds of signs.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba yongs su bsal ba'i phyir gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang de'i zla la spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba yongs su bsal ba'i phyir gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang de'i zla la spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because the bonds of signs are completely eliminated, the bonds of negative propensities are also eliminated.🔽Therefore, the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds states:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la spyod pa ni mtshan ma la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las rnam par ma bzhag pa'i bden pa la spyod pa ni mtshan ma la spyod pa yin te /
translated: Those who engage in the truth that is not posited in the Yogācāra Levels engage in signs.

original: mtshan ma la mi spyod pa'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol la /
analyzed: mtshan ma la mi spyod pa'i phyir mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol la /
translated: Because they do not engage in signs, they are completely liberated from the bonds of signs.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol ba'i phyir gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol ba'i phyir gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba las kyang yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
translated: Because they are completely liberated from the bonds of signs, they are also completely liberated from the bonds of negative propensities.

original: 'ching ba gnyis kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba gnyis kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of the two types of bonds should be understood as explained above.

original: sa dang po yan chad kyi 'ching ba gnyis las yongs su grol ba ji ltar @226b shes she na /
analyzed: sa dang po yan chad kyi 'ching ba gnyis las yongs su grol ba ji ltar @226b shes she na /
translated: How is it known that they are completely liberated from the two bonds on the first ground and above?

original: smras pa / bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la gnas pa des mtshan ma'i 'ching ba yongs su ma bsal bas /
analyzed: smras pa / bstan bcos rnam par rig pa tsam du grub pa las ji skad du sbyor ba'i gnas skabs la gnas pa des mtshan ma'i 'ching ba yongs su ma bsal bas /
translated: He says: In the treatise Establishing Knowledge-Only, it says: “The one abiding in the stage of application abandons the bondage of negative reflex actions because he has not yet eliminated the bondage of signs.”

original: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang spong bar byed do zhes bstan pa dang / gzhan yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par gyur na /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang spong bar byed do zhes bstan pa dang / gzhan yang theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las gal te rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob par gyur na /
translated: And the commentary to the Compendium of the Mahāyāna, translated by the one called “Cow,” says: “If one attains nonconceptual wisdom,

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba las yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one is completely liberated from the bondage of signs.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba mi 'byung ba nyid kyis gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang de'i rjes su nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba mi 'byung ba nyid kyis gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba yang de'i rjes su nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas /
translated: Because the bondage of signs does not arise, the bondage of negative reflex actions is also pacified.”

original: de'i phyir sa'i mdun rol bas 'ching ba gnyis mi spong bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa'i mdun rol bas 'ching ba gnyis mi spong bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the two bonds are not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba 'di yang bstan pa rnams las bshad pa mi mthun te /
analyzed: khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba 'di yang bstan pa rnams las bshad pa mi mthun te /
translated: Also, with regard to the statement “a puppy is born from a puppy,” the explanations in the treatises are not the same.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzugs brnyan ni khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzugs brnyan ni khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra says, “The reflection is like a small puppy.”🔽

original: gzugs ni khyi gu sbom po lta bu'o //🔽lus shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa de ni khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni khyi gu sbom po lta bu'o // lus shin tu sbyangs pa gang yin pa de ni khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds says that the image is like a small dog and the form is like a large dog.🔽The physical pliancy is like the small dog,

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len gang yin pa de ni khyi gu sbom po lta bu ste /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len gang yin pa de ni khyi gu sbom po lta bu ste /
translated: and the physical dysfunction is like the large dog.

original: 'di ltar khyi gu phra mos khyi gu sbom po 'byin par byed pas so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyi gu phra mos khyi gu sbom po 'byin par byed pas so zhes bshad de /
translated: The small dog is driven out by the large dog.🔽Therefore, the same text says that the meditation that eliminates afflictions is as follows:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las spang ba bsgom pa gang zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba'i tshul gyis mngon par 'byin par byed mngon par sel bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las spang ba bsgom pa gang zhe na / smras pa / 'di ltar 'di na la la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba'i tshul gyis mngon par 'byin par byed mngon par sel bar byed de /
translated: What is the meditation that eliminates afflictions?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows: Here someone, by attending to the sign of the object of meditation of meditative serenity, causes the sign of the essential nature to emerge and to be manifest, in the manner of a small dog being driven out by a large dog.

original: dper na la la zhig gis khyi gu ches phra bas khyi gu ches sbom pa 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig gis khyi gu ches phra bas khyi gu ches sbom pa 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as a very small puppy produces a very large puppy,

original: rnal 'byor ba yang shin tu sbyangs pa'i tshogs kyis lus kyi gnas ngan len gyi tshogs mngon par 'byin par byed mngon par sel bar byed /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba yang shin tu sbyangs pa'i tshogs kyis lus kyi gnas ngan len gyi tshogs mngon par 'byin par byed mngon par sel bar byed /
translated: so too, yogis and yoginis produce and eliminate the collection of physical dysfunctions through the collection of pliancy.

original: mngon par spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni spang ba bsgom pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mngon par spong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni spang ba bsgom pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: That which is the elimination of the collection of physical dysfunctions is called the cultivation of elimination.

original: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las spang ba bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las spang ba bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the Exposition of the Compendium of Abhidharma explains:🔽The cultivation of elimination is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yid la byas pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma yongs su bsal nas yang mngon du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yid la byas pa'i phyir chos rnams kyi rtsa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma yongs su bsal nas yang mngon du mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: In this way, in this life, some, due to attention to the sign of the image of the object of concentration, eliminate the sign of the essential nature of phenomena and it does not manifest.

original: gzhan ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor @227a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni bstan bcos rnal 'byor @227a * //
translated: The other is the treatise on yoga.

original: spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun no //
translated: This is similar to the explanation in the Bodhisattva Levels.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las /
translated: The commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna by the Indian master Tripiṭaka master Bodhibhadra explains:

original: khyi gu sbom po khyi gu phra mos 'byin pa ni sa bcu po dag tu shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa dag gis shes pa dman pa dag rnam par sel ba'i dper bstan pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: khyi gu sbom po khyi gu phra mos 'byin pa ni sa bcu po dag tu shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa dag gis shes pa dman pa dag rnam par sel ba'i dper bstan pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The example of a large dog expelling a small dog illustrates how the superior knowledge on the ten grounds eliminates inferior knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de nyid las dper na 'jig rten can shing gshegs par 'dod pa dag sngar ni khyi gu phra mo spyod la de'i 'og tu ni sbom po spyod pa ltar /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid las dper na 'jig rten can shing gshegs par 'dod pa dag sngar ni khyi gu phra mo spyod la de'i 'og tu ni sbom po spyod pa ltar /
translated: Therefore it says in that text: For example, worldly people who want to cut down a tree first use a small ax and later a large one.

original: rnal 'byor pas nyon mongs pa 'jig par byed pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas nyon mongs pa 'jig par byed pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, yogins who destroy the afflictions do so in stages.

original: dang por ni lam dman pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dang por ni lam dman pa spyod pa'o //
translated: First they use a lesser path,

original: bar du lam 'bring spyod do tha mar ni lam mchog spyod do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bar du lam 'bring spyod do tha mar ni lam mchog spyod do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: in the middle they use a middling path, and in the end they use the supreme path.

original: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa las /
translated: The treatise Compendium of the Mahāyāna says:

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
translated: The ārya path is like a large dog.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ni khyi gu sbom po lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon ni khyi gu sbom po lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The seed of the afflicted class is like a large dog.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa las /
translated: Therefore, Vasubandhu’s commentary says:

original: gnyen pos rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyen pos rab tu dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The analysis of antidotes is as follows:

original: chos thams cad 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba'i tshul du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa thams cad 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi khyi gus khyi gu dbyung ba'i tshul du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa la sgrib pa'i sa bon yod pa thams cad 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The wisdom that focuses on the mixture of all phenomena removes all the seeds of obscurations that exist in the foundation consciousness, like a large dog being removed by a small dog.

original: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las chos 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pas /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi 'grel pa las chos 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes ni sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pas /
translated: Vasubandhu’s commentary on this says, “The wisdom that focuses on the mixture of phenomena acts as the antidote to all obscurations.

original: dper na khyi gu phra mos khyi gu spom po 'byin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khyi gu phra mos khyi gu spom po 'byin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a small dog removes a large dog.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon yod pa gang yin pa de ni sbom po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sa bon yod pa gang yin pa de ni sbom po zhes bya'o //
translated: The seed that is infused in the root consciousness by the phenomena of the afflicted class is called large.

original: gnyen por gyur pa'i lam rnams ni de dag spong bar nus pa'i phyir phra mo'i don yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnyen por gyur pa'i lam rnams ni de dag spong bar nus pa'i phyir phra mo'i don yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: The paths that are antidotes are subtle in meaning because they are able to abandon those.

original: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba byas pa las /
analyzed: gzhan yang slob dpon ngo bo nyid med kyis theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba byas pa las /
translated: Moreover, Master Niḥsvabhāva composed a commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna,

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni shin tu gya nom pa'i phyir khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni shin tu gya nom pa'i phyir khyi gu phra mo lta bu'o //
translated: where it says, “Because the ārya path is very subtle, it is like a small puppy.

original: des spang bar bya ba'i sa bon de'i rang bzhin ni rags pa'i phyir khyi gu sbom po lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba'i sa bon de'i rang bzhin ni rags pa'i phyir khyi gu sbom po lta bu'o zhes bshad de /
translated: The seeds abandoned by that are the nature of the coarse, so they are like a large puppy.”

original: gzhan ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba dang mthun no //
analyzed: gzhan ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba dang mthun no //
translated: The other is in accord with the commentary composed by Master Vasubandhu.

original: bstan pa 'di dag la sogs pa la brten nas mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di dag la sogs pa la brten nas mdo'i tshig 'di bshad pa yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: Based on these teachings and so on, the words of the sūtra are explained, and since the individual explanations are not in accord,

original: @227b kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang mthun par shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i khyi gus shes pa dman pa'i khyi gu 'byin par bstan pa yin no
analyzed: @227b kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba lang gi tshe bsgyur ba las bstan pa dang mthun par shes pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i khyi gus shes pa dman pa'i khyi gu 'byin par bstan pa yin no
translated: Some say: This sutra passage is similar to the explanation in the commentary on the compendium of the great vehicle composed by master Sthiramati, which states that the superior knowledge of a dog that is in accord with the teachings expels the inferior knowledge of a dog.

original: zhe'o // kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di'i dgongs pa ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba la sogs pa dang mthun te /
analyzed: zhe'o // kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di'i dgongs pa ni slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel ba la sogs pa dang mthun te /
translated: Some say: The intention of this sutra passage is similar to the commentary composed by master Vasubandhu and so on,

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi khyi gus nyon mongs pa'i khyi gu 'byin pa ston to zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi khyi gus nyon mongs pa'i khyi gu 'byin pa ston to zhe'o //
translated: which states that the dog of arya knowledge expels the dog of affliction.

original: kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de rab tu bstan na slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa dang mthun te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mdo'i tshig 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de rab tu bstan na slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa'i 'grel pa la sogs pa dang mthun te /
translated: Some say: This sutra passage is taught from the perspective of the definition and is similar to the commentary composed by master Vasubandhu and so on,

original: spyir mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa yin pas kun kyang phan tshun 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: spyir mtshan nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bstan pa yin pas kun kyang phan tshun 'gal ba med de /
translated: because in general it is taught from the perspective of the definition and therefore they are not mutually contradictory.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa'i mdun rol du ni rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas lus shin tu sbyangs pas lus kyi gnas ngan len rnam par sel bar byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa'i mdun rol du ni rtsa ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas lus shin tu sbyangs pas lus kyi gnas ngan len rnam par sel bar byed la /
translated: Thus, because bodhisattvas have attained the fundamental concentration prior to the first level, they eliminate the negative tendencies of the body through physical fitness.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi nang gi gzugs brnyan phra mo ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma rags pa rnam par sel ba'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi nang gi gzugs brnyan phra mo ni phyi rol gyi mtshan ma rags pa rnam par sel ba'am /
translated: Subsequently, the subtle image in concentration eliminates the coarse external signs or the subtle image sign eliminates the coarse basic sign.

original: yang na gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma phra mos rtsa ba'i mtshan ma rags pa rnam par sel bas sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin nyid du bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyis /🔽gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yongs su sel bar byed de /
analyzed: yang na gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma phra mos rtsa ba'i mtshan ma rags pa rnam par sel bas sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin nyid du bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyis / gzugs brnyan gyi mtshan ma yongs su sel bar byed de /
translated: Thus, through the yoga of meditating on thatness, bodhisattvas on the levels eliminate the image sign.

original: de bzhin du ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams sel bar byed pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa rnams sel bar byed pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni brtags na khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the same way, one can understand that it is through wisdom that they eliminate defilements.

original: yang na dpe dang don du sbyar ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis gnas skabs kho na dang sbyar te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dpe dang don du sbyar ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis gnas skabs kho na dang sbyar te bstan pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the analogy and its meaning can be applied only to the occasion of the path of cultivation.

original: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad gtan du bcom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len thams cad gtan du bcom pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all signs and negative tendencies are destroyed forever,🔽the mind is purified on those higher and higher stages, like gold being refined.

original: rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma de dag tu gser sbyang ba lta bur sems rnam par sbyangs pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sems rnam par sbyong ba ston to //
analyzed: rim gyis sa gong ma gong ma de dag tu gser sbyang ba lta bur sems rnam par sbyangs pas zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa sems rnam par sbyong ba ston to //
translated: This is the second, the teaching on the purification of the mind.

original: 'di ltar sa dang po la 'ching ba gnyis gtan du bcom pa'i stobs kyis sa gong ma rnams su gser ma byang ba sbyang ba lta bur sems rnam par sbyong bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa dang po la 'ching ba gnyis gtan du bcom pa'i stobs kyis sa gong ma rnams su gser ma byang ba sbyang ba lta bur sems rnam par sbyong bas so //
translated: In this way, through the power of having destroyed the two bonds forever on the first stage, the mind is purified on the higher stages, like gold being refined.

original: gser sbyang ba'i dpe 'di yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: gser sbyang ba'i dpe 'di yang bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: This analogy of refining gold is taught in the Yogācārabhūmi:🔽The mind is refined like gold being refined.

original: gser sbyang ba dang 'dra bar sems sbyang bar gsungs pa de ji ltar lta @228a * //
analyzed: gser sbyang ba dang 'dra bar sems sbyang bar gsungs pa de ji ltar lta @228a * //
translated: How is that to be understood?

original: zhe na / gser rnam par dag pa la rnam pa gsum yod de skyon rnam par dag pa dang / gar bu rnam par dag pa dang / las su rung ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhe na / gser rnam par dag pa la rnam pa gsum yod de skyon rnam par dag pa dang / gar bu rnam par dag pa dang / las su rung ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Objection: But there are three kinds of pure gold: pure in the absence of faults, pure in the absence of dross, and pure in the absence of workability.

original: de la skyon rnam par dag pa ni 'byung khungs na 'dug pa'i gser gyi skyon rags pa dar 'bring dang / cha phra ba bsal bas ci tsam du gser phye dag par 'gyur ba kho na lus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la skyon rnam par dag pa ni 'byung khungs na 'dug pa'i gser gyi skyon rags pa dar 'bring dang / cha phra ba bsal bas ci tsam du gser phye dag par 'gyur ba kho na lus par gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, pure in the absence of faults is the gold that is only left when the gross faults of the gold that is in the source, the medium faults, and the subtle faults are removed.

original: de la gar bu rnam par dag pa ni de nyid bzhu nas gar bur gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gar bu rnam par dag pa ni de nyid bzhu nas gar bur gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, pure in the absence of dross is that which, when melted, becomes dross.

original: de la las su rung ba rnam par dag pa ni gar bu de khro ba la sogs pa'i skyon rnam par sbyangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la las su rung ba rnam par dag pa ni gar bu de khro ba la sogs pa'i skyon rnam par sbyangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Among them, pure in the absence of workability is that dross which is purified by the faults of heat and so on.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it is said in the same text:

original: dper na mgar ba'am /
analyzed: dper na mgar ba'am /
translated: For example, a goldsmith🔽or his apprentice

original: mgar ba'i slob ma zhig gis gang gi tshe gser ram dngul zhig dri ma dang / snyigs ma thams cad sbyang ba'i phyir dus dus su mer bsregs shing chur bkrus nas rgyan de dang de dag tu bya ba la mnyen zhing las su rung ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum du bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mgar ba'i slob ma zhig gis gang gi tshe gser ram dngul zhig dri ma dang / snyigs ma thams cad sbyang ba'i phyir dus dus su mer bsregs shing chur bkrus nas rgyan de dang de dag tu bya ba la mnyen zhing las su rung ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum du bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: A goldsmith or goldsmith’s apprentice, in order to remove all the impurities and stains from gold or silver, from time to time burns it in fire, washes it in water, and makes it pliable and workable for the purpose of making this or that ornament.

original: de la mgar ba'am mgar ba'i slob ma mkhas pa de dang mthun pa'i bzo shes pa des mgar spyad kyis rgyan gyi rnam pa ci 'dod pa der sgyur bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la mgar ba'am mgar ba'i slob ma mkhas pa de dang mthun pa'i bzo shes pa des mgar spyad kyis rgyan gyi rnam pa ci 'dod pa der sgyur bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: A skilled goldsmith or goldsmith’s apprentice who knows the appropriate craft can transform it into whatever ornament he wishes using the goldsmith’s tools.

original: rnal 'byor pas kyang gang gi tshe sems de brnab sems la sogs pa'i dri ma dang / snyigs ma la mi phyogs pa nyid kyis skyo bar byas la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas kyang gang gi tshe sems de brnab sems la sogs pa'i dri ma dang / snyigs ma la mi phyogs pa nyid kyis skyo bar byas la /
translated: In the same way, when the yogi makes the mind averse to the stains and impurities of covetousness and so on, he becomes disenchanted with them.

original: nyon mongs pa can yid mi bde ba la mi phyogs pa nyid dang / dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par dga' ba la mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyis mngon par dga' bar byas nas rnal 'byor des sems de zhi gnas kyi phyogs sam /🔽lhag mthong gi phyogs gang dang gang dag las nges par sbyong par byed pa de dang de dag la shin tu nye bar sbyar ba dang / shin tu rnal du 'bab pa dang mi g-yo ba dang / mi 'gul bar 'gyur zhing /🔽ji ltar bsams pa'i don yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir 'gro bar yang dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yid mi bde ba la mi phyogs pa nyid dang / dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par dga' ba la mngon du phyogs pa nyid kyis mngon par dga' bar byas nas rnal 'byor des sems de zhi gnas kyi phyogs sam / lhag mthong gi phyogs gang dang gang dag las nges par sbyong par byed pa de dang de dag la shin tu nye bar sbyar ba dang / shin tu rnal du 'bab pa dang mi g-yo ba dang / mi 'gul bar 'gyur zhing / ji ltar bsams pa'i don yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir 'gro bar yang dag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Having made it well-developed, he makes it well-concentrated by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-concentrated, he makes it well-purified by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-purified, he makes it well-penetrated by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-penetrated, he makes it well-released by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-released, he makes it well-purified by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-purified, he makes it well-developed by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-developed, he makes it well-concentrated by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-concentrated, he makes it well-purified by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-purified, he makes it well-penetrated by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-penetrated, he makes it well-released by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-released, he makes it well-purified by means of the four formless meditative attainments.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang 'thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang 'thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Having made it well-purified, he makes it well-developed by means of the four formless meditative attainments.🔽Having made it well-developed, he makes it well

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'bras bu'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa 'bras bu'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: This is the second stage, called the stage of result.

original: gnas skabs rnam pa lngas 'di ni lnga pa mthar phyin pa'i @228b gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs rnam pa lngas 'di ni lnga pa mthar phyin pa'i @228b gnas skabs so //
translated: This is the fifth stage, called the stage of culmination, because it is the culmination of the five stages.

original: 'di ltar sa rnams su sems sbyang ba kho na ma yin gyi mthar phyin pa'i gnas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang yongs su sbyang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa rnams su sems sbyang ba kho na ma yin gyi mthar phyin pa'i gnas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang yongs su sbyang dgos pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is not only the purification of the mind on the stages, but also the purification up to the culmination, which is the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang gnas 'di la brten nas dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi las bzhi pa dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas 'di la brten nas dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi las bzhi pa dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa yang thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, on the basis of this stage, the fourth objective support, the objective support of the accomplishment of the purpose is attained, from among the four objective supports.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su ni dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi po dag tshang bar mnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs su ni dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi po dag tshang bar mnga'o //
translated: At the stage of buddhahood, all four objective supports are complete.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gzhan du na /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gzhan du na /
translated: In another explanation,

original: sa'i mdun rol pa dag ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob bo //
analyzed: sa'i mdun rol pa dag ni dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob bo //
translated: those on the stages prior to the eighth obtain two objective supports.

original: sa bcu pa la gnas pa dag ni dngos po'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la gnas pa dag ni dngos po'i mtha' zhes bya'o //
translated: Those on the tenth stage are called the culmination of things.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs kyi ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas skabs kyi ni yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The stage of buddhahood is called complete.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma bzang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma bzang ngo //
translated: Although there are two such explanations, the former is better.

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub sems dpas nang gi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub sems dpas nang gi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa spyi'i mjug
translated: Son of noble family, in this way, bodhisattvas fully accomplish inner śamatha and vipaśyanā and thus fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba ste /
translated: This is the second general conclusion.

original: 'di ltar sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag gis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam la brten nas nan tan du bsgrub pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dag gis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi lam la brten nas nan tan du bsgrub pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, bodhisattvas who are on the stages attain unsurpassed awakening by practicing on the basis of the path of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The bodhisattva Maitreya then said to the Lord:🔽How, O Lord, does one practice so that the power and virtues of the bodhisattvas are led to be vast and extensive?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / yon tan yangs shing rgya cher rab tu 'dren par 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bcu bdun pa mthu dang yon tan yangs shing rgya che ba'i bar du 'dren pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar sgrub par bgyid na byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / yon tan yangs shing rgya cher rab tu 'dren par 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bcu bdun pa mthu dang yon tan yangs shing rgya che ba'i bar du 'dren pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This is taught in the seventeenth chapter called The Gate of Leading to Vast and Extensive Power and Virtue.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the request and the reply.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the request.

original: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas drug la mkhas par gyur na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas drug la mkhas par gyur na /
translated: Son of noble family, if bodhisattvas become skilled in six topics,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / yon tan yangs shing rgya che ba ji snyed yod pa dag rab tu 'dren par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa @229a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / yon tan yangs shing rgya che ba ji snyed yod pa dag rab tu 'dren par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas lan du yang dag par gsungs pa @229a * //
translated: From here on is the second part, the reply of the Tathagata.

original: ston to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: ston to // 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par rnam par bshad pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par rnam par bshad pa dang / rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba man chad spyi'i mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: the correct explanation according to the request and the general conclusion from Son of good family on.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: The first is also divided into three parts:

original: grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: the brief answer after mentioning the number, the listing of the names according to the number, and the explanation by dividing it according to the order.

original: 'di ni dang po grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po grangs smos nas lan mdor gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the first, the brief answer after mentioning the number.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas drug la mkhas par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams gnas drug la mkhas par gyur na /
translated: Thus, if bodhisattvas become skilled in six topics,

original: mthu dang yon tan rgya che ba rab tu 'dren par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mthu dang yon tan rgya che ba rab tu 'dren par 'gyur bas so //
translated: because he becomes a leader who has great power and good qualities.

original: sems kyi skye pa la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi bslab pa dang / sems kyi 'phel ba la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi thabs la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skye pa la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi bslab pa dang / sems kyi 'phel ba la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa dang / sems kyi thabs la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: Skill in the arising of mind, skill in the state of mind, training of mind, skill in the increase of mind, skill in the decrease of mind, and skill in the means of mind.

original: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: How is one skilled in the arising of mind? and so on. The third is explained in order by analysis.

original: 'di yang gnas drug rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid las rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang gnas drug rnam par phye ste bshad pa nyid las rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into six aspects, explained by analysis of the six topics.

original: 'di ni dang po sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the first explanation of skill in the arising of mind.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: de la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i sems so //
translated: Here, skill is the mind that causes thorough understanding.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i sems te /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par bya ba'i sems te /
translated: Birth is the mind that is thoroughly understood.

original: 'og ma rnams kyang 'di bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'og ma rnams kyang 'di bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The following should be applied in the same way.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.🔽The knowledge of the classification of the birth of the sixteen aspects of mind just as they are is called skill in the birth of mind.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi rnam pa bcu drug gi skye ba rab tu dbye ba shes pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes pa la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs🔽pa ston to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems kyi rnam pa bcu drug gi skye ba rab tu dbye ba shes pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi skye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes pa la sogs pas ni gnyis pa yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: This shows the second correct answer.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: len mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
analyzed: len mdor gsungs pa dang / rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste /
translated: the brief explanation in the sutra and the detailed explanation.

original: 'di ni dang po lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the brief explanation in the sutra.

original: de la sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug rab tu dbye ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa sems rnam pa bcu drug rnam par phye nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems kyi skye ba rnam pa bcu drug rab tu dbye ba yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa sems rnam pa bcu drug rnam par phye nas bshad pa'o //
translated: Among them, the classification of the sixteen aspects of the birth of mind and so on explain the second, the detailed explanation of the sixteen aspects of mind.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad @229b pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang / rnam par bshad @229b pa ste /
translated: a brief teaching and an extensive explanation.

original: 'di ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching.

original: snod brtan par gnas pa'i rnam par rig pa'i skye ba rnam par mi rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: snod brtan par gnas pa'i rnam par rig pa'i skye ba rnam par mi rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of the cognition that is the stable basis is not recognized, that is, the appropriating consciousness.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: From here on is the second, the extensive explanation in order.

original: 'di yang sems rnam pa bcu drug tu bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang sems rnam pa bcu drug tu bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into sixteen types by the teaching of the sixteen types of mind.

original: 'di ni sems dang po rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems dang po rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the first mind.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This statement of the sutra is also divided into two:

original: sems kyi ming bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ming bstan pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the name of mind and the teaching of its nature.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This statement of the sutra also has two explanations.

original: kha cig na re mi rig pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re mi rig pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Some say that the so-called nonrecognition is the foundation consciousness,

original: des dmigs pa'i rnam pa mi rig pas so //
analyzed: des dmigs pa'i rnam pa mi rig pas so //
translated: because the aspects it observes are not recognized.

original: rtag par rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir brtan par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir brtan par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “firmly abiding” because it is uninterrupted.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten 'dzin pa'i phyir snod ces bya'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten 'dzin pa'i phyir snod ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “receptacle” because it holds the world of sentient beings.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement “the appropriating consciousness” indicates its nature.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum dang ldan te /
translated: It is also endowed with three characteristics:

original: dbang po'i rten yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / skye ba'i rgyun yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhe'o //🔽kha cig na re mi rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i rten yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang / skye ba'i rgyun yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhe'o // kha cig na re mi rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the characteristic of holding the support of the sense organs, the characteristic of holding the seeds, and the characteristic of holding the continuity of rebirth.

original: thun mong gi 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten rang nyid kyis sprul pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par mi rig pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thun mong gi 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten rang nyid kyis sprul pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam par mi rig pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the statement “it is not known” means that it is not known to be the characteristic of the common result, the external world of the container, which is created by oneself.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems gnyis rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems gnyis rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The statement “it is the arising of the various kinds of perceptions of objects” and so on indicates the teaching of the two kinds of consciousness.

original: 'di yang ming smos pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pas ston te /
analyzed: 'di yang ming smos pa dang / ngo bo nyid bstan pas ston te /
translated: This is also taught by mentioning the name and by teaching the nature.

original: 'di ni ming smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ming smos pa'o //
translated: This is the mention of the name.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang yul gyi rjes su gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam pa yang yul gyi rjes su gcig kho na ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The aspect of the objective referent is not just one, because of the diversity of objects.

original: dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni yul la ming du btags pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba zhes bya ba ni yul la ming du btags pa ste /
translated: The arising of the representation of the objective referent is the designation of the object by name.

original: yul la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba zhes bya'o cig car gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa cig car nang dang phyi rol gyi yul 'dzin cing tshor ba rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas
analyzed: yul la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba zhes bya'o cig car gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa cig car nang dang phyi rol gyi yul 'dzin cing tshor ba rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas
translated: Because it is consciousness that has the object as its objective referent.🔽The arising of the representation of the objective referent is the designation of the object by name.

original: ni gnyis pa ngo bo nyid ston to //
analyzed: ni gnyis pa ngo bo nyid ston to //
translated: The second, the teaching of the nature, is taught by the statement: “The mind consciousness that is the discrimination of all objects such as form, etc., simultaneously apprehends internal and external objects, and is called the consciousness that experiences feeling, etc.”

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two parts:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i @230a * //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i @230a * //
translated: the contaminated and🔽the uncontaminated.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching on the uncontaminated mental consciousness

original: 'di ni dang po ste 'di ltar dus gcig tu cig car gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam🔽par shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste 'di ltar dus gcig tu cig car gzugs la sogs pa'i yul thams cad 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag dang dus gcig tu rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: This is the first. Thus, the conceptual mental consciousness that simultaneously and instantaneously apprehends all objects such as form is the conceptual mental consciousness that occurs simultaneously with the five consciousnesses.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the conceptual mental consciousness that occurs immediately after the five consciousnesses.

original: yang na dus gcig tu cig car nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gi yul 'dzin pas tshor ba myong zhing rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dus gcig tu cig car nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bcu gnyis po dag gi yul 'dzin pas tshor ba myong zhing rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the conceptual mental consciousness that experiences and cognizes objects by apprehending the objects of the twelve internal and external sense bases simultaneously and instantaneously.

original: skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug pa ston pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba /
analyzed: skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam cig car ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug pa ston pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba /
translated: He manifests the simultaneous entry into many samadhis in an instant, a moment, a second, and he sees many buddhafields and many tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zag pa med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mang po mthong ba rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa zag pa med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the second, the uncontaminated mental consciousness.

original: de la skad cig ces bya ba ni shin tu yun thung ba ste /
analyzed: de la skad cig ces bya ba ni shin tu yun thung ba ste /
translated: An instant is a very short time.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos sems sna tshogs bstan pa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Teaching the Various Minds states:

original: skyes bu shin tu stobs dang ldan pa'i se gol gtogs pa gcig la skad cig ma drug cu yod do zhes 'byung bas skad cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu shin tu stobs dang ldan pa'i se gol gtogs pa gcig la skad cig ma drug cu yod do zhes 'byung bas skad cig ces bya'o //
translated: “In the snapping of a finger by a very strong person, there are sixty instants.”

original: de la thang cig dang yud tsam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la thang cig dang yud tsam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is called an instant.🔽A moment and a second are:

original: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las skad cig brgya nyi shu la de'i skad cig gcig go //
analyzed: mdzod kyi bstan bcos las skad cig brgya nyi shu la de'i skad cig gcig go //
translated: The treatise Abhidharmakosa states: “One hundred and twenty instants is one moment of that.”

original: de'i skad cig drug cu la ni thang cig go thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam gcig go zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i skad cig drug cu la ni thang cig go thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam gcig go zhes bshad do //
translated: Sixty of those are one instant, and thirty instants are one moment.

original: de ni 'di skad du phyis zag pa med pa la dbang thob pa'i mthu'i dbang gis dus gcig tu skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas mang po mthong ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du phyis zag pa med pa la dbang thob pa'i mthu'i dbang gis dus gcig tu skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas mang po mthong ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is being taught: “Later, by the power of having attained mastery over the uncontaminated, many meditative absorptions are simultaneously entered into in a single instant, many buddhafields are seen, and many tathāgatas are seen.”

original: phyis thob pa 'di yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems la ltos na ni rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis thob pa 'di yang zag pa dang bcas pa'i sems la ltos na ni rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This later attainment is called “nonconceptual” in comparison to a contaminated mind.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes la ltos na ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi ye shes la ltos na ni rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But in comparison to the wisdom of the essence body, it is called “conceptual.”

original: skad cig ma gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa mang po @230b mthong ngo zhes bstan pa de'i don ni de ltar mi rung bas /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa mang po @230b mthong ngo zhes bstan pa de'i don ni de ltar mi rung bas /
translated: The teaching that “many tathāgatas are seen in a single instant” is not correct.

original: ji ltar skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin mang po la snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: How does one enter meditative attainment on many concentrations in a single moment?

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pas skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pas skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin rnam pa sna tshogs la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: It is said: Because the power of buddhas and bodhisattvas is inconceivable, they enter meditative attainment on various concentrations in a single moment.🔽Therefore the treatise Differentiating the Middle and Extremes declares:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa ni ji ltar bzhed cing 'dod pa bzhin du skad cig skad cig la ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa dag la snyoms par 'jug pas rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa ni ji ltar bzhed cing 'dod pa bzhin du skad cig skad cig la ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa dag la snyoms par 'jug pas rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because the Bhagavan Buddha and bodhisattvas who have attained great power enter immeasurable concentrations in each instant according to their wish and desire, they are differentiated.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa yin gyi yang dag par skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na ji ltar 'os pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin rnams la snyoms par 'jug pa yin gyi yang dag par skad cig ma gcig la ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, he would enter into the meditative concentrations in whatever way is appropriate, but he would not enter into all the meditative concentrations in a single moment.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na ni ji ltar skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na ni ji ltar skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po la 'jug ste /
translated: If it were not so, then how could he enter into many buddha-fields in a single moment?

original: sems can gang la yang lus mang po med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i lus kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang por 'jug par ston to //
analyzed: sems can gang la yang lus mang po med pa'i phyir sprul pa'i lus kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang por 'jug par ston to //
translated: He demonstrates the entry into many buddha-fields with a transformation-body, because no sentient being has many bodies.

original: mtshan ma chung du la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma chung du la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a representation with a small objective support is like this:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems gsum pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems gsum pa ston to //
translated: the representation associated with the desire realm.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan ma lnga po dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las brtsams nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i mtshan ma lnga po dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las brtsams nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The five objective supports that will be mentioned below are taught in relation to the store-consciousness.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds explains:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'dod pa'i khams su ni rgyu chung du'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas dmigs pa chung du'i dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de yang 'dod pa'i khams su ni rgyu chung du'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas dmigs pa chung du'i dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Also, the consciousness of the ground of all is small in scope in the desire realm because it is the object of a small-scope object of observation.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las /🔽chung ngu'i 'du shes ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las / chung ngu'i 'du shes ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma says:

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ste shin tu dman pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //🔽mtshan ma chen por gyur pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi ste shin tu dman pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do // mtshan ma chen por gyur pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Small discernment is that of the desire realm because it is very inferior.🔽The arising of a consciousness that observes a great sign is that of the form realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bzhi pa ston te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bzhi pa ston te /
translated: This teaches the fourth consciousness.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las @231a * //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las @231a * //
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds says:

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni rgya chen por 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas dmigs pa rgya chen po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni rgya chen por 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas dmigs pa rgya chen po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The consciousness of the store-consciousness has a vast objective support because it is the objective support of the consciousnesses that are the cause of the great increase of the world.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang rgya chen por gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang rgya chen por gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In the Abhidharmasamuccaya, it is said:

original: gzugs kyi khams mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: “The vast is, for example, the form realm, because it is the highest.”

original: mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of the representation of the object of the signless is, for example,

original: nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems lnga pa ston to //
