analyzed: nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems lnga pa ston to //
translated: the representation of the sphere of infinite space and the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched na ni rgyu mtshan med pa'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the object of observation of the limitless space and limitless consciousness bases of absorption of the formless realm because it is the infinite cognition that is the object of observation of the signless base.

original: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang tshad med pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Compendium of Abhidharma also explains:

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de mtha' med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //🔽mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa'i rnam par skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched de mtha' med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do // mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa'i rnam par skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The limitless are the bases of limitless space and limitless consciousness because they are limitless.🔽The arising of the consciousness that observes subtle signs is the cognition of the base of nothingness.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems drug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems drug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This explains the sixth consciousness.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las /
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds explains:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched na ni rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas phra ba'i dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched na ni rgyu phra ba'i dmigs pa rnam par rig pas phra ba'i dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The foundation consciousness in the base of nothing at all is the most subtle object of observation because it is the most subtle object of observation of the cognition that is its cause.

original: mtshan ma mthar thug pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma mthar thug pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a cognition that observes the final sign is as follows.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bdun pa ston te /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bdun pa ston te /
translated: The cognition of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment is the seventh mind.

original: khams gsum pa'i nang na mchog tu mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nang na mchog tu mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called final because it is the most final of the three realms.🔽The Yogācāra Levels declares:

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched na ni shin tu phra ba'i dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pas shin tu phra bas dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched na ni shin tu phra ba'i dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pas shin tu phra bas dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The foundation consciousness in the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment is the most subtle object of observation because it is the most subtle object of observation of the cognition that is its cause.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa @231b las kyang gong du bstan pa'i mtshan ma lnga po dag bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa @231b las kyang gong du bstan pa'i mtshan ma lnga po dag bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa dang mthun par bshad do //
translated: The Vyakhyayukti also explains the five signs taught above in accordance with the teaching in the Yogacarabhumi.

original: yang na mtshan ma lnga po de dag ci rigs par rnam par shes pa drug po dag dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na mtshan ma lnga po de dag ci rigs par rnam par shes pa drug po dag dang sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the five signs are to be applied to the six consciousnesses as appropriate.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems brgyad pa ston te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rig pa dang / 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems brgyad pa ston te /
translated: The arising of the non-sign-source cognition is as follows:🔽The supramundane cognition and the cognition that takes cessation as its object.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bden pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i spros pa'i mtshan ma rnams yongs su spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyi bden pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i spros pa'i mtshan ma rnams yongs su spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The so-called supramundane cognition is the cognition associated with the truth of the path that is uncontaminated. Because it completely abandons the signs of conceptual proliferation of the contaminated consciousnesses, it is called signless.

original: 'dir zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag kyang gtogs so //
analyzed: 'dir zag pa med pa rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad po dag kyang gtogs so //
translated: The eight kinds of consciousness that are pure and free from the outflows are also included here.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of the consciousness that is associated with suffering is as follows:🔽The consciousness of the hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems dgu pa ston to //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems dgu pa ston to // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the ninth kind of consciousness.

original: sems can dmyal ba ril dang / yi dags dang dud 'gro las kha cig ni gcig tu sdug bsngal myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba ril dang / yi dags dang dud 'gro las kha cig ni gcig tu sdug bsngal myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The consciousness of the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts is the consciousness that experiences only suffering.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra on Unravelling the Intent states:

original: sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni ngan 'gro'i rnam par rig pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni ngan 'gro'i rnam par rig pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “The consciousness that is associated with suffering is like the consciousness of those in the lower realms.”

original: tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshor ba 'dren ma dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of the consciousness that is associated with a mixture of pleasure and pain is as follows:🔽The consciousness of those in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems bcu pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems bcu pa bstan te /
translated: This is the tenth kind of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar mi dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha ril dang / yi dags dang dud 'gro las kha cig ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshan mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang 'dren mar 'jug pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dang 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha ril dang / yi dags dang dud 'gro las kha cig ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang mtshan mtshungs par ldan pa sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang 'dren mar 'jug pas so //
translated: Thus, all humans and gods of the desire realm, and some hungry ghosts and animals, have a life faculty that is associated with the six sense consciousnesses.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:🔽The consciousnesses that are associated with the feeling of indifference are like the consciousnesses of the desire realm.

original: tshor ba 'dren ma dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽dga' ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshor ba 'dren ma dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo // dga' ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The consciousnesses that are associated with the feeling of pleasure are like the consciousnesses of the first and second meditative stabilizations.🔽The consciousnesses that are associated with the feeling of pain are like the consciousnesses of the gods of the third meditative stabilization.🔽The consciousnesses that are associated with the feeling of mental pleasure are like the consciousnesses of the gods of the third meditative stabilization.🔽The consciousnesses that are associated with the feeling of mental pain are like the consciousnesses of the gods of the fourth meditative stabilization.🔽The consciousnesses that are associated with the feeling of indifference are like the consciousnesses of the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu gcig pa bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu gcig pa bstan to //
translated: The consciousnesses that are associated with the feeling of pleasure are like the consciousnesses of the first and second meditative stabilizations.

original: @232a * // 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pas ni tshor ba bde ba dang ldan pa theg pa che chung gi bstan pa kun las bshad de /
analyzed: @232a * // 'di ltar bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pas ni tshor ba bde ba dang ldan pa theg pa che chung gi bstan pa kun las bshad de /
translated: Thus, the first and second absorptions are said to possess the feeling of pleasure in all the teachings of the Great and Lesser Vehicles.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis bstan pa yang ngo bo nyid ni mthun la don ni tha dad de /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i gzhung gis bstan pa yang ngo bo nyid ni mthun la don ni tha dad de /
translated: The teachings of the scriptures of the Great Vehicle are similar in essence but different in meaning.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba yang yod par ston pas so //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba yang yod par ston pas so //
translated: They teach that the feeling of pleasure exists.

original: mdo 'di las ni tshor ba rnam pa lnga tha dad par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni tshor ba rnam pa lnga tha dad par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: In this sutra, the five types of feelings are distinguished.

original: re zhig dga' ba'i tshor ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig dga' ba'i tshor ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it teaches the feeling of joy.🔽The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning also says:

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang dga' ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las kyang dga' ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The consciousness that is concomitant with joy is like the consciousness of the first and second absorptions.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of the consciousness that possesses pleasure is as follows.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the third meditative concentration is cognition” indicates the twelfth mental state.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bsam gtan 'og ma gsum ni gcig tu bde ba'i tshor ba dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bsam gtan 'og ma gsum ni gcig tu bde ba'i tshor ba dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes bshad do //
translated: The Levels of Yogic Deeds says that the three lower meditative concentrations are engaged in by those who are experiencing the feeling of pleasure.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo // sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Cognition that is concomitant with pleasure is like the third meditative concentration.”

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu gsum pa ston to //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu gsum pa ston to //
translated: The phrase “the fourth meditative concentration and the peak of cyclic existence are cognition that is neither painful nor pleasurable” indicates the thirteenth mental state.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad kyis pa rnams gcig tu tshor ba btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad kyis pa rnams gcig tu tshor ba btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pas so //
translated: Thus, the fourth meditative concentration and above are all concomitant with the feeling of equanimity.

original: 'dir ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang gtogs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa yang gtogs so //
translated: Here, the defiled mental consciousness and the store consciousness are also included.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: tshor ba btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i bar gyi rnam par shes pa lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The cognition that is associated with the feeling of equanimity is like the consciousness of those in the fourth meditative concentration and the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of a cognition that is associated with afflictions is like this:🔽The cognition that is associated with afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu bzhi pa ston te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu bzhi pa ston te /
translated: This passage teaches the fourteenth consciousness.

original: ci rigs par rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa drug dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa @232b nyi shu rtsa bzhi po dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci rigs par rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa drug dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa @232b nyi shu rtsa bzhi po dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is any contaminated cognition that is concomitant with any of the six root afflictions and twenty-four secondary afflictions.

original: dge ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /🔽dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bco lnga pa bstan te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste / dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bco lnga pa bstan te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of cognition that is virtuous is as follows:

original: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu gcig dang mtshungs par ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba bcu gcig dang mtshungs par ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is any of the six types of contaminated cognition that is concomitant with the eleven virtuous factors such as faith and the eight types of uncontaminated cognition.

original: lung ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa skye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The arising of cognition that is neutral is as follows:

original: 'di gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu drug pa ston to //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya bas ni sems bcu drug pa ston to // 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.🔽The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.🔽The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.🔽The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.

original: dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa de dag dang mi ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ji ltar na sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //🔽'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /🔽'di ni brtag pa'o //🔽de la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i sems te /🔽'og ma rnams kyang 'di dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa de dag dang mi ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ji ltar na sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to // 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te / 'di ni brtag pa'o // de la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes par byed pa'i sems te / 'og ma rnams kyang 'di dang 'dra bar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.🔽The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.🔽The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.🔽The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.🔽The phrase “that is, the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted, as well as the storehouse consciousness” means that the six forms of consciousness that are both virtuous and afflicted are not associated with one another.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa bstan te /
translated: The second reply is indicated by the statement, “One comprehends the reality of representation just as it is and in an authentic manner.”

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa'i sems rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa'i sems rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid rab tu shes par gyur nas /
translated: Thus, having comprehended the reality of representation, which is a mind that is consistent with nonconceptual, authentic, and just as it is wisdom,

original: de bzhin nyid la brten te gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la brten te gnas pa'o //
translated: one relies on and abides in reality.

original: yang na rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: yang na rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam pa bdun las rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Alternatively, the reality of representation is one of the seven types of reality.

original: de ni so sor brtag par nus pa'i shes pa la rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ni so sor brtag par nus pa'i shes pa la rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ste /
translated: It is called the reality of representation because it is the object of a consciousness that is capable of analysis.

original: de kho na ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reality itself.

original: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdo sde'i rgyan las /
translated: The Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras states:

original: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality of representation is as follows:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so zhes bshad do //
translated: It is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de ni 'di skad du 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgom pa'i shes pa dang mthun pa'i sems gang yin pa rab tu shes @233a * //🔽par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rig pa tsam du bsgom pa'i shes pa dang mthun pa'i sems gang yin pa rab tu shes @233a * // par 'gyur te /
translated: That is to say, one will understand the mind that is in accord with the knowledge that meditates on mere representation in accordance with reality, just as it is.

original: yul la brten nas gnas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul la brten nas gnas pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi gnas la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind that is based on objects is called skill in the basis of the mind.

original: ji ltar na sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa sems kyi bslang ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: How is one skilled in the arising of the mind? and so on explains the third, skill in the arising of the mind.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the question and answer.

original: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po las bslang bar bya'o zhes rab tu shes pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po las bslang bar bya'o zhes rab tu shes pa 'di lta ste /
translated: One should understand that one should be liberated from the two kinds of bondage, just as they are.

original: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba de dag las sems 'di bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba de dag las sems 'di bslang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la mkhas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second reply.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i sems rab tu shes par gyur nas 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po dag las nges par 'byung bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun par 'gyur ba'i sems rab tu shes par gyur nas 'ching ba rnam pa gnyis po dag las nges par 'byung bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Thus, having understood the mind that is in conformity with nonconceptual intuitive wisdom just as it is, one becomes liberated from the two bonds.

original: yongs su shes pa'i sems de la mkhas par gyur na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i sems de la mkhas par gyur na /
translated: Having become skilled in that mind which is fully understood,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun par gyur pa'i sems kyi 'ching ba gnyis po dag las 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun par gyur pa'i sems kyi 'ching ba gnyis po dag las 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: one becomes liberated from the two bonds of the mind that is in conformity with nonconceptual intuitive wisdom.🔽How is one skilled in the increase of the mind?

original: ji ltar na sems kyi 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa sems kyi 'phel ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa sems kyi 'phel ba la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: This and the rest teaches the explanation of the skill in the increase of the mind, which is the fourth.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught in terms of an analysis and a reply.

original: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the analysis.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the reply:

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba'i gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de 'phel ba dang de bsags par gyur pa'i tshe 'phel bar gyur to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan ma'i 'ching ba dang gnas ngan len gyi 'ching ba'i gnyen po'i sems gang yin pa de 'phel ba dang de bsags par gyur pa'i tshe 'phel bar gyur to //
translated: “The mind that is the antidote to the bondage of signs and the bondage of negative reflex actions, just as it is, increases and accumulates.🔽When it increases and accumulates, one should know that it increases and accumulates.

original: bsags par gyur to zhes rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bsags par gyur to zhes rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is called skill in increase.”🔽“The mind that is the antidote to the two bonds, just as it is, increases and accumulates.🔽When it increases and accumulates, one should know that it increases and accumulates.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'ching ba gnyis kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i sems de 'phel bar gyur pa dang / de bsags par gyur pa'i tshe 'ching ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sems dang mthun par gyur pa'i shes rab la sogs pas rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'ching ba gnyis kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i sems de 'phel bar gyur pa dang / de bsags par gyur pa'i tshe 'ching ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sems dang mthun par gyur pa'i shes rab la sogs pas rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called skill in increase.”

original: de la 'phel ba dang bsags pa la bye brag yod pa yang mngon du spyod pa 'phel bar gyur pa gang yin @233b pa de ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'phel ba dang bsags pa la bye brag yod pa yang mngon du spyod pa 'phel bar gyur pa gang yin @233b pa de ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: There is a difference between increase and accumulation. That which is the increase of manifest action is called increase.

original: yongs su bsgos nas sa bon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bsags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsgos nas sa bon du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bsags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is the seed of complete transformation is called accumulation.

original: yang na 'phel bar gyur pa'i dus gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'phel bar gyur pa'i dus gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, that which is the time of increase is called increase.

original: yang nas yang du bsgos pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni bsags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang nas yang du bsgos pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni bsags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which arises from repeated transformation is called accumulation.

original: ji ltar na sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar na sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: How is one skilled in the decrease of mind? and so on. This teaches the explanation of skill in the decrease of mind.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas bstan to //
translated: This is also taught by stating the investigation and the answer.

original: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the investigation:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
translated: Just as it is, it becomes the opposite.

original: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems de 'grib pa dang 'bri bar gyur pa ni de 'gribs so bri bar gyur to zhes rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa zhes
analyzed: mtshan ma dang gnas ngan len gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems de 'grib pa dang 'bri bar gyur pa ni de 'gribs so bri bar gyur to zhes rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni sems kyi 'grib pa la mkhas pa zhes
translated: The knowledge that the afflicted mind that is afflicted by signs and negative tendencies decreases and diminishes is the knowledge of the decrease of the mind.

original: bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is the second reply.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de dang mi mthun par gyur pa'i 'ching ba gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems 'grib pa dang 'bri bar 'gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du de dang mi mthun par gyur pa'i 'ching ba gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems 'grib pa dang 'bri bar 'gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when the afflicted mind that is afflicted by the two bonds that are incompatible with it decreases and diminishes in accordance with reality,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang 'grib cing /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang 'grib cing /
translated: the view and so on that are concomitant with the afflicted mind also decrease and diminish.

original: 'bri bar 'du shes ba gang yin pa de ni 'grib pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bri bar 'du shes ba gang yin pa de ni 'grib pa la mkhas pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The knowledge that they decrease and diminish is called the knowledge of decrease.

original: 'grib pa dang / 'bri ba la bye brag yod pa yang gong du bstan pa'i 'phel ba dang bsags pa las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'grib pa dang / 'bri ba la bye brag yod pa yang gong du bstan pa'i 'phel ba dang bsags pa las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: The difference between decrease and diminution should be understood as the opposite of the increase and accumulation explained above.🔽How is one skilled in means?

original: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni drug pa thabs mkhas pa'i rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar na thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni drug pa thabs mkhas pa'i rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: This teaches the sixth explanation of skill in means.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas ston to //
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pas ston to //
translated: This is also taught by stating the investigation and the reply.

original: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the investigation:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag sgom pa'am //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dag sgom pa'am //
translated: The correct meditative development of the emancipations, the spheres of mastery and the spheres of totality.

original: yongs su bsal ba rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsal ba rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of complete discernment is the second, the reply.

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu ste /
translated: The correct meditative development of the eight emancipations, the eight spheres of mastery and the ten spheres of totality.

original: rnam pa gnyis @234a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis @234a * //
translated: These two aspects are the benefits of cultivating the immeasurables.

original: po 'di dag bsgoms pa'i phan yon dang / rnam pa gsum po de dag gis sgrib pa yongs su bsal ba rab tu shes pa ni thabs kyis mngon par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs rab tu 'dren par byed pa'i phyir thabs zhes bya'o //🔽yon tan rnams rab tu 'dren par byed pa yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni rnam par thar pa brgyad las /
analyzed: po 'di dag bsgoms pa'i phan yon dang / rnam pa gsum po de dag gis sgrib pa yongs su bsal ba rab tu shes pa ni thabs kyis mngon par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs rab tu 'dren par byed pa'i phyir thabs zhes bya'o // yon tan rnams rab tu 'dren par byed pa yang bstan pa rnams las so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni rnam par thar pa brgyad las /
translated: The knowledge of the removal of obscurations by means of these three aspects is the method of direct knowledge, and it is called the method because it leads to the various qualities such as the absence of defilements.

original: rnam par thar pa lnga pas yon tan rnams 'dren par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa lnga pas yon tan rnams 'dren par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: The leading of the qualities is explained in the teachings, but since the explanations are not consistent, in the Vyakhyayukti, it is said that the fifth liberation leads to the qualities.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon par zhen pa shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir yang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa mngon du byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos de nyid las 'phags pa rnams kyis mngon par zhen pa shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir yang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa mngon du byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: they manifest the liberation of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las ni bshad pa mi mthun pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ste /
translated: The treatise Levels of Yogic Deeds presents three different explanations.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gcig las /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gcig las /
translated: One explanation states:

original: rnam par thar pa dang pos ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang pos ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: The first liberation establishes the bases of subjugation, the bases of totality, and the superknowledges, the absence of affliction, knowledge through prayer, and the correct and discerning awarenesses of the noble ones.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las gzugs kyi zad par gyi skye mched brgyad yongs su dag pa rnams kyis ni 'phags pa'i mos pa dang dngos po yongs su bsgyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las gzugs kyi zad par gyi skye mched brgyad yongs su dag pa rnams kyis ni 'phags pa'i mos pa dang dngos po yongs su bsgyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Through the eight bases of mastery of the totality of form, one accomplishes the supernormal knowledge of transformation of the faithful ārya.

original: zad par rnam par shes pa'i skye mched yongs su dag pas ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa rnams mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zad par rnam par shes pa'i skye mched yongs su dag pas ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa rnams mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Through the pure base of the totality of consciousness, one accomplishes the supernormal knowledge of the absence of conflict, knowledge through prayer, the correct and discerning knowledge and so on.

original: zad par nam mkha'i skye mched yongs su dag pas ni gang 'dod pa de nam mkhar sgyur bar byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zad par nam mkha'i skye mched yongs su dag pas ni gang 'dod pa de nam mkhar sgyur bar byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: Through the pure base of the totality of space, one transforms whatever one wishes into space.🔽Moreover, that same text teaches:

original: gzhan yang de nyid las rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyis mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyis mngon par sgrub par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: The bases of liberation, bases of overpowering, bases of totality and so on are accomplished through supernormal knowledge.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa gtan la dbab pa las kyang gsum @234b po dag mngon par sgrub par byed pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa gtan la dbab pa las kyang gsum @234b po dag mngon par sgrub par byed pa yin par bstan to //
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi ascertains that all three are the means of accomplishing supernatural powers.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las dang po dag ni gdon mi za bar rnam par thar pa dang po kho nar dgongs pas de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las re zhig rnam par thar pa la brten nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las dang po dag ni gdon mi za bar rnam par thar pa dang po kho nar dgongs pas de'i phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las re zhig rnam par thar pa la brten nas /
translated: The Yogācārabhūmi teaches that beginners definitely intend the first liberation, and therefore they first cultivate the first liberation.

original: de'i 'og tu rim gyis zad par gyi skye mched sgom pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yin te /🔽yang dag pa'i don du na gsum po kun gyis kyang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rim gyis zad par gyi skye mched sgom pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yin te / yang dag pa'i don du na gsum po kun gyis kyang /
translated: After that, they gradually accomplish the cultivation of the bases of subjugation.

original: yon tan rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pas /
analyzed: yon tan rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pas /
translated: In reality, all three accomplish good qualities.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa'i bshad pa rnam pa gcig dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsum po kun kyang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa mngon par sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bstan pa'i bshad pa rnam pa gcig dang / mdo 'di nyid las gsum po kun kyang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa mngon par sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore the Yogācārabhūmi Śāstra and the explanation of the sūtra teach that all three accomplish supernatural powers and so on.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag bye brag yod pa yang bstan bcos chos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag bye brag yod pa yang bstan bcos chos bye brag tu bshad pa chen po las /
translated: The Abhidharma-samuccaya-vyākhyā explains that these three have specific differences:

original: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched la bye brag ci yod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / zad par gyi skye mched la bye brag ci yod ce na smras pa /
translated: What is the difference between the bases of subjugation, bases of totality, and bases of liberation?

original: ming dang bye brag yod de 'di ni rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang bye brag yod de 'di ni rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: They are distinguished by name and type.

original: 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: 'di ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched do //
translated: This is a base of subjugation.🔽This is a base of totality.

original: 'di ni zad par gyi skye mched do zhes zer bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni zad par gyi skye mched do zhes zer bas so //
translated: This is a base of liberation.

original: gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, a small root of virtue is called a base of subjugation.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po ni zad par gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po ni zad par gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: A great root of virtue is called a base of totality.

original: gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, a small root of virtue is called a base of liberation.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po gang yin pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po gang yin pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: A great root of virtue is called a base of subjugation.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa gang yin pa de ni zad par gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa gang yin pa de ni zad par gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: The roots of virtue that are immeasurable are called the bases of totality.

original: gzhan yang rgyu gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the cause is called the liberations.

original: 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni zad par gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni zad par gyi skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: The result is called the bases of totality.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces bya'o /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gtogs pa gang yin pa de ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ces bya'o / // / bam po lnga bcu gcig pa /
translated: That which is included in the cause and result is called the bases of mastery.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byams pas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Maitreya Bodhisattva again addressed the Bhagavān, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshor ba thams cad ma lus par 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa la /
translated: “Bhagavān, regarding what the Bhagavān has said, ‘In the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder, all feelings without exception cease,’

original: tshor ba gang dag der gtan du 'gag par 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad @235a * //
analyzed: tshor ba gang dag der gtan du 'gag par 'gyur lags zhes bya ba 'di man chad @235a * //
translated: what are the feelings that cease there forever?”

original: ni bco brgyad pa lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su tshor ba 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: ni bco brgyad pa lhag ma med pa'i dbyings su tshor ba 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: The eighteenth chapter is called “The Gate of the Teaching of the Cessation of Feeling in the Uncompounded Sphere.”

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This chapter is also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba dang / lan du gsungs pas bstan te /
translated: the question and the answer.

original: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhu ba gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The words of the scripture are also divided into two parts:

original: zhu ba gsol ba'i bstan pa smos pa dang / zhu ba de nyid yang dag par gsol ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhu ba gsol ba'i bstan pa smos pa dang / zhu ba de nyid yang dag par gsol ba nyid do //
translated: the statement of the question and the statement of the question itself.

original: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na tshor ba rnam pa gnyis ma lus par 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mdor bsdu na tshor ba rnam pa gnyis ma lus par 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par lan du gsungs pa ston to //
translated: “Son of good family, in brief, the two kinds of feeling will cease without remainder” — from here on is the second part, the answer of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par rnam par bshad pa dang / de'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis spyi'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa bzhin du yang dag par rnam par bshad pa dang / de'i phyir zhes bya ba man chad kyis spyi'i mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the correct explanation according to the question and the summary from “For these reasons” on.

original: rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa la yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The explanation is also divided into two parts:

original: grangs smos nas lan mdor bstan pa dang / brtag pa dang / lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: grangs smos nas lan mdor bstan pa dang / brtag pa dang / lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: a brief indication of the answer by stating the number, and a detailed explanation by way of the analysis and the answer.

original: 'di ni dang po lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po lan mdor gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is the first, the brief indication of the answer.

original: gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa brtag pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa brtag pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher bshad pa ston to //
translated: The second, the detailed explanation by way of the analysis and the answer, is shown by “What are the two?” and so forth.

original: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang brtag pa dang lan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is also stated by way of the analysis and the answer.

original: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtag pa'o //
translated: This is the analysis.

original: gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rig pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: The knowledge of the negative tendencies and the knowledge of the object that is the result of that” and so forth show the detailed explanation.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two parts:

original: tshor ba rnams yang dag par bstan pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas ba zhes bya ba man chad kyis gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba rnams yang dag par bstan pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas ba zhes bya ba man chad kyis gtan du 'gag par 'gyur ba bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the feelings and the teaching of the cessation that is permanent, from “together with the remainder” and so forth.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first is also of two types:

original: tshor ba rnam pa gnyis kyis lan mdor gsungs pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa gnyis kyis lan mdor gsungs pa dang / go rims bzhin du rnam par phye nas bshad pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: The answer is given in brief by means of two feelings, and then in detail by means of the feelings.

original: tshor ba gnyis kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: tshor ba gnyis kyi bye brag gi mtshan nyid kyis so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: The answer is given in brief by means of two feelings, and then in detail by means of the feelings.

original: kha gcig na re gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha gcig na re gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say that the knowledge of the abode of the abode of impurity is as follows:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i ro myang ba dbang po drug po dag la brten nas byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i ro myang ba dbang po drug po dag la brten nas byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which arises in dependence on the six sense faculties, and which is the enjoyment of what is impure.

original: dbang po las ming thob pas na gnas zhes ming brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las ming thob pas na gnas zhes ming brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is called the abode because it obtains its name from the sense faculties.

original: sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gyi gnas ngan len gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir @235b gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gyi gnas ngan len gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir @235b gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the knowledge of the abode of the abode of impurity because it is the abode of the seeds of the two obscurations.

original: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge of the object which is its result is as follows:

original: phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag ni nang gi dbang po drug gi mthu las skyes pa'i phyir yul drug bo dag la de'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag ni nang gi dbang po drug gi mthu las skyes pa'i phyir yul drug bo dag la de'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The six external sense-fields are called the effect of the six internal sense-fields because they arise from the power of the six internal sense-fields.

original: yul rig pa de yang de dag la dmigs nas skyes pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yul rig pa de yang de dag la dmigs nas skyes pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness of the sense-fields is called the effect of the six sense-fields because it arises in dependence on the six sense-fields as its object.

original: yang dag pa'i don du na tshor ba gnyi ga yang bdag nyid bye brag tu gyur pa med kyang dbang po dang yul gyi rjes su don gyi tshor ba gnyis su bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du na tshor ba gnyi ga yang bdag nyid bye brag tu gyur pa med kyang dbang po dang yul gyi rjes su don gyi tshor ba gnyis su bstan pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: In reality, both feelings are not distinguished by themselves, but the two feelings are taught in terms of the object that follows the sense-faculty and the object.

original: kha cig na re gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say that the consciousness of the abode of the abode of the negative tendencies is as follows:

original: sa bon gyi myong ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi myong ba'o //
translated: It is the experience of the seeds.

original: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The consciousness of the object that is its effect is as follows:

original: mngon du spyod pa myong ba'o //
analyzed: mngon du spyod pa myong ba'o //
translated: It is the experience of manifest activity.

original: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon ni da ltar gyi 'bras bu'i rten byas pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i sa bon ni da ltar gyi 'bras bu'i rten byas pas so //
translated: Thus, the seeds of the contaminated are the basis of the effect of the present.

original: yang na sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gnas ngan len rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gnas ngan len rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or else, it is called the knowledge of the abode of the negative reflex action of the seeds of the two obscurations because it is the subsequent pursuit of the negative reflex action of the seeds of the two obscurations.

original: mngon du spyod pa myong ba gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi myong ba las byung ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: mngon du spyod pa myong ba gang yin pa de ni sa bon gyi myong ba las byung ba'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba gsungs so zhe'o //
translated: The experience of manifest activity is called the knowledge of the object because it arises from the experience of the seeds.

original: kha cig na re de la gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi dbang po drug la brten nas nang gi rgyud kyi dbang po drug dang yul la dmigs pa zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni rten dbang po dang
analyzed: kha cig na re de la gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi dbang po drug la brten nas nang gi rgyud kyi dbang po drug dang yul la dmigs pa zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni rten dbang po dang
translated: Some say: The knowledge of the abode of the negative reflex action of the abode refers to that which is contaminated, the focus on the six sense faculties and their objects in the mental continuum that is based on the six internal sense faculties.

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i chos las ming du btags pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i chos las ming du btags pa yin te /
translated: It is designated by the name of its basis, the sense faculties,🔽and its subsequent attributes.

original: 'di ltar dbang po drug la brten pas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po drug la brten pas sam /
translated: Thus, it is based on the six sense faculties.

original: yang na sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gyi gnas ngan len rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na sgrib pa gnyis kyi sa bon gyi gnas ngan len rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is the subsequent pursuit of the negative reflex action of the seeds of the two obscurations.

original: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of that is called “the consciousness of objects.”

original: phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag dbang po drug po dag gi dbang gis 'bras bur gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag dbang po drug po dag gi dbang gis 'bras bur gyur pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The six external objects are the result of the six sense faculties.🔽Therefore, the treatise Compendium of Abhidharma states:

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang mig la sogs pa'i dbang pa dag yongs su longs spyod pa'i mthu'i phyir dbang po drug skyes par gyur te zhes bshad pas tshor ba gnyis po 'di ni nang gi dbang po drug la
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa las kyang mig la sogs pa'i dbang pa dag yongs su longs spyod pa'i mthu'i phyir dbang po drug skyes par gyur te zhes bshad pas tshor ba gnyis po 'di ni nang gi dbang po drug la
translated: The six sense faculties are produced for the purpose of experiencing objects.

original: brten nas phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag la dmigs par byed pas yul las ming thob pa yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes gsungs te //🔽dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis las ni rang gi ngo bo @236a * //
analyzed: brten nas phyi rol gyi yul drug po dag la dmigs par byed pas yul las ming thob pa yin pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa zhes gsungs te // dmigs pa rnam pa gnyis las ni rang gi ngo bo @236a * //
translated: Since these two feelings are based on the six internal sense faculties and focus on the six external objects, they are called the consciousness of objects because they obtain their names from their objects.

original: nyid kyi myong ba dang yul gyi myong ba yin no zhes zer te //
analyzed: nyid kyi myong ba dang yul gyi myong ba yin no zhes zer te //
translated: From the two types of focal objects, there is the experience of its own nature and the experience of objects.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad ba yod kyang 'dir ni re zhig gsum pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad ba yod kyang 'dir ni re zhig gsum pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Although there are three such explanations, here we are concerned with the third.

original: de la gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: de la gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa ni rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: The explanation of the second, the knowledge of the negative tendencies of the realms, is taught from “This should be known as fourfold” onward.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two:

original: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa rnam par bshad pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi gnas ngan len rig pa rnam par bshad pa dang / de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: the explanation of the knowledge of the negative tendencies of the realms and the explanation of the knowledge of the object that is the result of that.

original: dang po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dang po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The first is also threefold:

original: grangs smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / gang go dka' ba bzlas te bshad pa ste /
analyzed: grangs smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / gang go dka' ba bzlas te bshad pa ste /
translated: the enumeration, the listing of the names according to the enumeration, and the repetition of the difficult points.

original: 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa dang / 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa dang / 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: the realm of the form-possessing, the realm of the formless, the negative reflex which is the result of the realm of the form-possessing, and the negative reflex which is the result of the realm of the formless.

original: tshor ba bzhi po 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: tshor ba bzhi po 'di yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gsum yod de /
translated: These four feelings are also explained differently by each of the masters.

original: de la slob dpon dang po'i bshad ba ni slob dpon gsum pa'i bshad pa dang mthun pas de'i phyir logs shig tu ma smos so //
analyzed: de la slob dpon dang po'i bshad ba ni slob dpon gsum pa'i bshad pa dang mthun pas de'i phyir logs shig tu ma smos so //
translated: The explanation of the first master is the same as that of the third master, and therefore it is not mentioned separately.

original: slob dpon gnyis pas ni 'di skad du gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gnyis pas ni 'di skad du gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second master explains it as follows: The realm of the form-possessing is

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi tshor ba'i sa bon gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi tshor ba'i sa bon gang yin pa'o //
translated: the seed of feeling in the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The realm of the formless is

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi tshor ba'i sa bon gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi tshor ba'i sa bon gang yin pa'o //
translated: the seed of feeling in the formless realm.

original: 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge of the impurity of the result that has been produced is as follows:

original: da ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa'i sa bon gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar 'bras bu 'byin pa'i sa bon gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the seed that now produces the result.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge of the impurity of the result that has not been produced is as follows:

original: da dung 'bras bu ma byin pa'i sa bon gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: da dung 'bras bu ma byin pa'i sa bon gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: it is the seed that has not yet produced the result.

original: kha cig na re gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzugs can gyi gnas rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say: The knowledge of the realm with form is as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the feeling that is concomitant with the five collections of consciousness.

original: gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i gnas rig pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge of the formless realm is as follows:

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the feeling that is concomitant with mental consciousness.

original: 'di dag ni lus dang sems kyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni lus dang sems kyi tshor ba'o //
translated: These are the feelings of body and mind.

original: 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas @236b ngan len rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa'i gnas @236b ngan len rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The knowledge of the impurity of the result that has been produced is as follows:

original: 'das pa'i ma rig pa dang / 'du byed la sogs pas bskyed pa da ltar gyi 'bras bu myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i ma rig pa dang / 'du byed la sogs pas bskyed pa da ltar gyi 'bras bu myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the experience of the present result generated by the ignorance and formations of the past.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽las dang po pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu 'gog par byed /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i gnas ngan len rig pa ni 'di lta ste / las dang po pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu 'gog par byed /
translated: The latent impressions of the result that has not yet come into existence are as follows:🔽The beginner stops the cause of the future feeling that is concomitant with the afflictions.

original: pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa'o zhes zer te /
translated: This is the latent impression of the result that has not yet come into existence.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang gsum pa ni yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum du bshad pa yod kyang gsum pa ni yang dag pa yin te /
translated: Although there are explanations of three types, the third is correct.

original: tshig dang don gyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig dang don gyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it accords with the words and their meaning.

original: de la 'bras bu grub pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu grub pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The latent impressions of the result that has come into existence are as follows:

original: da ltar gyi myong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi myong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the experience of the present.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The latent impressions of the result that has not yet come into existence are as follows:🔽It is the experience that becomes the cause of the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i myong ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gang go dka' ba bzlas te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i myong ba gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa gang go dka' ba bzlas te bshad pa'o //
translated: This is a repetition of the third explanation that was difficult to understand.

original: 'di ltar dang po gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi las kyis thob pa da ltar gyi 'bras bu myong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po gang yin pa de ni sngon gyi las kyis thob pa da ltar gyi 'bras bu myong ba'o //
translated: Thus, the first is the experience of the present result obtained from previous karma.

original: phyi ma ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par grub pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong ba ste /
analyzed: phyi ma ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa mngon par grub pa las dang nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i myong ba ste /
translated: The second is the experience of the future result that is established from karma and affliction that are concomitant with the future result.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu'i tshor ba'o //
translated: It is the feeling of the future cause and the future result.

original: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa yang rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa yang rnam pa bzhi yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa de'i 'bras bu yul rig pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: The four types of cognition of objects that are its results, etc., explain the second, the cognition of objects that are its results.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This also has two types:

original: grangs smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: grangs smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa ste 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: the enumeration of the number and the arrangement of the names according to the number. The first is the enumeration of the number.

original: gnas rig pa dang / yo byad rig pa dang / longs spyod rig pa dang / ltos pa rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas rig pa dang / yo byad rig pa dang / longs spyod rig pa dang / ltos pa rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the basis, the cognition of requisites, the cognition of enjoyment, and the cognition of dependence are the second, the arrangement of the names according to the number.

original: tshor ba bzhi po de dag kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: tshor ba bzhi po de dag kyang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: These four feelings are explained differently.

original: kha cig na re tshor ba bzhi po 'di dag ni mngon du spyod pa dag yin te //
analyzed: kha cig na re tshor ba bzhi po 'di dag ni mngon du spyod pa dag yin te //
translated: Some say: These four feelings are manifest feelings.

original: de dag bye brag yod pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag bye brag yod pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of specific feelings.

original: dang po gnas rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po gnas rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is the feeling that knows the abode,

original: snod kyi 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: which is feeling that focuses on the physical cosmos.

original: gnyis pa yo byad rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa yo byad rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the feeling that knows the necessities,

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: which is feeling that focuses on the necessities of life.

original: gsum pa longs spyod pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: gsum pa longs spyod pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste //
translated: The third is the feeling that knows enjoyment,

original: gos dang zas la sogs pa mngon sum du longs spyod pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gos dang zas la sogs pa mngon sum du longs spyod pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: which is feeling that directly enjoys clothing, food and so on.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni da ltar gyi yul la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni da ltar gyi yul la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: These three are feelings that focus on present objects.

original: bzhi pa ltos pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽'das pa'i yul @237a * //
analyzed: bzhi pa ltos pa'i rig pa ni 'di lta ste / 'das pa'i yul @237a * //
translated: The fourth is the feeling that knows dependence,🔽which is feeling that arises from focusing on the three former objects in the past.

original: snga ma gsum po dag la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: snga ma gsum po dag la dmigs pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: The first is the feeling that knows the abode,🔽which is feeling that focuses on the physical cosmos.🔽The second is the feeling that knows the necessities,🔽which is feeling that focuses on the necessities of life.🔽The third is the feeling that knows enjoyment,🔽which is feeling that directly enjoys clothing, food and so on.🔽These three are feelings that focus on present objects.🔽The fourth is the feeling that knows dependence,🔽which is feeling that arises from focusing on the three former objects in the past.

original: kha cig na re gnas rig pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //🔽yo byad rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re gnas rig pa ni snod kyi 'jig rten la dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o // yo byad rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say: Knowledge of place is the feeling that has the physical world for its object.

original: gos dang sman la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gos dang sman la sogs pa'i dmigs pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: Knowledge of goods is the feeling that has clothing, medicine, etc. for its object.

original: longs spyod rig pa ni gnas dang yo byad gnyis kyi tshor ba bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rig pa ni gnas dang yo byad gnyis kyi tshor ba bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of enjoyment is the feeling that includes the two, place and goods.

original: ltos pa rig pa ni tshor ba dang rdzas la lta ba'i tshor ba'o zhe'o //
analyzed: ltos pa rig pa ni tshor ba dang rdzas la lta ba'i tshor ba'o zhe'o //
translated: Knowledge of dependence is the feeling that views feeling and substance.
